She works at the "Dehkon" market, where she leases a retail stand and sell flat bread (national bread).  She has been involved in this business for over 10 years.  She is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Byambahuu

texts.en:
Byambahuu T. is 54 years old and lives with her husband and and daughter in their own house and fence in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her older two children both live on their own while her youngest daughter attends university. 

Byambahuu sells women’s handbags in the largest Ulaanbaatar market, Narantuul. She began her business in 1995 and since has built a stable and successful operation. Most of her siblings and relatives have also operated a variety of bag-selling business. She purchases bags from China. 

Today her working capital is 2,500,000 MNT and her daily average sales income is between 50,000 and 80,000 MNT. Byambahuu is a clever and hard-working businesswoman and says, " Now I am planning to buy a car for my daughter." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more quality and well designed leather handbags from Beijing, the capital city of China.

loans.use: To purchase more good quality and well designed leather handbags

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia R., 42 years old, is from the town of Trinidad. She is married and has three children aged 14, 7 and 6. Alicia's business, a sari-sari (general) store, sells various products including sardines, sugar and cigarettes. She has been running the store for more than two years now and earns approximately PHP 3000 every month. Alicia works hard to earn more and be better able to sustain her family's needs, especially her children's education.

Alicia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carminda

texts.es:
la señora Carminda García R. tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos.
Carminda se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado y accesorios para damas y caballeros.
Carminda se levanta muy temprano todos los dias de lunes a domingo para abrir su negocio y atender a sus clientes, les ofrece sandalias para hombre y mujer ropà para caballeros, damas, zapatos, gorras, adornos,
utencilios de cocina, ventiladores.
su negocio esta ubicado en la calle principal del mercado nuevo de San Lorenzo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para tener bien surtido su negocio.
su sueño es construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Carminda García R. is 45 years old.  She is a single mother and has three children.

Carminda sells clothes, footwear, and men's and women's accessories.

Carminda gets up very early every day, from Monday to Sunday, to open her business and serve her customers.  She offers them men's and women's sandals, men's and women's clothes, shoes, caps, decorations, cooking utensils and fans.  Her business is located in the main street of the 'Mercado Nuevo' (New Market) in San Lorenzo.

Carminda will use her loan to buy merchandise to better stock her business.  Her dream is to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, shoes, purses, glue, hooks, bracelets, talcum powder, deodorants, creams, lotions, and perfumes

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 58 years old and married with two children between the ages 17 and 26. Angelique runs a butcher business, where she sells beef to the local community. She has a shop where she employs three people to help her run the business.

Angelique will use the loan to purchase two cows, with the aim of expanding her business. With this loan, she hopes to earn more profits which will be used to continue paying school fees for her three relatives, as well as build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia belongs to Jaranwala, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family for 14 years. She has given birth to four daughters and a son. All of them are very young and stay at home. Razia is not in a position to enroll them in school due to financial constraints. 

Her husband’s name is M. S. and he operates a vegetable selling business.
 
To financially assist her husband, Razia weaves carpets on order. She is very good at her art and her carpets sell for a very good price. She also sells clothes to her neighboring clients to supplement the income of her family. Besides doing her businesses, she also manages her household work very well. 
 
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes selling business. With the loan, she will purchase clothes from the city of Lahore in bulk to minimize the cost of traveling and to increase her profits by offering more variety to her clients.
 
She has been operating this business for the past five years and is very confident about its growth as a result of a loan investment. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Serafín

texts.es:
El sr. Serafín  está casado con la sra. Amelia Bogado, tienen 6 hijas, 5 mayores y una en edad escolar, se dedica a la carpintería y fabricación de muebles rústicos, este oficio lo aprendió en una empresa grande que se dedica al mismo rubro, pero ahora tiene su negocio en su domicilio.
El crédito será de gran ayuda para la compra de más madera, ya que tiene mucha cantidad de pedidos.
Don S. desea comprar un vehículo y transportar en él su mercadería.
texts.en:
Serafín is married to Mrs. Amelia Bogado.  They have six daughters, five adults and one who is school age.   He is a carpenter and makes rustic furniture.  He leaned this skill while working at a large firm engaged in the same line of work.  Now, however, he has his business at home.

The loan will be of great help to buy more lumber because he has quite a few pending orders.

Mr. S. wants to buy a vehicle to transport his merchandise.

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: El señor José Francisco,  tiene la edad de 64 años , habita la comarca lomas del Gavilán ubicado en Masaya en lo que corresponde a la zona Rural; junto a su esposa que es ama de casa y  sus tres hijos ya todos independientes y laboran en diversas actividades lo cual le permite que le apoyen  los fines de semana en el cultivo de  yuca ,   don S. desde hace 45 años  trabaja en sus tierras como pequeño agricultor  trabajando  cultivo de yuca que es su fuerte demanda y granos básico . Por la situación económica, pérdidas de cosechas y otros factores que le afectan no ha logrado comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para tener una buena producción y poder vender a un mejor precio; pero para esto poder realizarse necesita de un financiamiento agrícola para poder inducir todas las plantas. El mayor sueño de don José es poder establecer barreras vivas en el perímetro de la finca.
texts.en: José Francisco is 64 years old.  He lives in the Lomas del Gavilán region, located in a rural area of Masaya department.  He lives with his wife, who is a housewife, and his three children, who are all already independent and work in various occupations which allow them to help him on the weekends growing yucca.  For the last 45 years, Mr. S. has worked on his land as a small farmer growing yucca, which is in high demand and is a basic staple.  Due to the economic situation, lost crops, and other factors affecting him, he has not been able to buy fertilizer and supplies necessary in order to have a good harvest and to be able to sell at a better price.  In order to do this, he needs an agricultural loan in order to be able to fertilize all his plants.  José's greatest dream is to be able to establish hedgerows around the perimeter of his farm.

loans.use: Fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Joseph Njoroge

texts.en:
Joseph Njoroge K. buys and sells firewood in Limuru town. He has been in this business for the last seven years, and earns an income of KES. 40,000 per month. He 27 years old, married to Ruth, and they have one child.  

He has never borrowed from any other MFI, and he learned about KADET from a member of a group registered with KADET. He is applying for a third loan from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to buy a power saw for cutting firewood.        

Joseph intends to save the anticipated profits to set up a business premise and provide the best living standard for his family.

loans.use: To buy a power saw for cutting firewood.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
El Señor Luciano es cliente recurrente de nuestra Institución, está casado con la señora Graciela Acosta, son padres de dos hijos, cuentan con casa propia ubicada en el Barrio Remansito de Ciudad del Este.
El Sr. Luciano es de profesión albañil, constructor de todo tipo de obras, mientras que la Sra. Graciela es ama de casa.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya la esperanza de obtener una ayuda crediticia, ya que se consideran personas honestas y con un espíritu de lucha en la labor diaria.
El desea invertir el crédito en gastos particulares, pues ahora mismo sólo con esta ayuda podrían obtener un nivel de vida digna, se compromete así mismo a pagar las cuotas de manera puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Luciano is a returning client of our institution.  He is married to Graciela Acosta, and they are the parents of 2 children.  They have their own home located in the Remansito neighborhood of Ciudad del Este.

Luciano works as a bricklayer and he does all types of construction, while Graciela is a housewife.

He appreciates the Fundación Paraguaya for the financial support that they provide, since they are considered to be honest people who have a fighting spirit in their daily work.

He wants to use this loan for private expenditures.   Now, only with this help, will he be able to obtain a decent standard of living.  He pledges to make his loan payments in a responsible and punctual manner.

loans.use: private expenses

loans.name: Yeson-Erdene

texts.en:
Yeson-Erdene is a married woman, age 39, who lives with her husband and two children in a house in Tuv province, Mongolia. Her husband is a herdsman with a total of 70 husbandry animals. Her two children, ages 4 and 6, both attend kindergarten. She operates a grocery store in her town. 

At first she used to rent a small booth where she sold a variety of grocery items. She started her grocery trading business in 2000. With 11 years of business experience, she has managed to expand her business into a medium-sized grocery store. Her business success is due to the good location of her store which is placed between residential apartments and schools. She is a diligent woman who wants to expand her grocery store into a supermarket. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery items for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items.

loans.name: Bernaliza

texts.en:
Bernaliza L. is 23 years old and married to Bryan, a contractual worker. She is a college graduate and decided to run a micro-enterprise. She is a resident of Bancal, Carmona, Cavite City, Philippines. 

Bernaliza has operated their own internet cafe for two years now.  She rents out computer units at a low charge per hour to all surfers, social networkers and even to students who would like to do their research on the Internet.  She also offers printing job, encoding, scanning and photo printing. With this business, Bernaliza earns an estimated net income of around 350 PHP a day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to pay for the cost of upgrading hardware and computer programs to compete with other neighboring Internet cafes. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for upgrading computer programs and hardware.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is from the village of Burgos, Oroquieta City, Philippines. He is 61 years old, married and has eight adult children. Felipe runs a fish selling business.

He has been engaged in his business for 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. Felipe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities.

Felipe is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP with which he will purchase more fish to sell. This will be his second loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, tiene 25 años, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, Pablo de 50 años y Nieves de 49 años. Junto viven en la localidad de Alto Yapaz (selva central peruana). Cuidar adecuadamente sus chacras es su principal función, desde hace 12 años le gusta ver como se desarrollan las plantaciones de plátanos, café, frutas cítricas, entre otros productos oriundos de esta zona. Aunque le incomoda tener que limpiarlos a menudo pues no le gusta machetear ni retirar la maleza, ya que asegura que estando a diario con esta actividad sus brazos le duelen, por eso prefiere plantar, fertilizar y cosechar. Por otro lado, pone en práctica las técnicas agrícolas que le enseñó su padre. En adelante desea continuar plantando más café y plátano, productos muy solicitados por los mercados, además de construir su propia casa, para instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles, donde pueda atender su futura esposa. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los progresistas”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde comenta que desde un principio trabaja de manera activa en su banco comunal, junto a los integrantes. Juan, con el crédito, podrá comprar plantas de café y varios sacos de abono para fertilizar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Juan is 25 years old, single, and lives in his parents' home.  His parents are 50 year-old Pablo and 49 year-old Nieves.  They live together in the town of Alto Yapaz (in the central Peruvian jungle).  Juan's main job is to properly care for his plantations.  He has been in this business for 12 years and he enjoys watching his plantations of bananas, coffee, citrus fruit and other native products grow.  It is difficult having to weed his plantations often.  He doesn't like cutting or pulling weeds because he says that his arms ache from carrying out this work every day.  For this reason, he prefers planting, fertilizing and harvesting.  He puts into practice the techniques that his father taught him.

In the future, Juan would like to continue planting more coffee and bananas as these are products that are very much in demand in the market.  He would also like to build his own home and set up a grocery store where his future wife can work.

Juan is a member of the "Los Progresistas" community bank and this is his third loan from MFP.  He says that he has worked as an active member of his group since he joined.  Juan will use his loan to buy coffee plants and several sacks of fertilizer to fertilize his crops.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina es una clienta de 26 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa familiar con sus padres y su hermana mayor, en l el caserío Palominos ubicado en el  distrito de Tambogrande – Piura, en una pequeña comunidad rural que no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. 

Georgina tiene 4 años de experiencia en el negocio de comida marina que tiene en su propio domicilio, en el cual atiende los fines de semana y cuenta con clientela establecida que esta satisfecha con sus platos y servicios. Ella recibe el apoyo de su hermana mayor para realizar esta actividad. Sus padres cuentan son agricultores y Georgina también los ayuda en sus labores cuando no está atendiendo a sus clientes. Existe una buena relación familiar. 

Georgina solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para hacer mejoras en su negocio y para comprar cervezas directamente desde el carro repartidor que las vende a precios más asequibles. Es muy popular en el Perú negocios como los de Georgina que son llamados picanterías, y en estos se venden principalmente ceviches y cervezas. 

Este crédito será de gran utilidad para Georgina, quien tiene deseos de ampliar su negocio y así poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.

Georgina cuenta con un buen expediente de pagos, ya ha trabajado con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Georgina is a 26 year-old client.  She is single and lives in her family home with her parents and her older sister.  They live in the small village of Palominos which is in Tambogrande - Piura district.  This is a small, rural community that does not have all the basic services.

Georgina has four years experience in cooking seafood.  Her business is located in her own home and she works there on weekends.  She has  established customers who are satisfied with her dishes and her service.  She receives support from her older sister in her business.  Georgina's parents are farmers and she also helps them with their work when she is not serving customers.  They have a good family relationship.

Georgina is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can make some improvements to her business and also buy beer directly from the delivery truck which offers more affordable prices.  Businesses such as Georgina's are called 'picanterías' and they are very popular in Peru.  They mainly sell 'ceviches' (pieces of raw fish marinated in citrus juice, served with sliced onions and chilis) and beer.

This loan will be really useful to Georgina as she has a desire to expand her business and thereby improve her own quality of life as well as that of her family.

Georgina has a good credit history as she has already worked with our institution.

loans.use: to improve her business and buy beer

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 46 years old and widowed with two children.

Susana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Susana has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Susana aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Siméon

texts.fr: Siméon  est commercant, client d’ACB depuis 2007. Il est marie  âge de 31 ans.il a deux enfants entre 4 ans et 6 ans, un enfant va à l’école et son petit frère qui est dans son charge.  Il est né au  Rwanda. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB et il a eu bon historique de remboursement. Il va acheter les matériels de construction utiliser  pour le finissage d'une maison de location. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire  est de rembourser le crédit à temps et utiliser des matériels modernes pour que sa maison ait la valeur plus haute. Ses ambitions pour l’avenir est de construire d’autre maison de location et payer le frais de minerval pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Siméon is a businessman and has been a client of ACB since 2007. He is married, 31 years old, and has two children aged four and six. One child goes to school and Siméon also cares for his younger brother. Siméon was born in Rwanda. This is his second loan with ACB and he has a good history of repayment. He wants to use this loan to buy construction materials to put the finishing touches on his house. His strategy to grow his business is to reimburse the loan on time and use modern materials so that his house will be as valuable as possible. His ambition for the future is to build another house to rent out and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: Il va acheter les matériels de construction utiliser  pour le finissage d'une maison de location

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth tiene 38 años, es una mujer cordial y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Nelson de 49 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 02 hijos, a quienes les brinda una educación justa. Ruth es una mujer responsable tanto en su trabajo como en su hogar, por ello se despierta  muy temprano para dirigirse a su puesto y abrir las puertas de su tienda en espera de sus primeros consumidores. Desde sus 30 años viene dedicándose en la de venta de productos de primera necesidad, tales como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, detergentes y entre otros. Se siente muy contenta con la actividad que realiza, por que gracias a ello pudo comprar su propio lote de terreno y con ello también sustenta los gastos de educación de sus queridos hijos. Su  puesto de ventas se sitúa en la zona céntrica de la ciudad de Quimbiri donde ella les brinda una atención adecuada. Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado, comprará mayor cantidad de víveres y así implementar su bodega con productos. Este será su séptimo crédito y ya se siente contento al saber que en esta oportunidad también contará con el apoyo financiero para llevar consigo  su propósito, además se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente como solía hacer en los anteriores créditos. Con el monto requerido adquirirá mercadería de primera necesidad como: arroz, aceite, pasta dental, leche,  y detergentes.
texts.en:
Ruth, 38, is a courteous, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Nelson, 49.  They have two children that she provides a proper education for.  Ruth is a responsible woman both at work and in her home.  Because of this, she rises very early to take her position and open up the doors of her store awaiting her first customers of the day.  She’s been selling groceries like sacks of rice, sugar, noodles, milk and detergents, among others, since she was 30 years old.  She feels very happy with the work she does because thanks to it she was able to buy her own plot of land and she can also pay for her beloved children’s education.

Her sales stand is located in the central part of the city of Quimbiri where she provides adequate attention.  With support from the loan she will buy larger amounts of foodstuffs to stock her store with merchandise.

This will be her 7th loan and she feels happy to know that on this occasion she will once again have financial support to reach her goal.  In addition, she commits to make her installment payments punctually like she tended to do in previous loans.  She will use the requested amount to buy basic need merchandise like: rice, oil, toothpaste, milk and detergents.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, milk, toothpaste and detergents.

loans.name: Margielynne

texts.en:
At 33, Margielynne is married and has two children. She and her husband are farmers. They have been farming rice for 10 years now. 

She earns an average net income of 16,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every season during the months of April and November. Income generated from farming goes for school fees and basic needs at home. 

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay for labor and to purchase hybrid seeds for rice farming. 

In the future, Margielynne hopes to harvest consistent profits for her family's economic stability.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to purchase hybrid seeds for rice farming.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a responsible and loving mother who is always thinking of the well-being and security of her three children. She is dedicated to raising pigs. Her husband is unemployed and pig breeding is the only one source of income for her family. 

Gloria has two years of experience in the pig breeding business. She usually purchases piglets, then fattens them and resells them in the local market. Her monthly income is about PHP 1,500. Gloria's hope is to purchase more animals, to expand her business. To reach this goal, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.

loans.use: to feed and provide vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hadijja's Group

texts.en:
Hadijja’s group is comprised of three hard-working women. Hadijja is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. For the past three years, Hadijja has had a business selling food.         

To help expand her business, Hadijja has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hadijja hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Hadijja hopes to expand her business. Hadijja is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale

loans.name: Rubenia Dolores

texts.es: Rubenia Dolores de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad vive con su compañero de vida en casa propia. Ella posee un puesto de frutas en un lugar estratégico cerca de un hospital tiene mucha clientela pues el lugar es bastante concurrido por las personas, su fruta es conocida en el lugar pues siempre está fresca, es muy higiénica la venta, tiene precio accesible y el servicio es excelente;  Rubenia es una mujer decidida y con ganas de salir adelante el secreto en su trabajo es la constancia y satisfacer al cliente, piensa que solo así se puede llegar al éxito, es con ese pensamiento que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar sandia, piña, jocotes, fresas, mangos, guayabas entre otros. Rubenia Dolores tiene confianza que de esta forma logrará llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Rubenia Dolores, 54, lives with her life partner in her own house. She has a fruit stand in a strategic place near a hospital and has many customers because the street is very busy. She is well known in the area because her fruit is always fresh and clean, her prices are reasonable and the service is excellent.

Rubenia is a determined woman who wants to get ahead. The secret of her work is the loyalty and satisfaction of her customers. She believes that is the only way she can succeed. With that thought in mind, she decided to request a loan from Integral that allows her to buy watermelon, pineapple, coconuts, strawberries, mangos and guavas, among other items.  Rubenia Dolores is confident that in this way she can insure that her household has financial security.

loans.use: to buy watermelon, pineapple, coconut, strawberries, mangos and guavas.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.
 
Brenda has a food cart that cooks & sells street foods like kikiam, fishballs & tempura. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients like tempura & kikiam for sale.

Brenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Brenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like tempura & kikiam for sale

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene tiene 51 años, convive con su pareja y fruto de ello tienen tres hijos, Carlos, Lerner e Iris de 06, 05 y 03 años respectivamente. Juntos habitan en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en al localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tienen su casa propia. Ella empezó su aventura como carpintera, desde muy niña aprendio esta labor al observar a padre. Su pasión por el oficio la llevó a adquirir sus propias herramientas de trabajo, para pulir la madera. Tiene 22 años realizando esta actividad en compañía de su esposo. Por otro lado, también es realiza estos trabajos para colegios, instituciones y municipalidades de su zona, elaborando mesas, sillas, andamios, roperos, escritorios, entre otros. Cuenta con 03 ayudantes, quienes se encargan de terminar con el trabajo; se siente muy comprometido con su labor, su lema es la "puntualidad en la entrega del trabajo" que se le encomiendan, es por ello que cuenta con mayor clientela. Sin embargo, no le agrada absorber los polvillos de la madera, y por tal razón hace sus tratamientos médicos cada cierto tiempo en las postas medicas. Su inconveniente es no contar con suficiente capital para poder comprar más madera, por tanto recurre a MFP, para que le facilite su 15avo crédito, para que pueda comprar bloques de madera que le serán de gran utilidad para seguir prestando servicios a su comunidad.
texts.en:
Irene is 51, and lives with her life partner. They have three children: Carlos, Lerner and Iris, who are six, five and three respectively. They live together in the beautiful tropical forest of Ayacucho, in the town of Santa Rosa, where they have their own house.  She began her career as a carpenter from a very young age, learning this work by watching her father. Her passion for the trade led her to acquire her own tools for finishing wood. 

She has been doing this work for 22 years, alongside her husband.  Furthermore, she carries out work for schools, institutions and municipalities in her area; making tables, chairs, scaffolding, closets, desks, and other things.

She has three helpers, who are responsible for finishing off the job. She feels very committed to her work. Her motto for the jobs entrusted to her is "deliver the work on time." That's why she has more customers. However, she doesn't like inhaling the sawdust from the wood, and for this reason, she receives medical treatments in the health clinics from time to time.  

Her problem is not having enough capital to be able to buy more wood. Therefore, she is turning to MFP for her 15th loan, so that she can buy pieces of  wood that will be of great use to her in continuing to provide services to her community.

loans.use: To buy pieces of wood for carpentry.

loans.name: Kampala One Group

texts.en:
Paulo, who is in his late 40s, is married and has six children. Four of them are still going to school and two of them are grown and on their own. He also takes care of his mother. He works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his first motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and he wants to use it for buying more maize grains, grinding them and selling flour. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania, given in the middle of the main loan, that motivates borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their loans smoothly to receive half the amount of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kampala One," which has 10 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more maize grains, grind them and sell flour.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 36 years old.  He is married and has five children aged between 1 month and 15 years old.  Celestin owns a motorcycle business and also sells products such as coffee, beans, potatoes etc. This is his tenth successful year in this business and he currently employs one person to help him. The hours of his business are from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day. 

Celestin has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his motorcycle business and to purchase more coffee, beans, potatoes, etc. for sale. Celestin hopes to earn more profit. With any profit, he will be able to build a secure future for his business as well as for his family and he will be able to buy other motorcycles to help him in his businesses.

loans.use: expand his motorcycle business and buy more coffee, beans etc. to sell

loans.name: Sophary

texts.en:
Sophary is a 31 year-old mother of two children.  Her oldest son is six years old and he attends school.  Her four year old daughter is too young to go to school. 

Sophary has been farming for several years to support her family.  She also plants cassava to raise additional income.  

Sophary hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income to feed her family, set aside some money for the future and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to cultivate rice paddy and plant cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizer (N.P.K. and Urea) for farming and pay the cost of labour.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, sigue con su negocio de venta de productos plasticos y la venta de ropa, el cual vende por encargo y al detalle, los cuales los compra al proveedor en una fabrica, dando a mejor precio, y siendo de buena calidad, y de duracion al ser plastico.
Su esposo sigue con su trabajo de tortero, de sus dos hijas, una se caso y la otra estudia. Con este nuevo prestamo podra optar por mas productos en la compra de ropa, zapatos, perfumes, y productos plasticos que son de mucha demanda en esta temporada por  el rezo a la purisima, teniendo por objetivo mayores ventas, logrando obtener mejores ganancia que sastifaga las necesidades en gastos basicos y gastos personales.
texts.en: Rosa continues in her business selling plastic products and clothing, which she sells both to order and retail. She buys her products from a supplier in a factory who gives her a good price. The products are good quality and last well even though they are plastic. Rosa's husband continues working as a cook. One of her daughters got married and the other is still studying. With this new loan, Rosa will be able to buy more clothes, shoes, perfumes and plastic products which are in great demand this season because of La Purísima* Her goal is to achieve more sales and make better profits which will cover her basic and personal expenses. * (an annual celebration of the purity of the Virgin Mary when those with the means to do so are expected to throw a celebration for their neighbors)

loans.use: to invest in buying clothing, shoes, perfumes and plastic products in bulk

loans.name: Njete Farmers Group

texts.en:
James is the facilitator of the Njete Farmers group. James and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

James takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, James had a good maize yield harvesting 9 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  James was only able to harvest 3 ½ bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to James and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, James will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Njete Farmers group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Adulia

texts.en:
Adulia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her fishing/fish-vending business.

Adulia has been in this business for 12 years. Adulia earns more income from food vending.

Adulia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for her fishing business.

loans.name: Faiq

texts.en:
Faiq is 46-year-old man who is married with four children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a joiner (carpenter/cabinetmaker) and has his cabinets where he serves clients and take orders.  His son helps Faiq and is learning how to run the business. He has five years of experience in this field and during this time, he gained the necessary skills and knowledge required for the business. His business brings stable income to his family and his monthly profit is 250 AZN. 

Faiq decided to take a loan and purchase new tools for work. This will allow him to take more orders and keep clients satisfied with better quality of work. This will be his fourth loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for work

loans.name: Maria Norely

texts.es: Maria Norely se ha caracterizado por ser una muy buena madre de sus 2 hijos de 3 y 11 años, además que también se ha caracterizado por ser una muy buena esposa. Maria Norely la reconocen sus familiares y los habitantes de su sector por ser una persona muy noble y muy dedicada a intentar impactar positivamente en la vida de los demás, por lo que siempre que tiene la posibilidad ayuda a las personas que más lo necesitan y desde su negocio quiere seguir haciendo lo mismo. Maria Norely abrió su tienda hace ya un tiempo, en ella vende productos de la canasta familiar y demás productos que requieren sus clientes, y gracias a esto genera los ingresos necesarios para el sustento de su familia. Maria Norely quiere que sus ingresos aumenten para poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, empezando por que sus hijos puedan acceder a una mejor educación de la que acceden ahora. Es por esto que Maria Norely esta en la búsqueda de comprar una moto que le facilite hacer servicios a domicilios, y de esta manera sus ventas se incrementen notablemente. Sin embargo, Maria Norely no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder acceder a la compra de la moto, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a este vehículo de transporte y pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Maria Norely aspira que con el servicio a domicilio sus ventas se incrementaran, y de esta manera podrá cumplir su sueño de que sus dos hijos puedan ingresar a una institución donde le brinden una mejor educación a la que tienen actualmente.
texts.en:
María Norely has been notable for being a very good mother of her two children who are 3 and 11 years old; she’s also been characterized as being a very good wife.  María Norely is known by relatives and residents of her sector for being a very noble, dedicated person who tries to make a positive impact in the lives of others so is always willing to help those who need it most and would like to continue to do so from her business.

María Norely opened her store some time ago; she sells basic staple items as well as other products her customers need.  Thanks to this she generates income needed to support her family.  María Norely wants her income to increase to offer her family a better quality of life starting with her children being able to access better schooling than they currently receive.  Because of this María Norely is looking to buy a motorcycle that will facilitate doing home deliveries which will lead to notably increased sales.

However, María Norely does not have sufficient capital to be able to buy the motorcycle which is why she hopes for a loan that will make access to this vehicle and better customer service possible.  María Norely hopes that home deliveries will lead to increased sales which will in turn help her reach her dream of her children being able to enroll in an institution where they can get a better education that what they are getting now.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Khom's Group

texts.en: Khom is a citizen in the Battambang province’s Bovel district. She is 47-years-old and married. She has three children, one of whom are dependent on her and still in school Her main business  career is farming, which she has been growing rice and sesame for ten years This is the first loan for Khom with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy plow the field. She hopes to make a living better and keeps her child in school.

loans.use: to buy plow the field

loans.name: Arlindo

texts.pt:
O senhor  Arlindo de 37 anos de idade é pedreiro a conta própria, casado pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 estudam e 1 ainda menor  sustenta também sua mãe enviando lhe dinheiro e vive na casa própria .
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, ferro, areia, estribos, pedra e blocos para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro são terminar a construção de sua casa, mobilar, fazer a carta de condução e adquirir uma viatura  para usar como transporte semi colectivo de passageiros para reforçar a renda familiar.
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz depósitos numa conta como forma de poupar e que irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Mr Arlindo is 37 and a self-employed stonemason, married and the father of 3 children - 2 of whom go to school and one who is still too young to go. He also supports his mother by sending her money and he lives in a house he owns. 

He says that with this loan he will buy cement, iron, sand, buttresses, stone and bricks to continue the building work on his home.

His hope and dreams for the future are to finish building his house, furnish it, take his driver's license and buy a vehicle to use partially as a group transport vehicle to reinforce his family's income.

He says his challenges are his lack of funds and to overcome this he makes deposits into a savings account and will solicit further loans in future to carry out his plans.

loans.use: buy cement, iron, sand, buttresses, stone and bricks to continue the building work on his home.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Mrs. Nhung is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She operates a fishing business and owns fish cages. She earns a meager income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs of her family especially her children's education. She requested a loan, which she will use to repair and overhaul her fishing boat and maintain other fishing equipment to improve and expand her fishing business. In the future, she hopes to concrete her house.

loans.use: To repair and overhaul her fishing boat and maintain other fishing equipment to improve and expand her fishing business

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert O., was born in northern town of Kitgum in 1979 and has lived there until the war was unbearable when he moved to Kampala in 2002.His father was among those killed by the rebels, when he was just ten years old and watching this happened it was impossible for him to continue living in that situation thus the decision to look for safer place, this then was then when he came to Kampala.

While in Kampala Robert now as an adult married with 1 child started learning building skills this was through giving a hand to the mason. This could not earn him enough money so, he decided to join the rest at the stone quarry, a job he did until the news of the bracket project by life in Africa knocked on his door.

This gave him a lot of uplift in his earning that during the few months of working with them, he managed to acquire a small plot that he now wished to develop into a family house.

He therefore seeks a loan of 500,000/= which he will pay back in 12 mouths at 50,415 @

Budget

  • Bricks 1500 x 60/= - 90,000/=
  • Cement 5bags x 18,000/= - 90,000/=
  • Iron sheets 15 x 10,000/= = 150,000/=
  • Roofing poles 10 x 3000/= - 30,000/=
  • Sand 1 trip x 6,000/= - 60,000/=
  • Doors and window frames – 40,000/=
  • Transport – 30,000/=
  • Contingency – 10,000/=

Total ----------- 500,000/=


Since he already has building skills, Robert will be doing his work himself so no labour cost. After this Robert plans to get a bigger land where he will build rental houses that will enable his children go to school. Robert has designated the community impact portion of the interest he will pay on this loan to support educational opportunities for LiA member children.

loans.use: Purchase building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE MILK PROCESSING EQUIPMENT

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma K. has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She cooks palm oil and sells it to market women for retail. She is seeking a loan of US$800.00 from Kiva to help her expand her production.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is 55 years old, married with 8 children, 2 of whom have married and no longer live at home. Her husband sells flowers in San Cristobal and also to other customers who know the region and like roses. Juana is an artisan in the production of shawls, blankets, tablecloths and napkins, all hand embroidered. She belongs to the Rosas 2 group along with Mrs. Rosa P. Jimenez who also makes embroidered tablecloths and napkins. Together, they hope to use the loan to buy great quantities of fabric and thread and share them to bring down the costs of materials and thereby increase their incomes.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

JUANA TIENE 55 AÑOS , CASADA , TIENE 8 HIJOS DE LOS CUALES DOS DE ELLOS YA SE CASARON Y NO ESTAN CON ELLA .SU ESPOSO VENDE FLORES EN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL Y TAMBIEN CON PERSONAS QUE CONOCEN LA REGION Y QUE GUSTAN DEL CULTIVO DE LAS ROSAS .JUANA SE DEDICA A LA ARTESANIA CONFECCIONANDO CHALES , MANTAS , MANTELES , SERVILLETAS TODAS CON APLICACIONES DE BORDADOS ARTESANALES. PERTENECE AL GRUPO ROSAS 2 JUNTO CON DOÑA ROSA P. JIMENEZ LA CUAL TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA ARTESANIA CONFECCIONANDO MANTELES Y SERVILLETAS BORDADAS.JUNTAS ESPERAN CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRAR GRANDES CANTIDADES DE GENERO , HILOS Y REPARTIRSE ENTRE ELLAS PARA ASI REBAJAR LOS COSTOS DE COMPRA Y AUMENTAR SUS INGRESOS .

loans.use: Craft sales

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Mr. Alexander O. learned the act of planting pawpaw from his friends.  He is 45 years old, and married with 13 children.  He is requesting a loan of $550 to enable him to produce more fruit (pawpaw) to sell.  He has been a LAPO member for 4 years.

loans.use: For planting & maintenance of pawpaw fruit

loans.name: Eni

texts.en: Eni is a married mother of four children from the village of Matautu Falealili. Her business is a vegetable garden. Her husband and two sons work on the garden. Her last loan of $300 was used to buy supplies for her vegetable garden. She is applying for this loan in order to keep her children in school and to support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, gramoxone (a weed killer), and other supplies for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Rahbaroi

texts.en: Rahbaroi has been in business for over 4 years. Her business place is located  in Istaravshan market, a district of Khujand, Tajikistan. She is mother of 5 children and they are old enough to help their mother.Often her eldest son helps to carry heavy bags from the wholesale market to her stand. Every day they  arrange her stand together and at the end of her working day, her son comes again to help her gather up her goods. At home she additionally has a milk cow and her daughters sell milk in their village. All her profit is spent for family needs. By taking part in KIva's program, she wants to increase her working capital and be able to save money for her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: Purchase 4 cartons  of candles, 2 cartons of shampoo, and other household products for resale

loans.name: Evelyn Karina

texts.es:
Evelyn is a partner/member of the Communal Bank "Mujeres Emprededoras del Mercado" of Huaraz. She sells red meat (cattle meat) and ready-made hamburgers. Her business is based in the central market of Huaraz, in the Ancash region. With this loan of 200.00 soles, which will be paid in 4 instalments, she will buy small tools to cut meat. Furthermore, she will buy hooked meat (half cattle meat/half wholesale) in order to sell to the retail market. She is 23 years old, is cohabiting and has a small 3 month-old child. Her partner works in the mines as a worker, and during his days off helps Evelyn with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva Translator

La señora Evelyn es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprededoras del Mercado” de Huaraz, se dedica a la venta de carne roja (carne de res) y hamburguesa preparadas, su negocio está ubicado en el Mercado central de Huaraz, del departamento de Ancash. Con este préstamo de S/. 200.00 soles, que pagará en 4 cuotas, comprará una pequeña herramienta para trozar la carne, además comprará carne por gancho (media res/al por mayor) para vender al por menor. Ella tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo pequeño de 3 meses, su esposo trabaja en la mina como obrero y en sus días libres le apoya en el negocio.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale meat. To purchase cutting equipment.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia O. is 54 years old, married and has 7 children. She comes from Alaba in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She sells smoked fish. She has been a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) member for 2 years. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy more fish for sale. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa O. is a hardworking mother of two. She is currently working in a small convenience store which she runs out of her house. Her husband is a successful baker. He used to sell baked goods out of their house but now he works at a local supermarket baking their breads and sweet treats.

Through his work, Felipa was able to open her own small convenience store at their house, and with the combined incomes, they can support their two children. Felipa is asking for a loan of $225 to buy cooking oil, meats, eggs, and other popular food items. With a greater variety of food, she is hoping her profits will increase.

loans.use: To buy foostuffs for her convenience store

loans.name: Chanty

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanty M. was married to her first husband in 1990 and has four children. In 2006 she married her second husband, Minea Kong, and had one child. Four of her children are in school. The family is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chanty has been growing vegetables for five years. She grows many kinds of vegetables in the farm near her house. Her husband is a security guard.

Mrs. Chanty is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $600 to purchase a water pumping machine for her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Tabia

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 54-year-old Tabia M.. She is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 14.

In 2000, Tabia established her cocoa business. Tabia requires a loan in order to purchase cocoa in bulk for resale. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase cocoa in bulk.

loans.name: Peata

texts.en: Peata S., 35, is married with 4 children.  Her husband does much of the farming. She has 4 years of experience in the taro & bananas business. She sells to the village community at the Fugalei market 3 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Peata’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Loan will be used mostly to pay for labor, and also to replace all the equipment for her project.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi A. is 39 years old, married, and the mother of four. She has been running a pub for more than five years in Avetonou, a small village located about 100 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. To better satisfy her customers and to help cover household needs, Essi wishes to use this credit to outfit her restaurant and to buy sacks of rice, drums of oil, and the ingredients necessary for the proper operation of her business.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Essi A. est âgé de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle tient un bar depuis plus de 5 ans à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Pour mieux satisfaire ses clients et de participer à la prise encharge des besoins du foyer, madame Essi souhaite, avec ce crédit, aménager son restaurant et acheter des sacs de riz, des bidons d’huiles et des ingrédients nécessaires au bon fonctionnement de son activité.

loans.use: To outfit her restaurant and to buy sacks of rice, drums of oil, and some ingredients

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a thirty-eight year old married mother with four children. Elvira has a stand in the “April 12” market where she sells groceries with the help of her husband. Additionally, Elvira has another stand in the “F. Vivanco” market where she sells ingredients to make traditional breads, sold exclusively during community events. She also has opportunities to sell mustard, tomato sauce, vinegar, and soya sauce to different chicken restaurants in the city.

Elvira is a member of the Violeta Village Bank.

Elvira needs a loan of 2400 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($850 US Dollars) to invest in rice, sugar, milk, condiments, and various soups.

Elvira´s dream is to advance her children´s education and have a large store and a chicken restaurant.

loans.use: to invest in rice, sugar, milk, condiments, and various soups.

loans.name: Ni Wayan

texts.id:
Despite her age, Wayan J. is very diligent in farming her pigs. She develops this business to help her husband that works as a farmer providing income to the family. With the training and financial help from DINARI, Wayan J. managed to grow her pigs so that they bring her a lot of profit. From 4 piglets that she grew for 6 months, she managed to earn $30 profit per month. So she decided to apply for second loan from DINARI. With the bigger loan, Wayan plans to purchase more piglets and feeds. She hopes to increase her sales and consequently bring more income to fulfill her daily needs.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Meskipun sudah cukup tua, Wayan J. sangat ulet menekuni usaha beternak babi. Hal ini dilakukannya untuk membantu suaminya yang sebagai petani dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Dengan pemeliharaan yang sederhana serta pinjaman modal dan training dari DINARI Wayan J. mampu mengembangkan ternak babinya sehingga dapat memberikan keuntungan yang lumayan banyak. Dari penjualan babi penggemukan sejumlah 4 ekor selama 6 bulan diperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp.300.000,- per bulannya. Kemudian selanjutnya melakukan peminjaman kedua ke DINARI dengan jumlah pinjaman yang bertambah besar dan Wayan menggunakannya untuk membeli bibit babi penggemukan yang lebih banyak serta untuk pakan. Keuntungan dari penjualan berikutnya diharapkan bertambah besar juga sehingga dapat digunakan untuk keperluan sehari-hari serta menambah modal ternak babinya kelak.

loans.use: Purchase Piglets and Feed

loans.name: Fakhira

texts.en:
Fakhira baji is the daughter of M. R. and lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats and decorative embroidery. Fakhira baji got a divorce after her one year of marriage. She has no children. She has been living with her family for the last 20 years.

After her divorce Fakhira baji didn't want to be a burden on her parents. Therefore, she gave her life a new turn and started a milk-selling business. She bought a buffalo and started getting milk from her. Now she has involved her brother in this business. She gets milk from the buffalo and he goes to sell the milk in milk shops. Now she and her brother are together in one business and they both decided to buy another buffalo.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand her milk business

loans.name: Jacob

texts.fr:
Né à Aného en 1966, Mr d’ALMEIDA est marié et père de 04 enfants. Résident à Kpémé , il exerce le métier de mécanicien chauffeur. Son  sérieux dans le travail lui a valu la confiance d’un client qui lui a confié  sa voiture pour faire le transport  en commun (taxi). Le salaire qu’il perçoit de ce job étant médiocre, il n’arrive pas  à subvenir aux besoins essentiels de sa famille. 
        '
Son rêve aujourd’hui est de pouvoir bénéficier au maximum des atouts et faveurs de ce métier de  chauffeur de taxi qui est très prometteur dans le milieu.
  
Il sollicite alors un crédit  pour réaliser son projet qui pourra l'aider à améliorer son revenu et mieux prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Aného in 1966, Mr. D. is married and the father of four. A resident of Kpémé, he works in the driver-mechanic trade. His serious attitude towards work has earned him the confidence of a customer who has entrusted him with his car for use as a taxi. Because the salary he receives from this job is mediocre, he is unable to meet the essential needs of his family. Today, his dream is to be able to maximize the assets and added benefits of working as a taxi driver which is very promising in the locale. He is therefore requesting a loan to realize his project that will help him improve his income and to care for his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a taxi

loans.name: Vilma Margot

texts.en:
Vilma Margot is a member of the Wiracocha (“Sun God” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is 58 years old and has five adult children, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband died recently after a long period of illness, so Vilma Margot is now a widow.

Vilma Margot works at the Regional Health Authority in the city of Ayacucho and also sells cosmetics and women’s clothing in her free time. Most of her clients are friends, family members and co-workers. She is requesting a loan of 1400 soles to buy more women’s clothing to sell. She buys brand-name clothing new in Lima and brings it to the city of Ayacucho, which is about 9 hours away.

In the future, Vilma thinks about opening up a store of her own. Her daughter used to own her own store, but had to close it due to the expenses resulting from her father’s illness. Vilma would also like to sell a wider variety of merchandise, though she is also thinking about retirement.

She has been working with FINCA Peru for just under one year and says it has been a good experience that has helped her get out of some tough situations.

loans.use: Buy women's clothing

loans.name: Vit

texts.en:
Mr. Vith Mak is a villager in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Mak Sokoeun, breeds ducks. Although they have different businesses, they still earn less income than they need to support their family. 

In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Vith Mak has decided to ask for a loan to buy a machine for threshing rice, which he will rent to other villagers to earn an income. He is 39 years old and the father of three children, one of whom attends the local school. The others are too young.

Mr. Mak's wife is presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy a machine for threshing rice to rent to the villagers for income

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Khroch, 55, is a widow with eight children:  three sons and five daughters. Five are married and live outside the family home; one son is a silk weaver and the other son is a monk. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sok has been a silk weaver for 20 years, a skill learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. Sok is now requesting a loan of $400 to purchase more silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Harriet No Oyoo

texts.fr: O. harriet est une esthéticienne dans le quartier de nykonakpoè, elle a beaucoup de clientèle, elle a associé à son activité la vente de produits de beauté, elle  fait cette activité depuis 2003. Elle est donc très sollicitée dans son quartier et a besoin d’agrandir son commerce c’est pour cela qu’elle demande à WAGES un crédit d’un montant de 500000F pour acheter des marchandises de produits de beauté. Elle est mariée et a 01 enfants, son mari est un  gestionnaire  à la SVT.
texts.en:
Harriet O. is a beautician in the Nykonakpoè neighborhood. She has a lot of customers and she sells cosmetics as well. She has been in this business since 2003. She is very much in demand in her neighborhood and thus needs to expand her business. For that reason, she is asking for a loan from WAGES in the amount of 500,000 F to buy cosmetics. She is married with one child, and her husband is a manager at the SVT.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia S. grows rice for a living. Her husband, Elpedio S., manages their small farm. For 37 years, they have been renting a farm to have food for the family. Lydia is 57 years old and works very hard to raise her three children. She wants to send all her children to college so when they are old they will find better jobs to support their future families.

Lydia is asking for a loan of 10,000 pesos to purchase one quart Agrobond and urea fertilizers. She will also buy quality seeds for a good harvest. She also considers looking for some other business line to augment her income. With her loan, she will be able to help her husband more.

CEVI provides its clients the credit assistance they need. It also provides them with relevant trainings and insurance coverage to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for the farm

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean Damascene N. in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Jean Damascene is 40 years old and is married with three children.

This entrepreneur owns a small shop where he sells bed covers and bed sheets at Nyabugogo market in Kigali. He has owned the business for three years and employs one person to help him to run the business. He works every day from 7 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. and earns a profit of approximately 150,000 Rwandan francs per month (about $275).

Jean Damascene N. is requesting a loan in the amount of 500,000 Rwandan francs from Vision Finance Company S.A. With the increased profits that result from his loan, he plans to pay school fees for his child and to reinvest in his business. The loan will be repaid over eight months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To increase stock of bed covers and bed sheets to sell at market.

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya G. is a widow with three children. She lives with her two young children in the Narantuul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter is a senior in a local high school and her 6-year-old daughter goes to a kindergarten.

Since 1997, she has been selling TV remote controls for various consumer electronics in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. She started the business with a capital of 500,000 MNT (1 U.S. dollar equals approximately 1,500 MNT), and currently her business capital is about 4,000,000 MNT. Compared to when she started, her business has stabilized with some trusted clients.

In addition to selling new remote controls, she repairs old remote controls and resells antiques. Her business profit is the only source of income for her family. Her husband passed away three years ago and her only son is a soldier in the army.

In the future, she would like to make sure that her two daughters will be able to go to university without financial strains. She requests a loan for purchasing more antiques and remote controls.

loans.use: To buy more electronic remote controls and antiques to sell

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Mrs. Esterlina M. is married to a carpenter. The couple is blessed with two children, both in school. Esterlina became a member of Paglaum MPC in July 2005. She has had previous loans from Paglaum MPC usually for additional capital for her Junk Buying that she started long ago. She is now on her eighth loan, this one for Php 7,000. She will use her present loan to purchase junk items such as metals, plastics, aluminum etc.

The couple wishes to have a junk shop. She wants all her children to finish their courses. She is very grateful that she's one of the members of PMPC and has an opportunity to use Kiva services too.

loans.use: To buy junk items such as metals, plastics, aluminum etc.

loans.name: Nieves Dina

texts.es:
Nieves es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Nieves es viuda, tiene 55 años y 3 hijos, Nieves tiene un restaurante en su casa llamado Kayllapiña que significa Aquí Nada Más en quechua, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 3 empleados, además los días sábados y domingos vende comida típica.
Nieves necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza, cuy, gallina.
Los sueños de Nieves son ampliar su negocio, mejorar su local y que sus hijos últimos culminen sus profesiones.
texts.en:
Nieves is a partner in the Virgen Maria community bank. She is 55 years old and a widow, with three children. Nives has a restaurant in her home, called Kayllapiña, which means "Here No More" in quechua. Nives manages the restaurant with the help of three employees, and on the weekends she sells traditional food. Nives needs a loan of 3000 soles, which she'll invest in beer, guinea pig, and chicken. She dreams of expanding the business, improving the property, and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nieves needs a loan of 3000 soles, which she'll invest in beer, guinea pig, and chicken.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
"My husband and I are tilling a 3-hectare farm. Now, we are busy preparing the land for our next planting. We hope to grow our farm so that we could easily send our two children in school. We are grateful to Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) for always there to support our livelihood and make it grow," says Helen O., a 25 year old farmer from Agusan Del Sur in Mindanao.

Helen would like a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides. "With my loan, I hope I could improve our harvest even more," she said.

CEVI helps small business grow. They provide their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr: Hawa D., 56 ans est mariée avec 02 enfants  en charge. Son activité est la transformation et vente des céréales et de beignets. Elle veut acheter mil, mais et provisions pour faire des beignets et vendre pour renforcer améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Hawa D., 56, is married and raising two children. Her business is processing and selling cereals and making fritters. She wants to buy millet, maize, and provisions to make the fritters and sell these goods to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: processing and sale of millet, maize, and of fritters

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora S., age 31, is married and has four children. She has many years of experience growing and selling vegetables. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days per week. This is her first loan from SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Flora’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks.  She appreciated the help she got from the program to improve her family's living standards and is happy to continue with the loan program.

loans.use: Purchase weed killer, a wheel barrow and farming equipment, such as knives, spades and axes.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 53 years old and lives in Lagos State.  She is married with 6 children. She has a small business selling eggs. Sarah has requested and hopes to receive a loan in the amount of N150, 000 to purchase more eggs to sell. She promises to pay back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Mrs Aun O., 41,  is a determined woman and the mother of six children, one of whom is married while the others are of school age. She is shown in the picture at her vegetable store. Aun O. sells vegetables that she goes to buy with her husband from wholesale suppliers. She then brings them to sell to customers at the market. Typically, she generates $5 USD income each day, which she uses to manage all her family’s requirements and, in particular, to make sure her school-aged children get a good educatiO.. Aun O. says that her investment is growing well as she has an increasing number of regular customers. To make her business more successful and to satisfy customer demand, Aun O. has requested a loan to purchase larger quantities of various vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of vegetables for resale

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda C. is from the village of Buyog, Banlag Valencia Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Rosalinda is married and has five school-age children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of goods in her general store and selling firewood in the local community. Rosalinda has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more new items to further expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosalinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase items that will expand her product offering

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 45 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter who are both in school. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in crates of eggs. Theresa supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She procures the eggs from nearby poultry-farming communities. She has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to buy crates of eggs in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena A., 53, lives with her three adult children in Malibay, Pasay City.  One of her children is still in college.

Elena owns a general store.  She opened her store a decade ago and it is steadily growing over the years.  Because of the demand, she recently began selling pre-paid electronic load credits for mobile phones.  Business is brisk and she consistently makes more than $365 net income per month.  She can't afford to hire an assistant yet because she pays for her child’s college education.  She is also nursing a grieving heart because of her husband’s recent passing.  To help her in her grief, she is devoting much of her time in attending to her business.  She also finds time to attend gatherings organized for women entrepreneurs by the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative of which she became a member in 2003.

She is now applying for a loan in the amount of P15,000 to ensure the continuing operation of her business.  She will use the money to buy more grocery items and additional refreshments (soft drinks) to sell.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items and soft drinks

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel B. lives with her husband and three children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter goes to a university in Ulaanbaatar and her other two children are both high school students.

Narangerel has a small business in retail clothing. She rents a small stall in a local market and retails various women’s and men’s clothes. She mostly purchases clothes that are made in Mongolia, from the wholesale markets in the city. She now would like to expand her business by adding more variety of clothes to her stall. She would like to import cheap clothes from Ereen, China, a border town from where many cheap Chinese products are imported to Mongolia.

Narangerel requests a loan to purchase more clothes from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes from Ereen, China

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda F. is 34 years old and happily married to her partner in life, Edgar F., 37 years old. They have four children who are equally divided in gender, 2 boys and 2 girls. Danica is now 11 years old, Laline 8 years old, Darius 5 years old and Dennis 4 years old. All of them are now studying in the first level of education, so there are more expenses for their tuition fees plus the daily expenses in the house. The main source of their income is from their buy and sell fruit and peanut business. Her husband is her partner in improving their business. Through their perseverance and with enough capital for the business, they are sure they can make their business grow.

Through the help of the loans that she received from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), her business has continue to run for 10 years now because she always properly utilized the loans that she received. For this fifth time of taking a loan, she will buy things that are needed for her business. And she is sure that it will last for many years because they will to everything to make it grow.

One dream of Glenda's is to make her business grow big enough so they can have a store place in their market. So she will double her work with the help of her husband so that this dream will be possible. And of course, the result of this is enough income for them and enough money to send her children through college.

loans.use: To finance her buy and sell of fruits business

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Mrs. Thai V. lives in Prey Kdei village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this, she is a pig breeder. Since this business is doing well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy ten more piglets and feed. Her husband, Mr. Saem Bol, is a motorbike taxi driver who makes a small income to support the family. Mrs. Thai V. is the mother of a 1-year-old child. 
Her husband is present in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy ten more piglets and feed

loans.name: Caroline's Group

texts.en: Caroline B. is a 32-year-old hard-working and determined lady, and the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She has had a clothes store in Lugazi Town council for 3 years and she is able to make 30,000UGX as profits a week, which is mostly affected by the seasonality of her business plus the high rent costs. Caroline likes her business very much and in future, she would like to increase her business capital for increased stock. She would also like to have her children educated, as well as to build a family house for comfort. She is married with 3 children aged 13 years, 10 years and 1 week old, and she takes care of 5 dependants. Caroline needs a loan to help increase her business capital by purchasing more clothes for resale.

loans.use: Purchasing more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Scholastique

texts.en:
Scholastique is 38 years old, married with three children aged between 8 and 13 years. She lives in Gakenke, a region of Ruhengeli situated in the Northern Province of Rwanda, approximately two hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.
