Scholarstique has been in the business of selling local foodstuffs (fruits and vegetables) for two years and employs three people from her community to assist in the daily activities of her business. Her work runs from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Scholastique is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more fruits and vegetables as well as adding drinks to her business. With these funds, she is expecting to gain more profits as well as to satisfy her customers and increase the demand from her community.

Scholastique also plans to renovate her house and better provide for her family and her loved ones.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables and drinks to sell

loans.name: Ayihonsi

texts.fr: D. Ayihonsi est née en 1964 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Ayihonsi vit à Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis 10 ans environs. Mariée à HOUNKPEVI Marcelin, un chauffeur, Ayihonsi est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Ayihonsi vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Ayihonsi a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire. Il y a une dizaine d’année que Ayihonsi vend des divers (amuses gueule, liqueurs, lait, etc.) de façon ambulante. Ayihonsi s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Ayihonsi a obtenu une fois déjà, de crédit à ALIDé, et l’a bien remboursé. Ayihonsi sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
D. Ayihonsi was born in 1964 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin. Ayihonsi has lived in Agblangandan, in the Sèmè-Podji commune, for around 10 years. She is married to Hounkpevi Marcelin, a driver, and has six children who are all educated. Ayihonsi lives with her children and husband, and she and her husband take care of the family’s living expenses together. Ayihonsi did not complete high school.
Ayihonsi has worked as a street vendor selling various items (snacks, liqueurs, milk, etc.) for around 10 years. Ayihonsi stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market in Bénin.
Ayihonsi has already received and repaid a loan through Alidé. She is requesting a second Alidé loan to expand her business and to better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy snacks and liqueurs

loans.name: Ela

texts.en:
Ela I. is 39 and married with 3 children (ages 5 - 15).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Ela has many years of experience in this business.  Ela needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 260 tala or US $108 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Ela joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Ela's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita farms for a living. She is 54 years old, married and has nine children. Her oldest child, who is now 34 years old, does not live with the family any more. Teresita plants rice at her farm. She works hard at the farm to sustain her family’s needs. She helps her husband maintain the farm’s productivity. 

Teresita want a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos and plans to use it to buy seed, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Matilde Insaurralde

texts.en: Matilde Insaurralde is a member of the "Mujeres Unidas" Committee in the city of San Ignacio Misiones, located on Route 1.  She is the mother of four young children who live with her.  Her husband and children work in construction.  Matilde owns two milking cows with which she produces and sells milk and cheese in addition to homemade eggs and seasonal fruit dishes.

loans.use: To build a bathroom

loans.name: Ruperto

texts.en: Ruperto, age 55, manages a rice and banana farm. It is located in his town in the province of Agusan del Sur. At his age, he still wants to provide for his children and grandchildren. He maintains the farm in order for his whole family to benefit from it. When he found out about CEVI, he immediately joined to have access to financial support for his business. He requested a loan of 6000 PHP. He said he would use it to buy farm supplies, like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies, like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: George

texts.en: George B. is from the village of Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 28 years old. George is married. To make a living, George owns and operates a business to provide transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a motorcycle-transport service. George has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, George joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. George is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by George from ASKI, a Kiva partner. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Mireya Luisa

texts.es:
Mireya es una joven de 35 años de edad, con iniciativa propia, logro tener su pequeño negocio la venta de ropa nueva, como de segunda, cosméticos, zapatos y los que los clientes le encarguen. Su esposo es electricista y gracia a su apoyo comenzó sus ventas. Sus hijos estudian para lograr una buena educación. A su casa le hacen falta muchas mejoras como repellarla, pintarla, poner piso entre otros. No ha invertido aun en su casa para lograr aumentar las ventas y poder captar más clientela para un futuro mejor a su inversión. Con este préstamo lograra comprar ropa de verano, interior para dama, caballero, niños, a si como zapatos y cosmético para lograr las mejoras a sus venta con mercancías nueva. Sus planes a futuro es poder lograr hacer las mejora  a su casa para un bienestar a su familia.


c
texts.en:
Mireya is a young woman who is 35 years of age. Of her own initiative, she established a small business selling new clothing and a second business selling cosmetics and shoes that her customers request. Her husband is an electrician and thanks to his support, she was able to start her sales businesses. Her children are in school in order to obtain a good education. Mireya’s home is need of a several improvements such as plastering, painting, and installation of a floor among other things. She has yet to invest in her home because she needs to increase her sales and attract customers in order to make such improvements in the future.

With this loan she will buy summer clothing and undergarments for women, men, and children. In addition, she will acquire shoes and cosmetics so that she can improve her sales with new merchandise. Her plans for the future are to make improvements to her home for the welfare of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase summer clothing, undergarments, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata K. is married and has four children. She has been a trader for about 15 years now and trades in textiles, until recently when she switched to the sale of plastic shoes and slippers.

Aminata started her business with a very small amount of capital that she got from her husband. Being that she wants to expand her business by buying more goods to sell, she is in need of a loan to help her achieve her dream. It is her wish that, if successful in acquiring a loan, she will use proceeds from the loan to attend to her children's schooling needs and other domestic issues.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more goods to sell

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora  Mariana de Jesús  B. es socia del banco Esperanza del Mañana, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Azogues capital de la provincia del Cañar, cuenta con un clima templado facilitando la producción de algunas frutas y verduras. Por su conformación topográfica es una ciudad bien asoleada desde el punto Este culminando en la iglesia y templo del Santuario Franciscano que  desciende con grandes inclinaciones hasta el cajón del río Burgay.

Mariana tiene 29años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido cinco  hijos que se encuentran de 13, 11, 5, 3 y 1 año, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuela del sector y gracias a su esposo que trabaja en la construcción y también pinta  casas han salido adelante; la casa en la q viven es arrendada por lo que su mayor sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia. 

 Nuestra  socia se dedicaba a la venta de granos y verduras pero le fue mal por la sequia que arraso  a la región ocasionando que los precios se disparen y por ende que las ventas bajen por lo tanto, ahora se va a dedicar a vender salchipapas en la casa de una tía, Mariana lleva cinco ciclos en su banco comunal invitada por su madre a formar parte de éste equipo de mujeres emprendedoras, con el credito solicitado va a comprar todo lo necesario para montar su negocio de comida rápida como salchichas, papas, salsas, fundas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariana is a member of the Esperanza del Mañana ((Hope of Tomorrow) Bank and lives in the center of Azogues City, the capital of Cañar Province. The area enjoys a temperate climate, facilitating production of some fruits and vegetables. Topographically, it is a city exposed to the sun from its culminating eastern point, the Santuario Franciscano church and temple, and descending in great inclines until the canyon of the Burgay River. Mariana is 29 years old, married, and has conceived 5 children from the union. Their ages are 13, 11, 5, 3, and 1. Her eldest 3 children study in a regional school, and thanks to her husband, who works in construction and also paints houses, they have gotten ahead. The house they live in is rented and their major dream is to have their own home. Mariana used to sell grains and vegetables but things went badly due to a drought that hit the region, causing prices to shoot up. As a result, sales fell badly. Now, she will dedicate her efforts to selling salchipapas (a sausage and potatoes dish) from her aunt's house. Mariana has been with her communal bank through 5 loan cycles. She was invited to join this team of enterprising women by her mother. With this requested loan she will buy everything necessary to begin her business of selling fast foods, including sausages, potatoes, salsas and bags.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING SAUSAGES, POTATOES, SALSA, SNACKS, AND BAGS TO START A FAST FOOD BUSINESS

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La señora Margarita tiene 29 años viven con su conviviente, juntos tienen 4 hijos (10, 8,6 y 1) son una familia D. escasos recursos económicos ya que apenas están 5 años juntos y ya tienen 4 hijos. Viven en la Ciudad D. Cochabamba en la localidad D. Machacmarca, no tienen su casa propia viven en la casa D. sus padres que en el futuro heredaran dicha casa. 

La principal actividad del cliente es la producción D. la leche cruda, actualmente solo cuenta con 3 cabezas D. ganado lechero cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración D. productos lácteos. Así como también el esposo trabaja D. mecánico a domicilio, como no trabaja en una empresa fija no todos los días tiene trabajo razón por lo cual el dinero  no alcanza para los gastos D. la semana.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra D. una cabeza D. ganado lechero, para D. que D. esta manera pueda incrementar la producción D. la leche y pueda mejorar sus ingresos.
Entre sus sueños y metas D. la señora margarita esta aumentar la cantidad D. cabezas D. ganado lechero, tener por lo menos una pequeña granja D. 20 cabezas D. ganado lechero, realizar una nueva construcción D. su casa que le heredara sus padres, lo cual tenga una habitación para cada hijo, ya que actualmente solo cuentan con 2 habitaciones uno para los 4 hijos donD. están muy incómodos y el otro para los padres.
texts.en:
Mrs. Magarita is 29 years old and lives with her partner. They have four children (10, 8, 6, and 1) and are a family living in poverty. They have been together for only five years and already have four children. They live in the city of Cochabamba in the Machacmarca locality. They do not have their own home; they live in their parents' house, which they will inherit in the future. Magarita's main business is the production of milk. Currently she only has three dairy cows, whose output she delivers to a company that makes dairy products. Her husband works as a mechanic on-call, but because he doesn't work for an established business he does not work every day. This means they cannot afford their weekly expenses. The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow, which will increase milk production and thus raise her income. Among her dreams and goals are having a small farm with 20 dairy cows and make improvements on the house that she will inherit from her parents so that each child can have their own room. Currently there are only two bedrooms one for all four children and the other for the parents.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy cow

loans.name: Richell

texts.en:
Richell C. is from the village of Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old and is married. Richell owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transportation services. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Richell joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 60,000 PHP from GDMPC. Richell is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be her eighth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her existing vehicle

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdou B. est un jeune commerçant  de 38 ans qui évolue  dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 20 ans déjà. Il est marie et membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis janvier 2010. C’est un chef de famille qui a en charge 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 10 mois et 9 ans. Il s’active dans le commerce de bovin qui est une activité qu’il a hérité  de son père, un ancien paysan-éleveur. Monsieur B. sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs qui sera destine a l’achat de6 a 7 moutons. Par conséquent  ce crédit  lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices qui lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels ainsi que ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdou B. is a young merchant aged 38 who has spent more than 20 years already in the business sector. He is married and has been a member of the Bambilor group fund since January 2010. He is the head of his household and is responsible for 3 children, whose ages vary from 10 months to 9 years old. He is active in the animal-rearing business, which he inherited from his father, a former rural livestock farmer. Mr. B. is seeking a loan of 100,000 frs, which will be used to buy 6 or 7 sheep. As a result, this loan will allow him to increase his profits, which will allow him to provide for himself and his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 45 años, es un padre de familia muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Reyda de 43 años y sus 2 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo que realiza Juan es el cultivo de papa y alverja, esta labor la realiza junto a su esposa, quien también trabaja arduamente para brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Él ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta la ciudad de Tarma, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene. Tiene 20 años realizando esta actividad, por lo que procura siempre cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga, ya que puede perjudicar el desarrollo de sus plantaciones. Con el tiempo, espera que mejore su siembra y con la venta pueda aumentar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su grupo comunal, en donde es muy querido. Con los mil quinientos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Juan, age 45, is a very unassuming and hard-working man. He lives in his own house with his 43 year old wife, Reyda, and their two minor children. They are the motivation for all of his efforts. Juan grows potatoes and peas. He does this work together with his wife, who also works arduously to give their children a good education. He has seen that it is beneficial to take his products to the city of Tarma. According to Juan, that is where he gets the best earnings. He has been doing this activity for 20 years. That is why he always tries to take care of his crops so the pests do not get to them. The pests can hamper the development of his crops. In time he hopes to improve what he sows. With their sale he will be able to increase his income. This is his seventh loan with MFP. He feels obliged to make all of his payments on time. He does not want to cause problems for the members of his communal bank where he is held in high regard. He will use the 1,500 soles he is requesting to buy more fertilizer for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fertilizer

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine was born in 1985 and is married without children. She owns a small business selling clothes in the city of Kigali. This business is profitable in the town and that's the reason why she chose it. Her business is well organized and known; Clementine has an experience of 10 years in this field. The hours of her daily activities are from 7 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day except on Saturday.

At present, Clementine is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing more bales of clothes. This expansion will help her to satisfy her customers which will be one way of earning more profit.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Jenny Noemí

texts.es:
Jenny es una madre de familia de 22 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo de tres años, reside en el distrito de Túcume, una zona conocida a nivel regional por sus atractivos, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la confección de casacas y buzos para colegios en un pequeño taller situado en la vivienda donde reside, ella realiza su trabajo en base a pedidos y cuenta con una máquina de coser semi – industrial. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia, ya que le permite ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos familiares.

Jenny desea adquirir materiales como telas e hilos para poder seguir trabajando y cumplir con algunos pedidos que tiene pendientes, para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 400 nuevos soles.

Jenny es una mujer tranquila y bastante responsable, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajuando para brindarle a su familia la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida. Sus vecinos y clientes le consideran una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa.
texts.en:
Jenny, age 22, lives with her husband and their small, three year old child. They live in the Túcume district. This area is known on a regional level for its attractions. It belongs to the Lambayeque province, which is over an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For two years she has been making jackets and sweatshirts for schools. She makes them in a small shop in her home. She does her work based on orders, and she has a semi-industrial sewing machine. This business is an important source of income for the family’s finances. It allows her to help her husband pay the family expenses. Jenny wishes to get materials like fabric and thread to be able to keep working and fill some orders that she has pending. In order to do so she believes that it is prudent to request a loan, for the first time, for 400 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Jenny is a level-headed and very responsible woman. Her greatest desire is to keep working in order to give her family the opportunity to have a better quality of life. Her neighbors and customers consider her to be a hard-working and diligent woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread and fabric to expand her business of making school sweatshirts

loans.name: Mrs. Pov Ek Village Bank Group

texts.en: Seventeen people make up this village bank loan and they live in Tuol Trea village, in TaK. province. Mrs. Pov E., who was born in 1966, is a village bank president, as selected by the other group members. Each group member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Pov E. and her husband, Mr. Mai Dy, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land on which they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Although they try to work a lot, she can earn very a little money to support their family. So to improve her family's condition, Mrs. Pov E. is applyI. for a loan to buy some piglets for breedI. to start a new business. With the rest of the loan she will buy some fish for breedI. as well. She is a mother of two children, all of whom are studyI. in school and they are helpI. in their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with three children who have all completed schooling.  Her husband is a mason and he contributes to his family's needs. She has been operating her food café business for more than one year, selling from her home to school children and neighbors.  She earns her other source of income from her husband's contribution.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of maize flour and a sack of rice.  She faces the major challenge of seasonality, especially during the month of August when school has closed for the holidays.

She hopes to open a big restaurant in the future.  Her major aim of working with Yehu is to get a loan to boost her business.  She owns a house with electricity, but no piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase flour and rice for her cafe.

loans.name: Ethelyn

texts.en:
Ethelyn S. was encouraged to join ASHI because of the values of helping women to prove their skills through lending them working capital for a business as a micro-entrepreneur. Ethelyn marked the day that when she joined ASHI. She began to dream, hope, and to find a way to move away under hardship of poverty. To supply additional income for her family, Ethelyn is interested to continue her copra business. Copra is coconut meat, dried under the heat of the sun and used for making soap, cooking oil, shampoo, and etc.

Ethelyn would like to receive a loan amounting 10,000 PHP to purchase more inventory of coconut for copra. As a proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a first Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Ethelyn is thankful to obtain secured capital to support her goals in life. Her long term goals are to build a profitable copra business, send her four children until finish college, and invest in her home. With the support of Kiva partner, she is dedicated to expand her business and determined to achieve financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of coconut for copra.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin P. C. is twenty-two years old, single and has no children. He lives with his parents in Caserio Solicape in the district of Mochumi in Lambayeque, an area that is predominately agricultural.

Benjamin raises animals and sells them to neighbors and in the local markets. He has been involved in this business for the last two years. He raises the animals in and around his home, providing his animals with both the plants that grow on his parent’s land and additional feed which he purchases.

Benjamin is requesting this loan in order to purchase additional animals and feed and for materials to make repairs to his corrals. Benjamin hopes to be able to expand his herd in order to better provide for himself and his family. It will be his first loan with our institution.

loans.use: To purchase animals and feed and for materials to make repairs to his corrals

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. lives in the Kyebando neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.   She also takes care of her father. She lives in a home that she owns and she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Annet has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days a week. She sells her products at retail prices from her home.  Her main business challenge is transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only.

Annet has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert H. is 28 years old. He lives in Sevan with his wife and four-year-old son. 

For about six years Albert has been engaged in animal breeding. His farm includes cows, sheep and chickens. His wife helps him a lot with the farming and in this way they support their young family. Albert and his wife hope to develop their farm in order to earn more income in the future. This will allow them to look ahead confidently, because they plan to have a second child in the near future.
 
Albert is asking for a 400.000 Armenian Drams loan to buy one more cow for his farm and fodder for his cows and sheep.

loans.use: To buy one more cow for his farm and fodder for his cows and sheep

loans.name: Abibakhan's Group

texts.en:
Abibakhan S., 54, is a treasurer of this group. She is a resident of a small town, Kerben in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan. She is divorced and has one daughter. The family operates a small retail shop selling groceries. Demand for groceries is always high. In addition, Abibakhan owns a small shop in a nearby village Tuyukjar, where she sells flour. Eleven years ago her friend suggested getting involved in this field. She believes that this loan will allow her to earn enough money tor send her granddaughter to one of the best universities in Russia. Being the main source of income for the family, the retail shop earns 10,000 soms a month. Abibakhan plans to use this loan to purchase convenience goods for sale. Despite the fact that this is her first loan, she is sure that she will be able to repay it successfully. 

These loans can change lives of millions. Mol Bulak Finance has already helped to finance 307 loans. Kyrgyz entrepreneurs operate mainly in retail, cattle breeding, and agriculture. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.  If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase convenience goods for sale

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mr. Sopheap H. (in the photo) is 30 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sovan Some is 31 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2002 and have three children--two sons and one daughter. Two of them are in school and another one is still too young. 

Mr. Sopheap H. has a full-time job in Phnom Penh. His wife sells silk and cotton products (fabrics and scarves). She buys them from the weavers in the village and transports to sell in other provinces. 

Sopheap is asking for a loan of $1,200 to provide his wife with capital to purchase more silk and cotton products for resale.

loans.use: To provide his wife with capital to purchase more silk and cotton products for resale

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
la sra. Luz Marina N. tiene 24 años de edad, esta soltera y vive en la casa de sus papas.
no tiene hijos ni novio, Luz se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario.

en sus tiempos libres le gusta escuchar musica, en su pulperia atiende a los vecinos.
el credito lo utilizara para surtir un poco mas su negocio.

su mayor sueño es que las ventas sean mejores en estos meses para lograr tener mayores ganacias y suplir algunas de su necesidades que tiene por los momentos.
texts.en:
Luz Marina N. is 24 years old.  She is single and lives in her parents' home.  She doesn't have children or a boyfriend.  Luz sells essential food products.  In her spare time, she likes to listen to music.  She serves her neighbors in her small grocery store.

Luz will use her loan to stock her business a little better.  Her greatest dream is for her sales to improve during this period so that she makes more profits and can thereby cover some of the needs that she has right now.

loans.use: To buy eggs, condiments, soup, pasta, butter, oil, rice, beans, flour, soap, pasta, sugar, bread, coffee, cookies and milk

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet A. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are currently in school. Juliet has a boutique business, which she has run for five years. She also has a bar.
To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 1,600,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for her boutique. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Juliet hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her boutique

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase quintales [a unit of measurement: 46 kg] of maseca corn flour, firewood and coal for making tortillas

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
FRANCISCO C. L., TRABAJA COMO CONDUCTOR, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA  DE TRES HIJOS Y ESTOS SE ENCUENTRAN EN EL COLEGIO, EL ACUDE A CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: BERJAS, PERSIANAS Y BLOQUES PARA SU CASA DE HABITACION ES SU PRIMER PRESTAMO CON CEPRODEL.
A GRADECE A CE`PRODEL POR EL APOYO BRINDADO YA QUE ESTE FIANANCIAMIENTO VEIENE A YUDAR PARA QUE SU FAMILIA VIVA EN MEJORES CONDICIONES CON UNA VIVIENDA MAS SEGURA.
texts.en:
Francisco C. L. works as a driver. He is the father of three children who are in school. Francisco has approached CEPRODEL to request a loan for buying construction materials such as wrought iron, shutters, and blocks for his home. This is his first loan with CEPRODEL.

Francisco is grateful to CEPRODEL for the support that has been provided. The funds will help his family live in better conditions and have a more secure home.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for his home

loans.name: Karen Rocío

texts.es:
Roció, tiene 30 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y nació en la ciudad de Cusco. Actualmente, Rocio vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Roció es profesora y no tiene un trabajo estable pero ella enseño el año 2010 en el colegio “La Merced” de Calca. Actualmente, Roció está esperando que empiece el año escolar para que cualquier colegio la pueda contratar. Roció también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y pollos. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Roció en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mas animales menores como pollos y cuyes. 
 
Roció pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rocío is 30 years old and the mother of three children. She was born in the city of Cusco, but lives now in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. Rocío is a teacher, but has no permanent job. In 2010 she taught at the "Colegio La Merced" in Calca. She waits for the new school term to begin, so that some school may hire her. Rocío also breeds small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She has done that for two years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Rocío currently needs a loan to buy more small animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs.

Rocío is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy more small animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is currently in business selling charcoal. She is 35 years old, married to a driver, with seven children and four of them go to school. Angelina borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to open a shop with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth tiene 33 años y nació en la comunidad de Yanahuara de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del   Cusco,  Perú. Ella tiene su pareja y tienen un hijo. Actualmente, Yaneth vive en la comunidad donde nació, ella nos cuenta que la mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería pero ella tiene varias actividades como; una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, crianza de animales menores y también se dedica a la venta de Chicha de Jora. 

Yaneth en esta oportunidad requiere el microcrédito para comprar maíz y para la mercadería de la como arroz, azucar y otras cosas mas. Yaneth  pertenece al banco comunal de “Villa Marcelo de Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 33 years old.  She was born in the community of Yanahuara in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco, Peru.  She is married and has one child.  Currently, Yaneth lives in the community where he was born.  Shs tells us that most of the people there engage in farming and raising cattle, but she has several businesses including a small grocery shop, raising young animals and also selling chichi de jora (a traditional drink made from fermented corn).

Yaneth needs the loan in order to purchase corn kernels for making chicha de jora and fruit for her shop.  Yaneth belongs to the Asociación Arariwa’s Villa Marcelo de Virgen del Carmen Communal Bank.

loans.use: to purchase corn and other merchandise, such as rice and sugar

loans.name: Anargul's Group

texts.en:
Anargul B., 53, is the leader of this group. She resides in Kadamjai, a small town in the Southern Kyrgyzstan. Out of her four children, her 11 year old daughter is the only one financially dependent upon her. 

For the past twelve years, Anargul has been running a business of baking and retailing bread and other baked goods. She uses unique recipes taught to her by her mother. This allows her bakery to stand out from other bakeries by its special taste quality. Anargul has worked out strategies of cost cutting and a more efficient production, which makes her bread affordable and allows her to acquire competitive advantage. Anargul thanks her friend, whose advice she followed. 

A monthly income of 4,000 soms allowed her family to purchase an automobile, which helps Anargul’s husband start cab driving. She plans to use the loan as an investment in the business. For the generated profits she would like to build a small grocery store.  

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase flour.

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Dolgor T. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in their own house in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her older son is unemployed while the younger one attends college. Her husband is a driver who conducts a taxi service business. 

She manages a timber trading business in her town. She started her business last year. She is planning to continue her business in the future. She is a polite woman who says, "I am trying hard to feed my family." 

She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT of loan to purchase more wood for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang Y. lives in the province of Siem Reap. She makes a living by selling a few Khmer cakes in and around her village. She can generate around $3 a day to help support the whole family. She is a widow. Her husband passed away years ago due to illness. She has a life partner in her daughter who is employed at a hotel and earns about $2 a day. She often shares her income with Lang Y.. Lang Y. will use her loan to buy a motorbike for her daughter to ride to work. This will reduce her travel expenses.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her daughter to ride to work.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: For the past 2 years, Esi has been selling kenkey (a popular Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough, usually eaten with pepper sauce and fried fish) in Abura near Brasi. She is a widow with 9 dependents, and the money she earns from her sales is used to take care of them. Her loan will be used to buy maize, pepper, tomatoes, corn husks and other ingredients to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a food joint. At the time of the visit, Esi had finished selling for the day and is showing the pan in which she sells the kenkey.

loans.use: to buy maize, pepper, tomatoes, corn husks and other ingredients to expand her business.

loans.name: Agip Women's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 36 years old and happily married with four kids. She is a trained nurse and for the past nine years has been operating a medical clinic in Mukono. Her nursing training is very important in her business. With determination, hard work and prayers, Margaret has made substantial progress.  She earns a monthly profit of approximately 30,000 UGX.

Margaret will use her portion of this group loan to purchase drugs and medical equipment to use in her clinic.

loans.use: to purchase drugs and medical equipment to use in her clinic

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 5 years, Mwanakombo has operated a clothing sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is competition from other clothes sellers in the area. Mwanakombo dreams of establishing another shop in the future.

Mwanakombo plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El grupo denominado Virgen del Rosario cuenta con 17 mujeres que trabajan de forma coordinada y organizada. Todas ellas se esfuerzan al máximo para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y familiares que de ellas dependen. Ellas se definen como mujeres jefas de familia que no temen al trabajo y que todo lo que hacen es para que sus hijos no pasen por aquellas carencias por las que ellas tuvieron que atravesar en su momento.
La Sra. Enma se dedica a la venta de hortalizas, es decir, todo tipo de verduras. Ella manifiesta que todos los días se levanta a muy tempranas horas de la mañana a buscar los productos frescos para salir a venderlos. Cada día que sale, lo hace con el deseo de traer mas ingresos a su familia.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas hortalizas, tales como lechugas tomates, repollos y demás, por que sabe que teniendo mas tipo de verduras podrá atraer a mas clientes, sumados a los que ya tiene.
Ella tiene el sueño de algún día poder armar armar en su casa un pequeño puesto donde vender sus mercaderías.
texts.en: The Virgen del Rosario group consists of 17 women who work together in a coordinated and organized way. All the women put in the maximum effort in order to be able to make headway for the children and family that depend on them. The members defined themselves as heads of the family who are not afraid to work and are willing to do whatever it takes so their children don't suffer the same hardships they have had to endure. One of the members is Enma, who makes a living selling all kinds of vegetables. She says that she gets up very early every day to look for fresh products that she can later sell. She does this every day with the desire to bring in more income for her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase more vegetables, such as lettuce, tomatoes, cabbage and others, because she knows that having more kinds of vegetables will attract even more customers than she already has. Her dream is to one day set up a small post in her home where she can sell her products.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables such as lettuce, cabbage, tomatoes and others.

loans.name: Ana Lucila

texts.es:
Ana, es comerciante, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, todos trabajan en su familia, y ella venD. ropa, este negocio lo estableció gracias al apoyo D. su madre, pues contaba con experiencia en este tipo D. venta para apoyarla, no tiene horario estable pues todo depenD. D. la demanda.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa, específicamente blusas, ropa interior, esta compra le ayudara a abastecer su negocio, ofrecer a los clientes mercadería nueva, permitiéndose crecer y mejorar su servicio a los clientes.
Para Ana su objetivo es tener el negocio abastecido, que los clientes se sientan satisfechos con la mercadería que ella ofrece, aumentar las ventas y así mismo tener una mejor oportunidad D. superación con su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a businesswoman who lives with her ​​husband and two sons.  They all work in her family, and she sells clothes.  This business was established with support from her mother because she had experience in this type of sale to support it.  Ana doesn't have a stable timetable because her work depends on demand.

Ana is currently seeking a loan to buy clothes, specifically shirts and underwear.  This purchase will help supply her business and offer customers new merchandise, enabling her to grow and improve her service to customers.

Ana's goals are to supply her business so that customers are satisfied with the merchandise it offers, increase sales and also have a better chance of overcoming challenges with her family.

loans.use: to purchase shirts and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Aiza has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages, & canned goods. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks. 

Aiza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Aiza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Fe has a food shop that sells viands like afritada, pancit bihon & caldereta. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy raw ingredients needed to cook viands to sell.

Fe is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to cook viands to sell

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: 42 year old Sophal is a farmer. Together with his wife he earns $7 per day. He has five children, all of whom are farmers who help to plow the farm to make money. Every month, he has to spend $80 on food, $20 on rent, and $25 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy groceries for his daughter to sell at home. This loan will help his daughter to have a career, to support herself, and to be able to make a better income then she can from farming. In the future, he wants to help his sons to study a skill that can help them to get a better job.

loans.use: To buy groceries for his daughter to sell at home

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 12 years. She is 39 years old and married to Murage. They have six school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Agnes hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a single woman with five children; two attend school while three graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four months, she has operated a business of cooking food for resale at an open-air market. Her potential customers are passersby and neighbors. She faces a challenge of an inadequate supply of food for the business. She dreams of expanding to establish a food stall in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, sugar, tea leaves, maize flour and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, sugar, tea leaves, maize flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
At her young age of 23, Estrella is now blessed with two children. To generate income and provide sustenance for the family, her spouse works as a farmer and Estrella involved herself in the business of buying and selling second-hand goods such as used bottles and plastics. She had been doing it for almost two years. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy more used bottles, plastics and newspapers to sell. This would help increase her earnings.

Someday, she hopes to provide a successful life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more used bottles, plastics and newspapers to sell.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is a 45-year-old married man with five children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in a retail shop business for 6 years in which he started with 300,000 UGX and now has 1,000,000 UGX as his working capital. His hardship is price fluctuations and his vision is a wholesale shop plus an educated family. Josephat needs the loan to buy rice and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 40 years old and is a window with two children aged between 8 and 15 years old. Eugenie owns a business selling various African clothing. This is her 12th successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 7 am until 7 pm every day except on Saturday. She currently employs 2 people to help her. 

Eugenie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more African clothes to sell. With any profit, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family, and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Juakali B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Juakali B Group in Western Kenya! With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Musabi and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February, 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Musabi is the facilitator of the Juakali B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Juakali group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize. In the picture, the field officer is standing on the far left.

Musabi takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Musabi had a very good maize yield harvesting 6 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Musabi was only able to harvest 1/2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. With income from maize sales, Musabi will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Fatiyah

texts.en:
Fatiya is single and has four children who attend school. She lives in a rented house in Kampala, Uganda and the family does not have access to electricity or piped water. 

Fatiya owns a food stall selling bananas, tomatoes, onions, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes on a retail basis. She has been in this business for eight years. She works seven days a week. 

Fatiya is requesting a loan for  600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy green banana, tomatoes, onions, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals are to own a fully stocked food stall, to start growing some foodstuffs, and to educate her children up to university level. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, tomatoes, onions, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Félix Antonio cuenta con una pequeña pulperia, su negocio solo tiene un mes de iniciado, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, pero su actividad principal es la venta de frutas y verduras en un mercado de la ciudad, tiene tres años de vender frutas y verduras, con su esposa mantenían ahorros y decidieron iniciar una pulpería para poder obtener otros ingresos, su esposa es muy trabajadora y se dedica a la Elaboración y venta de tortillas, juntos han logrado sacar adelante sus hijos y poco a poco ir realizando mejoras a su vivienda.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de productos para la pulpería y asi ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Félix Antonio has a small grocery store.  He has had his business for only one month.  It is located in his home, but his principal activity is selling fruits and vegetables in a market in the city.  He has been selling fruits and vegetables for three years.

He and his wife were maintaining their savings and they decided to open a grocery store to be able to get additional income.  His wife is very hardworking and works making and selling tortillas.  Together they have managed to get their children ahead and little by little they are making improvements to their house.

He will use the loan to buy products for his store to offer his customers greater variety.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, groceries, soda, bread, cookies, juice, milk, instant soup, eggs, tortillas, and dry grains.

loans.name: Naema

texts.en:
Naema is a 49-year-old lady, who has 2 daughters and one son. She dedicated all her time to her kids till they are now college students, and because of that she could not find a good job opportunity. 

Naema has a talent for making clothes from wool, and she used to make blouses and scarves, and gloves for her children. Now that two of her older children have entered college, Naema deicded to follow her passion and start a small business making clothes from wool to sell.

It has been two years now since she started, and people have started to recognize her and her work. She even was able to reach to some of the clothes shops to sell what she makes. Now Naema has applied for a loan to work on increasing her products and start working with wholesale traders so she can provide them with the required quantity and reach out to a bigger market.

loans.use: To buy more materials used for knitting clothes.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita, a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a scrap (recycled materials) business in the Philippines for 12 years, is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more plastic, metal, and bottles for her business. She earns additional income from raising pigs, shell crafting and food vending.

Benita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her enterprise to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like plastic, metal, and bottles.

loans.name: Moraima

texts.es:
Moraima, de 48 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de alegre y amable,  está separada desde hace 11 años, vive en compañía de su hija de 22 años y su nieto de 2 años de edad, instalados cómodamente en su casa propia. El negocio que tiene Moraima es la venta de comida, que lo realiza de lunes a viernes atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes logrando tener una buena acogida y demanda. Además los domingos venden parrilladas de pollos, realizando este negocio desde hace 10 años contando con la ayuda de su hija, iniciándose con un capital de un préstamo particular.
Le gusta su negocio pues comenta, le gusta cocinar y esto lo aprendio de su madre, los secretos para una buena sazón, así como el ingreso económico que le permite pagar sus cuentas y gastos de su hogar. Sin embargo no le gusta por el cansancio físico ya que tienen que levantarse muy de temprano por las mañanas para realizar los preparativos del día, pero eso no la desanima y continúa en su negocio. Lo que ahora planea es ampliar su negocio y mejorar su techado donde pueda atender más cómodamente a sus clientes. Este será el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además dice estar cómoda con su banco comunal ya que considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en el arreglo de su piso con cemento del mismo modo refaccionar su techo para así atender más cómodamente a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Moraima, 48, is hard-working and earnest, as well as happy and friendly. She has been separated for 11 years and lives comfortably in a house she owns, together with her 22 year-old daughter and 2 year-old grandson. Moraima's business is selling food, which she does from Monday to Friday. The friendly way she treats her customers has earned her a good reception and high demand. On Sundays, she also sells barbecued chicken. With her daughter's help, she has been running this business for ten years. She started it with capital from a private loan.

Moraima is pleased with her business and commented that she enjoys cooking and learned the secrets of good seasoning from her mother. This business is the economic means by which she is able to pay her bills and other household expenses. However, she dislikes the physical fatigue, as she has to get up very early in the morning to prepare for the day. Nevertheless, this does not discourage her and she continues with her business. She is currently planning to expand her business and to improve her roof so that she can more comfortably tend to her customers. This will be her tenth loan through Microfinanzas Prisma. She is hoping for your help so that she can cement her plans. She also says that she is comfortable with her communal bank and considers her fellow members to be responsible people. With the 1,000 nuevos soles that she is requesting, Moraima will invest in repairing her floor and roof with cement so that she can serve her customers more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement to repair the floor and roof of her property

loans.name: Kiwambi Matengo Masimeri Group

texts.en:
Vianery is a 44-year-old father of three children, one is attending secondary education. He is hard-working and has been producing maize, beans, and coffee for over five years. He is facing farming problems due to a lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Vianery is looking to expand his scale of production from five to 15 acres in five years. Then, he can earn more income that can be used to pay school fees, remedy the house, and cover medical expenses. 

In the attached photo, one member named Triphon is not pictured since she is seriously sick at the hospital.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en:
Aiga is 30 years old.  She is married and has three children.

Aiga owns and operates a business venture, raising pigs to sell.  She has three years of experience in this business.  Aiga is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 WST to purchase additional small piggies to raise and to buy animal feeds such as manure.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas per week) to improve and/or expand the business.

In 2009, Aiga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Aiga's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional small piggies to raise and animal feeds such as manure

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is 52 years old married woman, a mother of 4 children. she lives in Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan.
Huda is looking to have a loan of 400JDs thus she can buy new furniture for her home so it will be more comfortable for her family.
Huda is a conservative woman she is unwilling to upload her photo on internet, the photo is for her husband.

loans.use: to buy new furnitre for home

loans.name: Neng

texts.en:
Neng is 51 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in animal husbandry for more than ten years; she has extensive experience and is successful in her career. Neng is involved in raising pigs and poultry. She earns approximately $8 per day. Her husband helps her run the business; her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 per day. 

Neng is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a metal grid to build a fence around her farm. This money will help her keep her animals on the farm and easily control them. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: purchase a metal grid to build a fence around her farm.

loans.name: Artesanas De Chuchipaca Group

texts.en:
In the outskirts of the city of Chichicastenango the rural area of Chuchipacá is found. Here,  7 women give life to the “Artesanas de Chuchipacá” or “Artisans of Chuchipacá” trust bank, the majority working as artisans, embroidery and weaving of traditional blouses, shawls, scarfs, and belts, and 2 members working in agriculture, growing apples and peaches. 

María is 35 years old, and had the opportunity to complete her studies, graduating with a degree in teaching, but because she has not found work in this area, she currently dedicates to artisanry, embroidering and selling elaborate creations made up of  traditional design and textiles. Thanks to her intelligence and good administration as a businesswoman, María’s sales are increasing, and for this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy more high-quality threads of vibrant colors and various textures for her handiwork, improving her blouses, perrajes, or baby carrying-wraps, and other products. This hard-working mother plans to continue using her profits to offer a better future to her 2 children, providing them with food, health, and education. 

Thank you, Kiva investors around the world, for your valiant efforts in supporting women like María who are mothers, daughters, wives, extraordinary and determined businesswomen, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy more high-quality threads of vibrant colors and various textures for her handiwork, improving her blouses, perrajes, or baby carrying-wraps

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en:
Yuliana, 50 year old woman and is married to Daniel, 52 year old man. They have adopted 2 children who are Yandri, 18, 2nd grade of Senior High School; and Maria, 12, 1st grade of Junior School. 


Yuliana works as a weaver. Every day she starts weaving from 8 am in the morning and finish at 4 pm in afternoon. Her husband works as a farmer in their own farm. Once every week, Yuliana goes to a local market to sell the harvest as well as her woven cloth. 

Yuliana thinks to buy more yarn to produce more woven fabric because she often stop from finishing a woven due to run out of yarn.  So, Yuliana join with a group and received a loan  from TLM of IDR 1,750,000. This loan will be used  to buy yarn and half of that loan will be spent on fertilizer and seed for their farm.

loans.use: to buy more yarn for her weaving business and fertilizer and seeds for their farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The USD 600 loan will be used to include other soft drinks in her retail shop to meet her customers’ needs.

loans.name: Assou

texts.en:
Born to a family of producers of “sodabi” (a local drink made from the palm tree), Mr. Assou D. is a father of six children, all of whom are in school. He is in the family business of producing sodabi, a very popular drink in his town that is also highly sought after for holidays and celebrations. His wife does not work and does not contribute to the household income, which makes life difficult for Mr. D.. He has been noted for his ability to repay loans before the deadline and especially for his energy and over thirty years of experience in making sodabi. He is requesting a new loan of $800 to buy more production materials to increase his production yield, which will allow him to contribute more to the household income and to better meet his family's material and financial needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né d’une famille productrice de « sodabi » (boisson locale tirée du palmier), Monsieur D. Assou est père de famille de six (06) enfants, tous scolarisés. Comme héritage il produit du « sodabi » une boisson très appréciée dans la localité et surtout très recherchée en période de grandes cérémonies. Sa femme n’a aucune activité pour contribuer aux charges de ménage, ce qui pèse énormément sur Monsieur D.. Il s’est fait remarqué par sa capacité de remboursement avant échéance et surtout son dynamisme et son expérience depuis plus de 30 ans dans ce métier. Il sollicite de nouveau un crédit de$800 pour acheter plus de matériels en matières de production pour un meilleur rendement qui lui permettra ainsi de subvenir plus aux charges de la famille et pour un meilleur épanouissement social et financier.

loans.use: To buy African oil palms and other materials to produce “sodabi”

loans.name: Salomey

texts.en: Salomey has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She sells provisions and other items in her shop. She is seeking a loan of US$700.00 from Kiva to help her expand her sales.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Miroslav

texts.en:
Miroslav runs his own small printing business in the city of Ivano-Frankivsk in western Ukraine. He loves technology and he loves working for himself, so having this type of business has been a great fit for Miroslav. He has been in business for about ten years, and has developed a good name and loyal clientele. His reputation for quality at reasonable prices easily brings repeat customers.

Miroslav has requested a loan for $1000 to help him with the purchase of some necessary new equipment and to buy supplies of paper stock and ink. The equipment he’d like to purchase includes several new printers, a laminator and a cutting machine. Loans from Nadiya Ukraine have been an important ingredient in the success of Miroslav’s business. We are grateful for this opportunity to help him further develop and increase his trade.

loans.use: Miroslav would like to purchase equipment, paper and ink for his small printing business.

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.en:
Alma Rosa is a hard-working, enthusiastic woman. Her husband, unable to find a steady job, works as a waiter, bricklayer, or whatever other job is available. Even then, his income is often insufficient to cover the family's basic needs. Faced with this situation, Alma started her business selling cosmetics five years ago, when her children were still small and required diapers and milk. She was fortunate in that she was able to build a large clientele, thanks in part to the high quality products she sold.

She now fills large orders and is requesting this loan, which she will repay over a period of 6 months, to purchase additional inventory to meet demand. Alma and her family thank you for your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Alma Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta. Ante la falta de empleo su esposo realiza diversas actividades desde mesero hasta albañil, pero aun así el ingreso que obtiene es muy poco para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra Alma inició su negocio de venta de cosméticos desde hace cinco años, sus hijos estaban muy pequeños y requerían de leche y pañales, afortunadamente los productos que comercializa son de muy buena calidad y pronto logró incrementar su número de clientes.

Ahora ya surte grandes pedidos y para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes ahora Alma está solicitando un préstamo de $1,100 dólares, mismos que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien mas lo necesita, no lo pienses más, esta familia agradece mucho tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Abbasov

texts.en:
Mr. A. is a low income vulnerable person. He is 32, married with 2 children, and lives in the Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in Caucasus region.

A. and his wife (she is pictured) have owned and operated a small food market in the local bazaar of Saatli town for 10 years. The business is stable because A. has built up his customers during the time he has run the shop. But there is no money to diversify the assortment and increase sales, and therefore no income to provide all the necessities of life for his children.

Some commercial banks demand collateral to give him credit, but A. has nothing to mortgage. That's why he applied to Normicro Saatli branch, which disburses credit free of collateral, for a $500 loan. This credit could let him buy and sell larger amount of goods and develop business.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.en:
Gennadyi is married with a 20-year-old daughter. He and his family live in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine. Before Gennadyi started his taxi business, he worked at a radio factory as the head of a department. Today he works as taxi driver, providing transportation services all over Ukraine. His business is the only source of income for his family. He has been in this business for 8 years. His daily income is about $40-45.

Gennadyi doesn’t own his own vehicle. He rents a car and uses it as a taxi. He has many orders for transportation, but his car needs maintenance. That is why he is requesting a loan of $1000 to do major repairs on the car. One of his long-term plans is to buy the car he is renting at the moment. Gennadyi has promptly repaid previous loans and we are confident of his full repayment of the current loan.

loans.use: Major car repairs

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
Señora M. has spent the better part of her life just caring for her family and living off of her husband's income. However, after noticing that they were in a difficult economic situation, she decided to take out a loan to start a beauty salon in her home since she has skills in this trade. She started the salon in her home with her own savings and funds from Ceprodel. With this capital, she bought a mirror and scissors to offer services to her clientele, who are mainly merchants in La Estación market, since her house is very close to there.

Señora M. has benefited from five credits from Ceprodel, which she is thankful for because her business has grown quickly, and she has been able to improve her salon's conditions to offer good service to her clientele. She also is able to help her husband with the responsibilities of their home and raising their four kids.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Señora M., la mayor parte de su vida la ha dedicado solo a su familia viviendo de los ingresos del esposo sin embargo, al darse cuenta que la situación económica aun sigue difícil en el núcleo familiar decide realizar un préstamo para poner un salón de belleza en su hogar ya que ella presenta habilidades en este ramo. Inicia la actividad de belleza en su casa, con ahorros propios y parte con los obtenidos en Ceprodel. Al tener el capital, compra un espejo y algunas tijeras para brindar servicio a la clientela principalmente comerciantes del mercado La Estación por encontrarse su casa muy cerca de este lugar.

La señora M. ha sido beneficiada con cinco créditos por lo que declara que gracias a estos préstamos en Ceprodel el negocio ha incrementado rápidamente logrando tener mejores condiciones para brindar buen servicio a su clientela, además de ayudar al esposo con la responsabilidad del hogar y la formación de cuatro hijos.

loans.use: Working capital and construction of a beauty salon

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.en:
Isabel and Julia have belonged to the community bank “Iris Lanao” for six months. They are both from the countryside and travel for over an hour to attend meetings. From participating in the community bank, they have learned to be responsible, punctual, and to save.

Isabel is 19 years old. She and her mother run a store selling food staples such as wheat, flour, and sugar. Her mother, grandmother, and aunt are also members of the community bank. Isabel is also studying to be a nurse.

Julia is 33 and has five children. Her primary language is Quechua, but she speaks some Spanish. Julia also sells food staples from her home in the country. She has had her business for three years, and before that worked in the fields.

Isabel and Julia need loans of 600 and 1500 soles (3 soles = $1) respectively, which they will invest in their businesses by buying products such as flour, milk, beans, and sugar. The community bank emphasizes the importance of savings and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Isabel is saving to pay for nursing school and Julia is saving to buy furniture for her house. They dream of continuing to work hard and improving their quality of life.

loans.use: Isabel and Julia will invest in their businesses by buying products such as flour, milk, beans, and sugar.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca has been an associate of the “Chontaca” community bank for one year. She mentioned that the bank organizer has taught her how to invest her money, how to manage her business, and how to care for her children.

Francisca sells motor oil and gasoline from her home. She started this business because her husband is a mechanic, and she noticed that there was a demand for these items. She started the business and, since joining the community bank, has been able to expand her selection. Francisca also grows vegetables and raises animals that she later sells to middle men that visit her village.

Francisca needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying motor oil and gasoline.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Francisca plans to use her savings in the case of an emergency and to pay for her children’s education. Her dream is that her children receive a good education, that her business continues to grow, and to open a mechanic shop with modern machinery.

loans.use: Francisca needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying motor oil and gasoline.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Roland is 47 years old and married. His wife works as a fruit merchant, buying and selling fruit to help with the family's expenses. He has 5 children; the eldest 3 are working and independent. For 30 years, Roland has lived very happily in his small house surrounded by his plantation and the "Good Morning" of a beautiful sunrise every day: He rises before sunrise, and with love and hope he works the 3 fields of pineapple that generate his family's income. He is applying for a loan with which to buy the supplies necessary for the maintenance of his crop, including the vitamins to improve his production. These supplies will guarantee the quality of the harvest to which he has dedicated may hours of work during many months.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Rolando de 47 años de edad, es casado y su esposa se dedica al comercio, compra y vende frutas para apoyar en los gastos familiares de ellos y sus 5 hijos, de los cuales los 3 mayores trabajan y son independientes. El señor Rolando desde hace 30 años vive muy feliz en su casita rodeado de su plantación y los buenos días de un lindo amanecer todos los días que se levanta antes que salga el sol, con amor e ilusión trabaja sus 3 manzanas de piña las que genera el sustento de su hogar. Solicita un crédito para comprar todo el insumo necesario para el mantenimiento de la cosecha que es como la vitamina necesaria para que su producción sea de lo mejor, con estos insumos garantizara el éxito de la calidad de su producción la cual durante meses ha dedicado horas de trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural fertilizers for his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru:
Karomat K. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 45, divorced and has 3 children. She has finished high school. Karomat sells shoes on the market. She has been in this business for 13 years. It is the main source of income for her family. Karomat takes care of her children by herself, she wants to give them a good education, which costs money. Karomat divorced her husband when the children were still small.

Currently, she wants to buy seasonal goods, which is why she needs money. Karomat decided to ask for a loan. She plans to repay within 12 months

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Каримова Каромат жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 45 лет,разведенная ,имеет 3 детей. Образование средние. Каромат торгует на рынке обувью. Занимается бизнесом более 13 лет. Эта деятельность является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Каромат сама растит своих детей,хочет дать им хорошее образование,что стоит денег. С мужем Каромат развелась,когда дети были еще маленькими. В данный момент клиентка хочет закупить сезонный товар,на что ей нужны деньги. Каромат решила взять кредит. Планирует погасить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Tek

texts.en: Tek P. is a 41-year-old widow living in Kampong Cham province. She has earned her living selling fruits since she was but a girl in 1979 when the Khmer Rouge regime first lost power in Cambodia.
