She earns $11 (US) per day total, although much of this revenue goes back into purchasing fruit. She has two children still living in her home she cares for. Her elderly mother takes care of the children while she goes to work each day. She wants a loan to put her ahead in the fruit business. She will buy more expensive fruits in higher demand like mangos. She hopes to someday be able to afford a hand cart, which she could use to transport her fruit in greater quantities every day to the market. She is pictured here with her elderly mother.

loans.use: To buy mangos and other fruits.

loans.name: Las Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.en:
Panilus E. is a mother of two young boys (ages 2 and 9).  She moved to the small community of Momjor, just outside of Puerto Plata just several months ago, where she lives alone selling clothing on the streets.  She made the move, leaving behind her two children to live with their grandmother, so that she would be able to find a way to pay for their education.  When asked if she would like them to come and join her here in the Dominican Republic, she quickly responded, “No”.  While not many complete the education system in Haiti (for lack of funds), it is a far superior education to that of the public schools in the Dominican Republic.  Panilus has left everything she knows to fulfill her dream of putting her children through school in Haiti.  The money from this loan will be used to buy more pants, shirts, and shoes to sell on the streets of Momjor.  Panilus hopes that someday she will be able to afford the rent of a small store to sell her clothes from.

Panilus E. is just one member of the 10 person micro-bank, Las Mujeres Unidas.  Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own.  The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.

On behalf of Panilus, Las Mujeres Unidas, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To buy more skirts, pants, t-shirts to sell in the street.

loans.name: Edjossan

texts.fr:
Mr. Edjossan A., a farmer in Afangbédjicopé, was born in 1975 in Attitogon. A father of four, he is married to a goods seller with whom he lives. Known to his business neighbors as a nice man, Mr. Edjossan A. never misses a crop season. This year, his land became sparse. To fertilize it, he is seizing the opportunity to get a loan to buy fertilizer in order to expect a good harvest. This way, he will be able to better provide for his children, especially in regards to schooling, health, and food.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Edjossan, cultivateur demeurant Afangbédjicopé, est né en 1975 à Attitogon. Père de quatre enfants, il est marié à une revendeuse avec qui il vit toujours. Bien connu par ses voisins d’activités comme un brave homme, Monsieur A. Edjossan ne manque aucune saison de culture. Cette année, ses terres sont devenues très pauvres. Pour les fertiliser, il vient saisir de cette occasion pour bénéficier d’un crédit pour acheter de l’engrais afin d’espérer à une bonne récolte. Par ce moyen, il pourra réussir à mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants surtout en matière de scolarité, de santé et alimentaire.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for farmland

loans.name: Mohbigul

texts.ru: Давлатова Мохбигуль бизнесмен. Занимается торговлей. Опыт работы в данной сфере 6 лет. Имеет магазин , который арендует , продает продукты питания. Бизнес дает неплохой доход , но для увеличения объема продаж необходимо финансовое вливание. Поэтому она планирует получить кредит и увеличить ассортимент товара. Ее магазин является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Муж не работает , а дети еще совсем маленькие. Но несмотря на это все они живут дружно и весело. Погашать кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев
texts.en:
Mohbigul D. is a businesswoman. She has been involved in retail business for the past six years. Mohbigul sells food in a shop that she rents. The business is quite profitable but in order to increase cash flow, Mohbigul needs more capital. She would like to obtain a loan to increase the assortment of goods. Her shop is the only source of income for her family. Her husband does not work and her children are very little. The family is very friendly and merry. Mohbigul willl be able to pay off the loan within the next six months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Both

texts.en:
This is the second time Mrs. Both P. has asked for a loan in order to improve her business activity. She lives in Ponlai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. 

She is a tailor who processes cloth into dresses. Since this business is going well, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fabric to meet the needs of her customers. 

Her husband, Mr. Vann Sarann, is a high school teacher who can make $50 per month. 

Mrs. Both P. is 29 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Both P. obtained a loan to buy piglets for breeding and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy more fabric to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Yadira Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Yadira tiene 42 años de edad,  habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Villa Reconciliación, tiene  cuatro hijos de 1,15, 20 y 21 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en servicios de seguridad, el negocio de doña Yadira es la venta de de perfumes, cosméticos, ropa y zapatos, tiene siete años de experiencia en las ventas e inicio con dinero propio con ayuda de su esposo y su hijo. Con la solicitud del préstamo lo quiere para infraestructura pues su deseo es hacer mejoras a un cuarto para alquilarlo y así tener otros ingresos, para eso desea comprar materiales de construcción como arena, cemento, hierro. A largo plazo es hacer mejoras en la infraestructura del negocio, comprar vitrinas para que los productos estén mas alusivos a los clientes, también desea tener mas inventario, que le generen mas ganancias, ayudar a sus hijos con la educación de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yadira is 42-years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood in the capital city of Managua, Nicaragua. She has four children ages 1, 15, 20 and 21 and her husband works as a security guard. Mrs. Yadira has a business where she sells perfumes, cosmetics, clothes and shoes. With the help of her husband and children, she has been in business for the past seven years. With this loan request, she wants to make improvements as she desires to build a better room to rent as another form of income. She will need construction materials like: sand, cement and iron. A future goal would be to make improvements to the business, purchase showcases for very allusive products, build up a sizeable inventory and generate more profits. Additionally, Mrs. Yadira also wants to help her children with their educational studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and make a room

loans.name: Kholmamat

texts.en:
Kholmamat S. is 58 years old. He is married and he has three independent children. 

Kholmamat is a farmer. He has been working in agriculture for ten years. In this time he has gained much experience and a love for the land. He began cultivating his land through his own efforts and has gradually gotten ahead in life. He has been growing such crops as wheat, onions and potatoes. Each year he has produced a yield sufficient for both the family to consume and for Kholmamat to sell in the market. 

The business is his main source of income. While it generates a stable income, it also requires considerable funding. This is especially true because Kholomamat wants to grow the farm. He currently has an orchard and dreams of building a workshop so he can process fruits and vegetables. 

Today he is asking for a loan of 700 Somoni ($225 USD). Kholmamat would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and to improve production. This will allow him to increase the quality of his yield and his earnings at the time of sale. The loan will be repaid in 6 months. 

Kholmamat and his family are counting on your help. He thanks all those supporting him and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Essoyo-Mewe

texts.fr:
Madame B. esso-mewe est née le 31 décembre 1968 à tchitchao dans la préfecture de la Kozah au nord du Togo. Elle habite dans le quartier d’Agoe sogbossito, elle divorcée de son mari EGBAME Komlan qui est technicien en génie civil et ont six enfants (06). Elle est revendeuse de boissons et s’approvisionne à lomé. Elle a un bar dans le quartier d’Agoè assiyéyé.  Madame B. a déjà obtenu un crédit de 300000F chez WAGES qu’elle a remboursé sans contraintes.
Avec l’expérience dans son commerce qu’elle  exerce depuis 1999 et la gestion du crédit, elle sollicite un deuxième crédit d’un montant de 500000F pour agrandir son stock qui est fini avec soixante dix casiers (70) de bières et vingt neuf (29) casiers de sucrerie.
texts.en:
Mrs, Essoyo-Mewe B. was born on December 31, 1968 in Tchitchao in the prefecture of Kozah in the north of Togo. She lives in the neighborhood of Agoè Sogbossito. She is divorced from her husband Komlan Egbame, a technician; they have 6 children. She sells drinks and does her buying in Lomé. She has a bar in the neighborhood of Agoè Assiyéyé. Mrs. B. has already had a loan of 300,000 F from WAGES and reimbursed it correctly.

With the experience from her business which she has been in since 1999, and having managed the previous loan, she is requesting a second loan in the amount of 500,000 F to expand her stock, which is presently expended, with 70 crates of beer and 29 cases of sweet drinks.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of drinks

loans.name: Silun

texts.en:
Mrs. Silun M., 28, and her husband, Mr. M. Mer, 35 who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 2001 and have two daughters. One of them attends school and the other daughter is still young.

Silun has been a tailor for three years. Her husband has been raising pigs for three years as well. Silun is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to build a pigpen for her husband's pigs and to purchase rice for re-sale.

loans.use: To build a pigpen for her husband's pigs and to purchase rice for re-sale

loans.name: Adijat

texts.en:
Adijat lives in Akesan, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and married with 2 children.

Adijat runs a shop from her home where she sells drinks. This arrangement means she does not have to pay for shop rent. She opens her shop daily from 6am to 11pm.

She is a client of LAPO. She needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
Eveline O. recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya.

As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Eveline decided to work with K-MET because, she says, it is a good community network and the organization can help the community grow.

Eveline is 36 years old, has been married for 25 years, and is the mother of a 17-year-old daughter who currently attends form 3 in secondary school.

In 2004 Eveline went from being a housewife to a small business owner. She began thinking, “If I can sell chapatti, I can help my child.” As an accomplished cook, Eveline knew that she could make chapatti (a soft flat bread) that would sell. The business started that year and Eveline has been successfully selling chapatti over the last 5 years.

She has applied for her first loan from K-MET, requesting approximately $150 in order to purchase paraffin and flour.

loans.use: To purchase paraffin and flour

loans.name: Johana Maria

texts.es: Doña Johana vende ropa desde hace veinticinco años, que inicio con dinero propio y préstamo que Afodenic ha otorgado, este negocio lo inicio con el objetivo de ayudar a su familia, tiene 42 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa reconciliación con cuatro hijos dos de ellos mayores de edad, los cuales trabajan, su esposo trabaja de conductor es por eso que desea crecer en inventario ya que el salario de su esposo es bajo y todo esta caro, lleva once créditos en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de ropa para niño, damas y caballeros, también va invertir en la compra de prendas de plata que se esta vendiendo mucho. Con esto espera obtener mejores ingreso y captar clientes.
texts.en:
Johana has sold clothing for 25 years, something she started doing with her own money and with a loan that Kiva partner Afodenic authorized. She started this business with the goal of helping her family. She is 42 years old, living in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood with four children, two of whom are older and working. Her husband works as a conductor, ** and this is why she wants to build her inventory - because her husband's salary is low and everything is expensive. She has received 11 loans from Kiva partner Afodenic, and with this one she will purchase clothing for children, women, and men, as well as purchase silver pieces, which are selling well. Through this, she hopes to earn more income and attract more customers. **Translator's note: The meaning of the word "conductor" is slightly vague. It is most likely that Johana's husband is a driver for some type of public transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for children and adults, as well as silver pieces

loans.name: Halicha

texts.ru: Борлиева Хатича  замужем , 1966 года рождения, у нее 4 детей.   С Микроинвест сотрудничает месяц. Дома содержит скот,  после откорма продает на рынке. Муж находиться в России на заработки, время о времени присылает деньги, для ее и детей.  Основной доход продажа скота и посев сельского хозяйства. Весной продает зелень и корневые плоды, летом фрукты, и осенью овощи, а также виноград, который идет на завод для обработки вина и других изделий. Ей тяжело одной без мужа и поэтому  она решила получить кредит, что бы улучшить семейное положение.
texts.en:
Halicha B. is married, she was born in 1966 and she has 4 children. Halicha has been working with MicroInvest for one month. She raises livestock at home, after fattening it, she sells it at the market. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia and from time to time sends money home for her and for the children. Halicha’s main income comes from selling livestock and from agriculture. In the spring she sells greens and root vegetables, in the summer fruits and in the autumn vegetables. In addition, she sells grapes which are sent to a plant for making wine and other grape products. It is hard for Halicha to be alone without a husband and this is why she decided to take out a loan, in order to improve her family situation.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Kikiafu 1 Anyuru Vicky Group

texts.en: Ms. A. Vicky is aged 38 years, married with 4 children, 1 girl and 3 boys who all go to school. She will use her share of this group loan to purchase items in bigger volume for her retail shop, that is bags of sugar, groundnuts, beans, and maize flour and jerricans of cooking oil. She has owned a retail shop for over 6 years and she dreams of buying land where she will construct rental houses.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Aïssatou Combé

texts.fr: Aïssatou Combé D. est âgée de 57ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, plus 4 neveux  dont elle a la charge. Elle souhaiterait promouvoir son activité de vente de pâte d’arachide et d’huile de palme. Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses enfants, de même ceux de sa sœur décédée dont elle a la charge.
texts.en:
Aïssatou Combé DRAM, age 57, is married and the mother of three children, plus she has four nephews in her care. She would like to advance her business selling peanut butter and palm oil. Her objective is to provide for her children, as well as for her deceased sister's children, who she is supporting.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell peanut butter and palm oil

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita T., a 38-year-old mother, lives in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur--a town of 32,233 people whose livelihood is predominantly from agriculture. She has two children and a rice farm business. Her husband, Jonie T., manages their rice farm. Their harvest is for family consumption; however, there are also times that they sell some rice to their neighbors to supplement their family income.

Mercedita would like a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase new seeds, fertilizers and herbicides. She thinks that by doing so, she will be able to improve their harvest.

CEVI is reaching out to farmers to sustain their livelihood. CEVI gives its clients more than just loans. Training and insurance coverage are provided as well.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: İsmayıl

texts.en:
İsmayıl N. is 60 years old, married, and the father of two children. He owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue generated by it. In addition, he is a cultural section worker.

İsmayıl is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase the stock of foodstuffs in his grocery store and also to buy construction materials.

İsmayıl is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children will progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for his grocery store plus construction materials

loans.name: Mouena

texts.en:
Mouena C., 28, is married with one child. She has three years of experience in her plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public three days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Mouena’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weedkiller, chemicals, knives, a sharpener and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 62 years old and the mother of five children. Three attend school and the other two are working.

To support her household, Martha has been selling cereals like beans, onions, and groundnuts in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She lives in a cocoa farming community, which makes her goods more in demand. She says that selling these products is very lucrative, and therefore she wants a loan to expand her inventory. She started her business with a small amount of working capital but now her customer base has increased. She wants the loan to meet those hard pressing demand. The loan will enable her make a better income to support her family, especially in their education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnut, onions, and beans

loans.name: Sari's Group

texts.en:
Sari A. is the group leader of six members who live in Prey Kla village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land for cultivating rice, and she also breeds chickens.  The soil on her rice field is infertile which affects her crop badly, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to plow the field. Sari is forty-three years old and a widow with one child who breeds cows. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans' term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients stA. to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to plow the field.

loans.name: Susanie

texts.en:
Susanie L. is from Valencia City. She is 48 years old. Susanie is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Susanie owns and operates a business selling vegetables and spices in the local community. Susanie has been in business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Susanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susanie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Susanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her vegetable selling business

loans.name: Carmen Magdalena

texts.es:
La microempresaria Carmen Magdalena M. W. tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera de la etnia creole tiene dos hijos adultos los cuales ya tiene formados su propio hogar, la señora M. se dedica desde hace mas de 10 años a vender fritos y principalmente comidas típicas de la región como es el caso de la sopa mixta de mariscos como el rondón (comida hecha a base de coco, yuca, quequisques y otros productos).

Esta actividad la realiza dos o tres veces a la semana y es visitada por habitantes de barrios negros de esta ciudad quienes llegan a comprar sus comidas y se las llevan empacadas a sus casas. En la venta de estos productos ofrece un día la sopa mixta y otro día el rondón.

La señora M. ya fue beneficiada con un crédito de kiva y aprovecha para agradecer a los prestamistas que hicieron realidad este préstamo el cual lo pago en tiempo y forma y a la vez solicita se le financie para comprar los siguientes productos:

80 libras de Pollo le cuesta a US 1.90 cada libra, 55 unidades de cocos le cuesta a US 0.60 cada coco, 80 libras de carne de res le cuesta a US 2.00 cada libra, 50 libras de pescado le cuesta a US 2.00 cada libra, 30 libras de camarón le cuesta a US 5.50 cada libra, 1 quintal de arroz americano le cuesta a US 45.00 cada quintal, 1 quintal de azúcar le cuesta a US 35.00 cada quintal, 35 sacos de carbón le cuesta a US 5.00 cada saco, 1 bidón de aceite le cuesta a US 35.00 cada bidón, 80 libras de quequisque le cuesta a US 0.40 cada libra, 100 unidades de plátanos le cuesta a US 0.40 cada plátano y 80 libras de  yuca le cuesta a US 0.35 cada libra.
texts.en:
Small businesswoman Carmen Magdalena M. W. is 61 years old, and is a single mother of Creole ethnicity. She has two grown children who have their own homes. Señora M. has sold fried foods and other dishes that are typical of the region such as mixed seafood soup and rondón (a dish made with coconut, yucca root, taro root, and other products) for over 10 years. She carries out this activity 2 or 3 times per week, and is visited by the inhabitants of black neighborhoods of this city who come to buy her meals and take them in containers to their houses. One day she will offer the mixed seafood soup, and the other day the rondón.

Señora M. was already the beneficiary of a Kiva loan which she paid off on time, and she wants to take this opportunity to thank the lenders who made her this loan. At the same time she requests additional funding in order to purchase the following products: 80 pounds of chicken that costs US$ 1.90 per pound, 55 coconuts that cost US$ 0.60 each, 80 pounds of beef that costs US$ 2.00 per pound, 50 pounds of fish that costs US$2.00 per pound, 30 pounds of shrimp that costs US$5.50 per pound, 100 pounds of American rice that costs US$ 45.00, 100 pounds of sugar that costs US$35.00, 35 bags of coal that costs US$ 5.00 per bag, a drum of cooking oil that costs US$ 35.00, 80 pounds of taro root that costs US$ 0.40 per pound, 100 bananas that cost US$ 0.40 per banana, and 80 pounds of yucca root that costs US$ 0.35 per pound.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chicken, coconuts, beef, fish, shrimp, American rice, sugar, coal, cooking oil, taro root, bananas and yucca root

loans.name: Jelisa

texts.en:
Jelisa B. has been in business for eight years now. She is 47 years old and lives in the upland town of Silang in the province of Cavite.

Jelisa owns and manages a tailoring shop where she makes dresses for various people. Adjacent to her tailoring shop is a plastic wares store which she opened recently. Both businesses are situated inside the Silang Public Market. She earns close to P 15,000 net income per month from the combined operation of these businesses.

She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006, the same year she established her plastic wares store. She enjoys a lot of benefits from the cooperative. Her businesses grew dramatically. From her profits, she was able to purchase a plot of land and her future project is to build her own house on it. She was also able to purchase an additional sewing machine.

Jelisa is asking for a loan in the amount of P22,000 for the expansion of her tailoring shop. She’s now geared toward saving more to be able to build her own house soon.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est lancée en 2002 dans le commerce des produits d’alimentation générale dans sa boutique, située dans le quartier d’Ahligo à Lomé. Elle est mariée à un mécanicien chauffeur et le couple a 03 enfants ; cette activité permet à cette dame d’aider financièrement son mari dans l’éducation scolaire de leurs enfants. Actuellement son étalage est presque vide ; c’est pourquoi elle  sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour disposer de nouveaux stocks. Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter 05 cartons d’eau minérale, 12 cartons de macaroni, 10 cartons de lait Nestlè, 08 cartons de tomates en boîtes, des cartons de savons de toilettes et 10 cartons d’eau de javel. Elle n’a aucune inquiétude pour rembourser son prêt dans les délais qui seront exigés.

loans.use: Achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en: Estrellita S. is from the town of Canunan, Guipos, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Estrellita owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month. In 2008, Estrellita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Estrellita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 34-year-old single mother of two teenage children, a girl and a boy. For the past three years, she has run a kiosk selling food like chapati and ndengu (like peas but more nutritious). Previously, she supported her family by washing clothes for others at a fee. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase cooking items in wholesale for the kiosk, such as flour and cooking oil.

She describes herself as honest and hardworking and says that since she joined Faulu she has gained more knowledge on business management and improved her savings skills. In the future, she hopes to stabilize her business and move to permanent premises.

loans.use: To purchase cooking items

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita B. is from the town of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old. Pedrita is married and has 8 school-aged children.

To make a living, Pedrita owns & operates a a sari-sari (variety) retail store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Pedrita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,700 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pedrita joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedrita successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting her third loan, for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

Pedrita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Jackson Kariuki

texts.en:
Jackson is a 40-year-old married man with two children, a son and a daughter. His wife’s name is Rahab and together they have been operating a butchery stall for the past eight years. Jackson is also employed as a driver with a private institution. (We have posted Jackson's wife's photo on the Kiva profile because Jackson was outside his home town when the Kadet credit officer visited the business.)

Jackson and his wife are planning to purchase a motorcycle with the loan he has applied for to reduce the cost of transporting meat from the slaughter house to the butchery, which is expensive because he has to hire public vehicles.

Jackson's hopes and dreams are to own a Nissan vehicle which will be used for offering public transport. He is also intending to educate his children to the highest level possible. 

Jackson describes himself as a determined person and feels he can make it in life.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transporting meat from his butchery.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es una emprendedora mujer de 48 años, comparte su vida con William, su esposo, de 54 años, con su hija Mireya de 23, la pareja de ésta, y con su pequeña nieta, Sarai de 8 años, todos viven juntos en su casa propia.Desde hace algunos años  se dedica a la administración de su taller de producción de estructuras metálicas , negocio familiar con el cual se ayuda económicamente, además le proporciona la experiencia necesaria para lograr una estabilidad laboral y económica, ya siempre  tiene gran cantidad de pedidos, gracias a los buenos acabados que realizan. Nancy se siente reconfortada ya que puede trabajar todos los días al lado de su familia, con los que  sale adelante para poder forjarse un futuro prometedor, aunque algunas veces el trabajo le resulta muy cansado, sabe que todo se logra a base de  mucho esfuerzo es por esta razón  que siempre anima a su esposo para  seguir mejorando por el bienestar de su familia, y ya  tiene pensado seguir en este rubro y comprar mas cantidad de maquinaria para ampliar el negocio.Es el octavo préstamo que tiene  con MFP y siempre es  muy puntual con todos los pagos.Con el dinero del crédito quiere comprar otra máquina para así empezar a ampliar  su negocio y proyectarse al futuro.
texts.en:
Nancy is an enterprising 48-year-old woman, who lives in her own house with her 54-year-old husband William, her daughter Mireya (who is 23) and her partner, as well as her granddaughter, 8-year-old Sarai. For some years she has managed the family's metal shop, which has given them an income and provided her with the experience needed to achieve a stable working life and finances. Because of her good work, she always has a stack of orders. Nancy feels strengthened by working daily with her family, for as a team they have been successful and their future is promising. Although the work is sometimes tiring, she knows that one achieves through effort. For this reason, she constantly proposes improvements to her husband, for the wellbeing of the family. She plans to continue in this work, and purchase equipment to expand the business. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and she has always been punctual with her payments. She wishes to use the loan proceeds to buy an additional machine and begin to grow her business to move towards the future.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: machinery for her shop

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna P. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old. Luna is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Luna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use items in the local community. Luna is just starting this business.

In 2009, Luna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Luna is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to build up her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: No. 08 Group

texts.en:
Renuka is group leader of this group. She is 35 years old and she has a business doing food production.  She buys food production materials twice a week from the market, then she makes lunch packets.  She can usually sell 10 packets per day.  Now, she needs  20000 LKR to increase the number of items she can sell.  She is married and currently lives with her husband.
 
Another member of this group is Mahatanthila.  She is 41 years old and she has one saL.for increasing beauty in the culture.  She wants to expand her business and create new employment, so she needs 20000 LKR to purchasing more new instruments.

Silva is other member in this group and she is 44 years old.  She is doing a tailoring business.  Right now she has one machine, but she want to buy new machine to develop her business. She needs 20000 LKR to buy a new machine.

Mallika is the fourth member in this group. She is 48 years old and she does business selL. fruits with her husband. Her husband always supports her in the business.  Right now, she does not have enough money to develop her business, so she needs a loan of 20000 LKR.

Maduka is the final member in this group.  She is 38 years old.  Her business is also tailoring and for now she doing her business aL..  She wants to buy a new machine to develop her business.  She needs a loan of 20000 LKR for that purpose.

loans.use: Rice,Vegetable,Fish,Meat and speces purchse

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena sells crates of eggs at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to be a major distributor of eggs in her community in Sapele. She hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more crates of eggs to sell.

Philomena is 43 years old and married with four children who are excelling in their education. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs to sell

loans.name: Hiezel

texts.en:
Hiezel has been married to her husband, Ronie, for 18 years. They have five children, whom they send to school. 

Hiezel and her family live on farming. She and her husband till a rice field to be able to provide for the growing needs of the family. When free of farming duties, her husband does welding to have extra earnings.

It is Hiezel’s first time to join an MFI, and she is hopeful that its program will be really helpful to her farming. She requested a loan of PHP 6,000. She will use this loan to buy farming necessities, such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farming necessities, such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jantsanhuu

texts.en: Jantsanhuu is 61 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a small house which they own. They have been living there for the past 20 years. Jantsanhuu operates a carpentry business with the help of his wife and two sons at home. They manufacture a variety of wooden furniture. He and his two sons are responsible for the carpentry work and his wife paints the products. Jantsanhuu has been operating his business since 1994 after previously working as a musician at the local music center for 26 years. He has steadily grown and expanded his business into a successful operation over the last 16 years. He has gained much experience operating his business and has become an experienced wood craftsman. Jantsanhuu is a very open-minded person and is working hard to continue his success into the future. He has been planning to expand his production line to include full carved furniture used in gers, which are traditional Mongolian tent homes. He says, “My life is going well. As it stands, I am concentrating on making effective use of the loan to reach my goals.” Jantsanhuu is requesting a 1,300,000 tugrug loan to purchase necessary materials such as timber, nails and paint for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his business

loans.name: Wali Ahmad

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is Wali Ahmad son of S. Mohammad Pacha. He is 30 years old and married. He has a retail shop in Kama district, and he wants to take an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the purpose of purchasing the essential materials for his shop such as beverages, sanitary products like shampoo, and soap.  These materials will help him to progress his business, and attract more customers who will be able meet all their needs in the district. This is his only business and he uses its income to supports his family members.

He would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders who support people around the world through their effective process.

loans.use: to complete his stocks

loans.name: Maria Karina

texts.es:
La señora es de la ciudad de Guayaybi Calle 2000 Def. Del Chaco, es casada, con 3 hijos, su esposo es encargado de una Estación de servicios.
La señora es propietaria de la MINISHOP(venta de bebidas y comestibles) ,se dedica a la ventas de bebidas,golosinas,comidas rápidas en general, servicio de Maxi y Mini carga para teléfonos celulares,  ventas de tarjeta para teléfonos celulares, la señora comenzó con un pequeño negocio ahora gracias gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación  ha ampliado bastante  su negocio. 
Actualmente ya cuenta con gran cantidad de mercaderías.
Su sueño es tener un salón comercial para poder brindar un buen servicios a sus clientes, solicita el crédito para comenzar ha construir el salón comercial.
Es una señora honesta trabajadora y responsable esta muy agradecida por la ayuda y el buen servicios que le brinda la entidad.
texts.en:
This woman is from the city of Guayaybi, Street 2000, Def. Del Chaco. She is married and has three children. Her husband is in charge of a service station. She owns a Mini-shop (where she sells drinks and food). She sells drinks, sweets, general fast foods, Maxi and Mini chargers for cell phones, and cards for cell phones. She started with a small business, and now, thanks to her effort and dedication, her business has expanded quite a bit. She currently has a great quantity of merchandise. Her dream is to have a commercial salon to be able to offer good services to her customers. She is requesting the loan to start building the commercial salon. She is a hard-working and responsible woman. She is very grateful for the help and the good services given by this entity

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bricks

loans.name: Kolla Marca Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Alto Lima, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal KOLLA MARCA. Se agruparon por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les permita mejorar sus negocios.
Las integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios del área de producción, servicio y comercio. 
Un ejemplo claro es Florencia P. de 43 años, recuerda que esta con la familia de Pro Mujer hace 6 años, a invitación de una amiga, ella se dedica   a la fabricación de pelotas y con el préstamo tiene planificado comprar cuerina, blader y cáñamo al por mayor, ya que con ellos, fabrica su producto.
A Florencia le gusta asistir al consultorio porque la orientan sobre la salud de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The “Kolla Marca” Communal Association meets every two weeks at the Alto Lima Community Center. They joined together in order to access the capital needed to improve their businesses. The members of this Association have different businesses in the manufacturing, service, and retail sectors.

One clear example is Florencia P., who is 43 years old. She recalls joining the Pro Mujer family six years ago after being invited by a friend. Florencia manufactures balls and plans to use her loan to buy imitation leather, bladders (the core of a soccer ball that holds the air, usually made of latex or synthetic rubber), and hemp in bulk so that she can continue producing her products.

Florencia enjoys going to the Pro Mujer sponsored clinic because she receives health advise for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for manufacturing sports balls

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria tiene 46 años de edad y ella empezó su negocio de comerciante ambulante hace mas de 30 años.  Ella viaja hasta El Salvador y Honduras donde compra y vende sus productos.

Maria ha tenido otros préstamos y con ellos a logrado mejorar su negocio y su condiciones de vida.

Maria vive en León y tiene 5 hijos de 17, 19, 21, 25, y 28 años de edad.  Uno de sus metas para su negocio es tener suficiente capital para trabajar por sí sola.
texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old. She has been working as a roving salesperson for the past thirty years. She has traveled as far as El Salvador and Honduras in order to buy and sell her products. Maria lives in Leon and has five children ages 17, 19, 21, 25, and 28. One of her goals for her business is to have sufficient capital so that she can be self-employed.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various clothes and other products

loans.name: Andeoye

texts.en:
D. R. Andeoye is a hardworking businesswoman, forty-two years old, who is married with seven children, all schooling. Three of them are in institutions, two in secondary schools, and two of them are in primary school.

D. owns a drugstore business located in Hawker market and she has been running the business for the last ten years. She is using the loan to purchase various drugs for her drugstore. She is a promising business woman whose dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase various drugs for her drugstore

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline has been operating a hair and beauty salon from home, offering services to passersby and neighbors for the past three years. Her previous occupation was being a school teacher. She is married with two boys; both attend school. Her other source of income comes from her husband's salary.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan, she wants to purchase a blow dryer and cosmetics and pay for a business license. Caroline hopes to have a big and well equipped beauty parlor in the future. She joined Yehu to acquire a loan and invest in her business.

Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. Caroline rents a house with electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer and comestics and pay for a business permit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros S. is a middle-aged woman whose husband appears in the photo. She has three young children who attend school and depend on her income. A year ago, she started a job as a sewing employee in the garment industry, while her husband has been a construction foreman for eight years. He has a few employees who help provide his service. Ros S. will be using the part of the loan she requested to pay school fees for her children, and any remaining cash from the loan she will use to buy a second-hand motorcycle to provide transportation for her family.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children and to buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Asemgul's Group

texts.en:
Asemgul M. is the leader of this group. She is thirty-one and married. She has four children: her sons are twelve and eight and her daughters are eleven years old and eleven months. The three elder children are studying in the US and her youngest daughter is at home. Her husband helps her to keep house. 

Asemgul makes felt mat and sells them in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan). Her neighbor showed her how to make felt mats and five years ago she decided to make money out of them. She started back then with an initial investment of 5000 soms. Now, she makes 15,000 soms each month. With the profits received she bought dishes, carpets, and blankets and significantly improved her family’s nutrition. She is applying to buy materials (wool) for increasing turnover. With the profits received from her business, she is planning to buy cattle and her husband will mainly  raise cattle. This is their plan to increase profits.

Group members: 

Ulukbiubiu Z. is treasurer of the group. She is forty-three and divorced. She has four children: her sons are twenty-four, twenty-one and eighteen and her daughter is seven. She sells convenience goods at her stand. Ten years ago, she started her business selling just drumsticks with an initial investment of 5000 soms. On the profits from selling drumsticks, she was able to buy a stand and increase her assortment. Now, her business brings her in 13,000 soms each month. She is applying for a loan to buy additional convenience goods and increase her assortment and her turnover. Also, with the loan received she is planning to buy a milch cow and sell milk in the mornings. In the future, with the profits from her business she is planning to buy cattle and significantly increase their number.

Shaidylda K. is sixty-three and married. He has four children: his sons are twenty-five and twenty-three and his daughters are thirteen and twelve. His elder son is steelman, his second son is a welder and his daughters are studying in the US. In order to provide for his family, he sells convenience goods at a stand near his house. His children help him in their free time. He started his business after immigration from Tajikistan when they bought a house, a pavilion and goods for resale. Seven years ago, they started their business with an initial investment of 7000 soms and they make 5200 soms each month. He is applying for a loan in order to buy a milch cow. He is planning to sell milk in his convenience pavilion. 

Saipidin S. is forty-one and married. He has three children: his sons are eighteen and five and his daughter is sixteen. He makes felt mats and sells them in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan). He learned the skills of doing felt mats from his neighbors. His wife helps him in making felt mats making. He started making and selling felt mats four years ago with an initial investment of 5000 soms. Felt mat making brings him in 16,000 soms monthly. For now, with the profits from his business he has been able to buy home appliances and cattle. He is applying for a loan to buy wool to increase his turnover. On the profits from his business, he is planning to expand his business and further increase his turnover. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase wool

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a widow with two children who both attend school. She has been operating her secondhand children's clothing business for the last six years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She also cooks dumplings for sale as another source of income.

With this KES 20,000 loan, Sophia wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.She hopes that she will be able to purchase two more bales of clothes in the future.

Sophia decided to work with Yehu in order to get a loan to boost her business and improve her living standards. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Puth

texts.en: Puth S., 38, is married and lives with her husband (who we see here in the photo) and five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. This part of the country is known for products made from palm. S. is a housewife while her husband makes a living producing rice wine. He earns about $4 per day, and the family has to spend about $44 a month on food and $10 a month on electricity. S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy pigs to raise and sell. In the future, she would like to use the profits she makes from this business to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. We see her husband in this photo because she was not available during our visit.

loans.use: buy pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Emprendedoras 2 & 3 Group

texts.es:
Ana es una D. L. miembros del Grupo Emprendedoras 2 y 3, ellas son microempresarias dedicadas a las ventas D. ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, educacion, etc; en la ciudad D. L. Alcarrizos, una ciudad industrial al norte D. S. Domingo, con una gran poblacion y un buen crecimientofa. Está asociada D. Esperanza se dedica a la venta D. Leche y otros productos derivados D. la misma como Yogur y queso.

Ana esta recibiendo su segundo prestamo en Esperanza, despues D. haber terminado y haber invertido su primer prestamo para la formacion D. su negocio, poco a poco a podimos invertir en otros productos para inicial un Colmado ( una pequeña tienda para ventas D. alimentos ),  va a utilizar sus ganancias para seguir invertiendo en su negocio. Su reto mas dificil criar a sus  a sus 3 hijos, junto a su esposo para que sean personas D. bien, educados y profesionales. a la ves que estudiaba y trabajaba. Su sueño es seguir avanzando en su negocio, con el fin D. poder tener un mejor futuro
texts.en:
Ana is one of the members of the "Grupo Emprendedoras 2 y 3" [Group of Entrepreneurial Women 2 and 3]. They are microentrepreneurs dedicated to selling clothing, natural products and shoes, providing education, etc., in the city of L. Alcarrizos, an industrial city north of S. Domingo with a large population and strong growth. This associate of Esperanza works selling milk and other products derived from the same, such as yogurt and cheese. 

Ana is receiving her second loan with Esperanza, after having paid off her first loan, which she invested in starting her business. Little by little she was able to invest in other products in order to open a "Colmado" (a small food store). She will use her earnings to continue investing in her business. Her most difficult challenge has been raising her 3 children, together with her husband, so that they will be successful, educated and professional people, at the same time that she has been studying and working. Her dream is to continue making progress with her business, with the aim of having a better future.

loans.use: Buying milk and other dairy products (yogurt, cheese)

loans.name: Lhagvadorj

texts.en: Lhagvadorj P. is 44 years old and he lives with his wife and two children in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His family lives in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent). His wife works as a teacher at the local school and his daughter, age 18, currently lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, where she studies at university. His youngest son, age 14, attends a local secondary school. Lhagvadorj worked as a master in the forest company between 1988 and 1995, and, since 2003, he has been operating a wood production business. He has owned his carpentry business for many years and over this long time he has earned the loyalty of his customers because of the quality of his work and service. His earnings have enabled him not only to pay for his daughter's tuition fees, but also to start building a new house that will be used as a workplace for his wood production in the yard. Lhagvadorj is requesting a 1,600,000 tugrik loan in order to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To buy more wood

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school, while two are too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are electricity bills, school fees and food for the family. 

She operates her business of selling bedsheets, window curtains, and handbags. In addition, she sells charcoal to contribute to her other source of income. 

Najma faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to build houses for rent in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase two bundles of bedsheets, window curtains, and handbags. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy bedsheets, window curtains, and handbags for resale

loans.name: Meralyn

texts.en:
Meralyn T. is from the town of Surallah. She is 41 years old, married, and has four children.  To make a living, Meralyn raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Meralyn works hard to sustain her children's education. Two of her children are in college and she hopes for them to finish and find decent jobs.

Meralyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meralyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Meralyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm needs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm needs

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia B. lives in the town of Trinidad. She is 54 years old, married and has five children, the oldest of which is 28. She makes a living by making and selling food, including "puto" (rice cakes) and other delicacies. 

Anastacia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is applying for a new one, for 7,000 PHP, to buy the ingredients she needs to make her food items. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to continue expanding it.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make baked good to sell

loans.name: Maria Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 27 years old.  She lives in the district of Tambogrande in northen Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone primarily populated by small farmers, many of whom own small fruit plantations or raise animals.  Lily owns her home, which she shares with her husband and their two children.

Lily raises animals in corrals behind her home.  She raises cattle and sheep.  She raises the sheep for their meat and the cattle for milk.  She sells six liters of milk on a daily basis.  In addition to these activities, Lily is a beauty products saleswoman, working with the brand AVON.  She generally makes two purchases each month, taking requests from her clients.

This will be Lily’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She plans to use the funds to purchase additional feed for her animals, repair her corrals and provide additional capital for purchases during the holiday season.  She is a hardworking woman with many dreams for the future of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her animals, repair her corrals and provide additional capital for purchases during the holiday season

loans.name: Magret

texts.en: Magret makes a living selling charcoal and is applying for this loan to open a place where she can sell her goods. She is 25 years old, married to a salesman and has two children, both of whom are in school. In the future, she hopes to build and open a restaurant.

loans.use: To open a shop where she can sell charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy Bermuda shorts, jeans and T-shirts.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 45 años, vive sola en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años tiene su tienda, negocio que ella misma atiende todos los días, y con mucho animo y el buen trato ha hecho que su establecimiento sea el más concurrido. Siempre esta en búsqueda de otorgar ofertas a sus clientes, ya que de eso depende que su negocio siga manteniéndose. Una de las cualidades que cree poseer, es el orden que siempre lleva en sus cuentas y eso le permite saber cuanto gana por cada producto que vende en su tienda, ya que no solo vende productos sino algunos artículos para el hogar y balones de gas. Es por ello que desea tener una tienda más amplia llena de mercadería y muy variada. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta y motivada de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del crédito que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería.
texts.en:
Nancy is 45 years old and lives alone in her own home.  She has owned her store for more than three years and works in it every day.  Through a lot of effort and good customer service, her establishment has become very popular.  Nancy is always looking to provide her customers with offers since the survival of her business depends on it.  One of the qualities that Nancy believes herself to possess is the ability to keep her accounts in order.  This allows her to know how much she earns for every product that she sells in her store.  She doesn't only sell food products but also some household items and gas cylinders.  She would like to have a bigger store, full of a large variety of merchandise.

This is Nancy's first loan with MFP.  She is very happy and motivated to know that she has financial support and she is grateful to everybody who will help fund her loan since it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest the loan she is requesting in buying more merchandise.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 28 years old. He is married and has one child who is 3 years old. Jean Bosco is requesting his first loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company. He needs the loan to buy more clothing to sell at his market stall. He has been in business for three years and has two employees in his shop. He works daily from 8am until 4pm every day. 

Jean Bosco has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more inventory for his business. With his additional profits, Jean Bosco will build a new house for his family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for his business

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
La señora Crisolina S., ex integrante del comité Espiritu Santo del km 6 Bario san Isidro de Ciudad del Este, contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar un nuevo comité en su comunidad.
El comité se denomina ”San Cayetano“ y está en el Segundo Ciclo con 16 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable.
La sra. Berta se dedica a la venta de flores, ella día a día desde tempranas horas fumiga sus flores para embellecerlas y las pone como en un mostrador para todas aquellas personas que deseen comprarlas, este negocio le ha dejado un muy ingreso, a pesar de que tiene sus épocas como todo ciclo económico.
Ella desea poder adquirir más materiales de trabajo, como semillas, planteras, fumigadoras, etc. por eso solicita el crédito, esperando contar con la ayuda crediticia.
texts.en:
Crisolina S., a former member of Espiritu Santo committee from 6 km San Isidro neighborhood in Ciudad del Este, contacted her neighbors and friends to form a new committee in their community. 
The committee is named “San Cayetano“. It is in its second cycle with 16 members. The group stands out in their community for being very united, supportive and responsible. 
Berta sells flowers. Day after day, from early in the morning, she sprays her flowers to improve their appearance and she puts them on a display for those people who want to buy them. This business has given her an income, even though there are good and bad times, just like the economic cycle. 
Berta wants to obtain more work materials like seeds, planters, fumigators, etc. For this reason, she is requesting a loan and she hopes she can count on the credit assistance.

loans.use: to buy seeds, planters, fumigators, etc.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en:
Donatha is 29 years old and is married, with two children between 6 and 8 years old. Donatha sells second hand items like sheets, covers, etc., in the market.   Her business is clean. She runs her business from 8am until 7pm every day except on the weekend, and she has five years of experience.

She has requested a loan from KIVA lenders in order to purchase more second hand items, such as sheets, covers, etc., to sell.  With this profit, Donatha will reinvest in her business and save for her future.  She plans to buy her own house .

loans.use: to purchase more second hand items to sell, such as sheets, covers, etc.

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira I., 48, is the leader of this group. She resides in Tyup, is married to technician, and has four children, the youngest of whom is sixteen. Her husband takes care of the field work when he’s free, while Gulmira  has been running a dairy business for thirteen years now, yielding 5-6 liters of milk, which is sold for 11 soms per liter. 

The family is busy with field work with the start of spring. They used to rent out their land, but this year Gulmira decided to start using the land herself. She plans to sow wheat and gain a rich harvest in fall. The purpose of the loan is a purchase of 200 kg of wheat seeds and 200 liters of fuel for equipment. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase 200 kg of wheat seeds and 200 liters of fuel.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter G. is from the village of Santa Cruz in Tangub City. He is 31 years old. Peter is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a business of providing motor transport services. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Peter joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Peter is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This will be his 3rd loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José,vive con su esposa y se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse al cultivo, su horario generalmente es de 6:00am a 12:00pm, actualmente está iniciando la preparación del terreno, para lo que solicita un préstamo para el pago de mozos, compra de abono y semilla.
Este préstamo le servirá para tener los insumos disponibles para preparar de mejor manera los cultivos esperando tener buena cosecha para vender una parte.
Su aspiración es establecer un negocio que le permita una mejor vida a él y su familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife.  He has been farming corn and beans for over 20 years.  His usual work schedule is 6am to noon.  He is currently staring soil preparation for which he needs a loan to pay day laborers and to buy manure and seed.

This loan will help him have supplies on hand to better prepare the crops hoping to have a good harvest to sell part of it.  His goal is to establish a business that will lead to a better life for him and his family.

loans.use: to pay day laborers and to buy manure and seed.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira es una madre de familia de 56 años de edad, vive con sus hijos mayores de edad en su casa propia la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en la zona rural de Tongorrape que pertenece al distrito de Motupe, la misma que está en el departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracterizan por su actividad agrícola, ganadera y turística  que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Elvira ha puesto  en su casa un pequeña vitrina con golosinas, la cual ofrece a los niños que acuden a un colegio que está cerca a su casa, desde hace unos 6 meses, con los ingresos que obtenga  podrá solventar los gastos diarios de su casa.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa Elvira trata de adquirir un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para comprar más productos para abastecer su pequeña tienda y para cubrir algunos gastos personales, al ofrecer mayor variedad de productos podrá incrementar sus ganancias, lo que le permitirá  cubrir su crédito y tener una mejor calidad de vida.   Elvira es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una persona alegre, dispuesta a ayudar a otros y con muchas ganas de tener mejoras en su casa para los suyos.
texts.en:
Elvira is a 56 year-old mother who lives with her grown-up children in her own home which has only electricity.  The house is located in the rural area of Tangorrape, in Motupe district, in Lambayeque department.  This area is noted for the farming, livestock raising and tourist activities that the local people are engaged in.

Elvira has set up a small display case in her home which contains candies.  She sells these to the children who attend a school near her home.  She has been in this business for some six months and she uses the income she makes to cover her household's daily expenses.

Through a visit to Edpyme Alternativa, Elvira requested a loan for 500 Peruvian soles to buy more products with which to stock her small store and also to cover some personal expenses.  By offering a wider range of products, she will be able to increase her profits which will, in turn, allow her to repay her loan and enjoy a better quality of life.  Elvira is known by her neighbors as being a cheerful person who is ready to help others and who has a great desire to make improvements to her household for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her store and also cover some personal expenses

loans.name: Lorielyn

texts.en:
Lorielyn is 34 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Lorielyn has a pigpen that raises pigs to sell.  She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy feed for the pigs.

Lorielyn has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lorielyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 39 years old, married, and has three children. He owns a retail shop that sells assorted foodstuffs to individuals in a busy residential area. Samuel has been running this business for three years and hopes to expand it. He intends to use this loan to purchase more stock for his retail shop. 

This is Samuel's second loan with SMEP. He is a good client that pays back his loan on time. Samuel wants to use the profits from his business to further expand his business and support his family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his retail food shop.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
Cornelia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 56 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene cuatro  hijos (dos en estudio y dos  independientes).  Tiene educación primaria.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comida, frutas y abarrotes, sus productos los vende en las ferias de la localidad.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace siete años,  su préstamo anterior que fue de  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, invirtió en la compra de corderos y los engordó por tres meses.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará tres sacos de chuño blanco, chuño negro, papa, corderos, trucha, nos cuenta que estos productos los compra en las ferias de Chacachaca y así como otros insumos.  En el negocio trabaja sola, a veces sus hijos la ayudan ya que su esposo trabaja (es policía).
Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes para cuidar su salud porque dice que la venta de comida y abarrotes es muy cansado.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, la capacitación de brindan a las socias y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Cornelia is a member of the Medalla Milagrosa Community Bank which is located in Pomata district, Chuchito province, in the department of Puno. She is 56 years old, has a common-law partner, and four children, two of whom are still in school, and the other two are independent. She completed primary school.

Cornelia sells food, fruit, and groceries in the local markets. She has worked with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for seven years. Her previous loan of S/. 300 was used to buy lambs which she fattened up for three months.

With this new loan of S/. 1500 she will buy three bags of white chuño (freeze-dried potato, traditional in Peru), black chuño, potatoes, lambs, and trout. She will buy these items in the Chacachaca markets as well as other supplies. 

Cornelia works alone although sometimes her children and husband (a policeman) give her a hand.

Her dream is to have a grocery store so that she can take better care of herself as selling food and groceries in the markets is very tiring.

She most enjoys the punctuality, the training of members, and the sense of responsibility that the community bank provides.

loans.use: white chuño (freeze-dried potato), black chuño, potatoes, lambs, and trout

loans.name: Cita

texts.en:
Cita is 28 and has a five year old child. She has been a seaweed farmer for five years. Cita shared that sometimes seaweed farming is not easy, as weather conditions and lack of financial support can hinder earnings. Despite these challenges, Cita still does her best and finds ways to support her child.

Cita has requested a loan to buy straw, rope, bamboo and other materials for seaweed farming. She hopes to be able to save for her child's future.

loans.use: to buy straw, rope, bamboo and other materials for seaweed farming.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene (37 años) convive con el padre de sus 2 hijos y un nieto, vive en casa propia que pudo comprar con la ayuda de su esposo ya que ambos se dedican a trabajar arduo para darles buena educación a sus hijos y una mejor calidad de vida.Marlene se dedica a una actividad muy rentable en la ciudad. Ella sale por las noches a la vereda a vender comida, este trabajo ya lo viene realizando por 10 años. Su trabajo lo hace sola ya que sus hijos trabajan y su esposo es chofer de una mototaxi.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que siempre hay movimiento y todos los días hay buenos ingresos, además ella sabe que en el negocio de la comida nunca nada se pierde. Ella tiene muchos planes a futuro,  entre ellos esta arreglar su local y emprender en una nueva actividad para la cual está comprando ropa de la ciudad de Lima para venderla en su localidad.Este es el cuarto préstamo entre Marlene y la institución MFP, le esta yendo bien y su grupo le parece bueno ya que todos son responsables hasta ahora.Con el préstamo solicitado 1800 soles ella comprará ingredientes e insumos para su venta de comida, además de invertir en el mejoramiento de su local.
texts.en:
Marlene, 37, lives with the father of her two children and a grandson in their own house, which they were able to buy because they worked hard to give their children a good education and a higher quality of life.  Marlene works in a field that is very lucrative in her city.  She goes out on the sidewalk at night to sell food, which she has been doing for the last ten years.  She does this work on her own, since her children work, and her husband drives a motorcycle taxi.

She likes the fact that her business gets a lot of traffic, and she makes a good income every day.  She also knows that nothing is ever lost in the food business.  She has many plans for the future, among them to improve her location and to start a new business buying clothes in Lima to sell locally.  

This is her fourth loan with microfinance partner MFP.  She will use this loan of 1800 soles ($675) to buy ingredients and materials for her food business, as well as to invest in improving her location.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her food business and to invest in improving the ambiance of her location.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Sum is 50 years old, and is a farmer. Her husband is a carpenter. She has five children, three are studying, one is working in the factory, and one more is selling fruit. Their income is $6 per day for each working member. Every month, she has to spend $90 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy fruit for her daughter to sell. She hopes her daughter’s career will start going well, and that she will be able to make a good income to support the family. She hopes to send the rest of her children to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy fruit for her daughter to sell.

loans.name: Aurelia Lucia
