texts.es: Esta señora es originaria del poblado de san Jacinto jurisdicción de telica, actualmente se desempeña como maestra  de primaria con 25 años de experiencia , su núcleo familiar se compone por 4 personas ella , su esposo y 2 hijos, actualmente recibió el financiamiento numero 3 atravez del convenio firmado con dicho colegio, los anteriores créditos les han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: This lady is originally from the town of San Jacinto, in Telica.  She works as an elementary school teacher and has 25 years experience.  Her family consists of four people: herself, her husband and her two children.  She has received her third loan through an agreement signed with her school.  Her previous loans helped her to improve her living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to build an extension on a room, purchasing materials such as bricks, metal sheets and cement, and paying labor costs

loans.name: Melony

texts.en:
With her desire to earn money and be able to sustain her family needs, Melony worked in a restaurant for years. Due to the sickness suffered by her mother-in-law, she stopped working in the restaurant and decided to put up a small business.

Melony has two children in school. With her determination to help her husband bring up their family, Melony cooks and sells balut (fertilized duck or chickens eggs with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell) around their village. She doesn’t want to depend on her husband's remittances from abroad. Her dreams is for her children to finish their college level of education to have a better future.

Melony is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos to buy stocks of eggs to make balut. She believe that this loan will help her financially support her business to develop and attain her dreams.

loans.use: to buy stock of eggs to make balut.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a working lady who sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful in her work and receives a good number of orders every month. Her skills enable her to earn a reasonable amount of income. Her husband is a scrap dealer. He supplies scrap to different factories and to other scrap dealers. Bushra has given birth to eight children. Her eldest daughter left her education after matriculation and started an embroidery business. Four of her children are enrolled in a school and getting their education.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s scrap business. With the loan, he will  buy scrap like used papers, plastic bottles, and iron in bulk to be able to increase his sales and profits. Bushra hopes that through the loan investment her husband's business will be improved further. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bushra.

loans.use: To buy scrap

loans.name: Nzau

texts.en:
Nzau is 33 years old, married, and is the father of one child. He runs a restaurant in Mombasa, a business that has been in operation for the last 20 years. 

This marks Nzau’s second loan from KADET. With this loan he plans to add more stock of cooking oil, maize meal, cereals, wheat flour, detergents, and soft drinks. He plans to use the anticipated profits generated to repay the loan and gradually expand his business. 

In the future, he would like to own his own hotel.

loans.use: To add more stock of cooking oil, maize meal, cereals, wheat flour, detergents, and soft drinks

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es: El señor Hilarión nació  en Chuquisaca, el se dedica al reparado de automóviles es chapista hace mas de 10  años el vive en la angostura, a 30km de el torno convivía  con la Sra. Hermelinda y tiene  4 hijos pero ella lo abandono ya que se fue a trabajar al exterior a buscar mejor calidad de vida, el vive en casa propia, el destino del crédito es para comprarse una motocicleta para trasladarse de un lugar a otro ya que por su y trabajo tiene bastante distancia que recorrer,  el no tiene ningún crédito con  ninguna financiera, es el primer crédito que esta sacando con emprender, ya que fue la única institución que le ha dado una mano, para mejorar su calidad de vida y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Hilarión was born in Chuquisaca.  He’s been an auto body repairman for over ten years.  He lives in La Angostura about 30 kilometers from El Torno.  He used to cohabit with Hermelinda and he has four children but she abandoned him to go find better employment abroad.  He lives in his own house and the loan will be used to buy a motorcycle to get from place to place because his work demands his traveling great distances.  He has no loans with any other credit institution.  This is the first loan he’s taken out with Emprender since it was the only institution that gave him a hand to improve his quality of life.  He is very grateful for the opportunity that’s been granted him.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 30 years old. He is married to Irene and together they have one child. He sells tea leaves and has been in the business for the past 10 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 8,000.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase tea leaves to sell. He will reinvest the profits back in his business. His dream is to buy a plot and build residential houses.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín, D. 28 años es un joven trabajador. Vive en compañía D. su mamá Gloria y su hermano Henry; en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío D. Los libertadores D. huari.  Hace algunos años, tomó L. responsabilidad D. su hogar; por ello abrió un pequeño grifo, donD. venD. petróleo a los carros que visitan L. zona constantemente. Le va muy bien en su negocio tanto así que pudo ahorrar lo necesario para abrir una tienda D. comestibles, donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad a los pobladores D. su zona. Además D. dedicarse a L. ganadería, ya tiene 6 vacas y 40 ovejas a las que enseba para luego venderlas a buen precio. Cuenta que, cuando sus vacas dan cría, venD. L. leche que produce a los ganaderos y vecinos, quienes le compran cada año. Ahora desea mejorar su negocio y ampliarlo, comprando diversos productos. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Huari” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donD. espera D. su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte D. su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Efraín D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en L. compra D. varios galones D. petróleo y productos D. primera necesidad para su tienda D. comestibles.
texts.en:
Efraín, age 28, is a hard-working young man.  He lives with his mother, Gloria, and his brother, Henry.  They live in their own house in the rural community of Los Liberatores D. Huari.

Some years ago he took the responsibility for his household.  To do so he opened a small gas station where he sells petroleum to the cars that constantly visit the area.  The business is going very well. It is going so well that he was able to save what he needed to open a grocery store where he sells basic needs products to the people in his zone.

He also devotes himself to livestock.  He has 6 cows and 40 sheep that he fattens and later sells for a good price.  He says that when the cows give birth he sells the milk that is produced to the cattle-dealers and neighbors who buy from him every year.

He now wishes to improve his business and to expand it by purchasing diverse products.  He is a member of the Huari communal bank, and this is his third loan with MFP.  He hopes for your collaboration so that he will be able to solidify his planes.  He pledges to make his payments.  Also, he is grateful to be part of his communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.

Upon receiving your support Efraín will use the requested loan to buy several gallons of petroleum and basic needs products for his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock his store and to buy gallons of petroleum.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco del banco comunal El Control, vive por una comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia de Tur en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta parroquia es conocida como el mirador de la ciudad de donde se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña María tiene 32 años, es casada y a concibiendo 2 hijos de 14 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo trabaja como albañil y la casa en la que viven es el fruto del trabajo conyugal.
 
Ella se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa cría y vende gallinas y cuyes. 

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cobijas térmicas ya que va a iniciar con este negocio.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria is a member of the El Control Community Bank. She lives in the Tur area of the city of Cuenca. Tur is well-known because you can enjoy views of most of the city from there. The people of the community work in agriculture and livestock, and they maintain the culture and traditions of their forefathers. 

Maria is 32 years old; she is married and has two children, 14 and 3 respectively. Her eldest son is studying in high school in the city. Her husband works as a mason, and they live in a home that they have built together.

She does housework and raises and sells chickens and guinea pigs (a traditional food in the area). 

This is her first loan with the community bank. She was invited by a friend to join. She will use the loan to purchase thermal blankets which she will use to begin a business selling blankets.

Her goal is to complete building their home.

loans.use: purchase of thermal blankets

loans.name: Duo Las Marias Group

texts.es:
DUO LAS MARIAS
Doña Claudia Marisol  ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de pollos gracias a dios a podido salir adelante ya que es el único medio que tiene para poder apoyar a sus padres, ella necesita un capital para poder invertir mas para sus tejidos y asi obtener un poco mas de ingresos económicos.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos tipicos.

Doña Marisol es una mujer que se dedica a la venta de refacción en una escuela publica en horas de la mañana y en horas de la tarde vende refacción en la plaza municipal de la localidad ella se dedica a esta actividad para poder apoyar a sus padres y para que ella pueda terminar sus estudios ya que gracias al esfuerzo de ella ha podio salir adelante, ella sueña con que algún día pueda tener un negocio un poco mas grande y así poder apoyar un poco mas a sus padres porque son de escasos recursos
texts.en:
Duo Las Marias [The Marias Duo]

Claudia Marisol makes a living doing traditional weaving by hand and raising chickens. Thanks to God she has been able to succeed because this is the only means to support her parents. She needs capital to further invest in her textiles and therefore obtain extra income. She is applying for this loan to purchase raw material for weaving traditional textiles.

Marisol is a woman who sells refreshments in a public school in the morning hours and in the afternoon hours she sells refreshments in the town square. She does this to support her parents and so that she can finish her studies. Through her own effort, she has been able to succeed. She dreams of someday owning a larger business and being able to support her parents more, since they have few resources.

loans.use: to purchase raw material for weaving.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 53-year-old married woman with three children. She runs a tailoring business at her home in Talibon, Bohol. Anecita makes curtains, pillow cases, bags and uniforms. Anecita also provides general alterations to clothing. Anecita has had this business for eight years. She earns 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per week. 

Anecita has requested this loan to purchase cloth, threads and other tailoring materials. She hopes to sustain her youngest child's college education.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Joshua's Group

texts.en: Alex is 31 years old. He is single and lives in a container with two children. He has been selling spare car parts for the past five years. He wants to use the loan to buy more spare parts to increase his inventory and believes this to be a major opportunity to expand his business. He hopes to improve sales to enable him save more for his children’s education. Alex belongs to the community group called “together we can”. In this group, members act as each other's guarantors and as social collateral to the loan, supporting one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more spare car parts for his business

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, 31, is single and resides with her three sisters in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for nine years and gets less salary. All of her sisters are employed; two are also garment workers and the other one is a hairdresser. 

Due to less income, Phally is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase rice to resell when the price is higher. By doing so, she will get extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a hair salon and purchase cosmetics to sell at home. Moreover, she plans to build a bathroom and a bedroom on the ground floor.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell when the price is higher

loans.name: Gloire A Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GLOIRE A DIEU est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans la même zone. Le représentant de ce groupe, nommé Idelphonse, est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Idelphonse est âgé de 42 ans et est marié à Philomène, une revendeuse. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Idelphonse n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais est un couturier. Il y a près de quinze ans que Idelphonse exerce cette activité. Parallèlement, Idelphonse vend des articles de merceries. Idelphonse achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Idelphonse désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Idelphonse sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GLOIRE A DIEU, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des articles de merceries.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en: Reuben is a married man charged with a responsibility of paying school fees for children and providing for his family as the only income earner. He is a farmer who grows sweet potatoes and cabbages on a large scale having been in business for 3 years now. He meets a challenge of inadequate finances to run all his projects without out sourcing since he depends on seasonal products. Despite the challenges, he looks forward to educating his children from good schools. Reuben is honest that if he is given the loan, he will be able to pay it back on time. He requests a loan to pay for labor to weed his potato garden and buy cabbage seeds for planting

loans.use: to pay for labor toweed his potato garden and buy cabbage seeds for planting

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: Frutas Don Luis, which has been open for 29 years now, would like to thank Mifex and Kiva for advertising the need for business capital. He moved to Guayaquil, Ecuador from Cotopaxi (sierra region) 40 years ago to start a new life for himself and his family. At the age of 53, Luis has plenty of experience selling his fruit, but he needs vital capital to expand. He runs his shop along with his wife, so they can continue to provide a better life for their children. His three children are grown up now and live independent from the family, and he would like to improve their lot. Until now, Luis has been unable to gain access to credit from any institution.

loans.use: Luis plans to diversify his fruit inventory with this loan capital, and he also will be able buy more items in bulk. Because he will have enough cash to purchase more fruit, he does not have to buy his fruit on credit (which can be very costly)

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Née en 1984 à Aného, Mlle S. Jeanne a hérité le petit commerce de sa mère. Actuellement, elle est élève en classe de terminale et vit avec ses parents. Très douée et avec son savoir faire, elle exerce simultanément le commerce et continue les études . Pour les besoins de son activité, Mlle S. Jeanne se rend chaque fin de semaine à Lomé pour s’approvisionner. C’est un petit commerce qu’elle tient, car elle se permet de fournir ses produits à ses camarades de classe et autres élèves de son établissement.

Aujourd’hui, Mlle S. a trouvé une jeune demoiselle qui voudrait s’associer à elle pour ouvrir un kiosque pour la vente des fournitures. Elle sollicite un appui financier de $450  pour ouvrir un kiosque. Les bénéfices d’une telle activité permettra à Mlle S. Jeanne de se prendre en charge et d’effectuer convenablement ses études.

loans.use: Ouvrir un kiosque pour la vente des fournitures

loans.name: Lino Ventura

texts.en:
Mr Lino is 63 years old, a widower and has one son. He has worked since he was very young as a repairman, working for other people, but Mr Lino always wanted to open his own store and he succeeded in this a little while ago. He invested all the money he had in order to have his store and he now has several clients, but to increase his sales he would like to offer items on credit to his customers, but to do so, he needs a loan of $475.00, which he will use to buy tools and materials he needs to make doors, windows, banisters and protectors, which are all in high demand.

Mr Lino has worked very much and he would like to see his business to continue to grow, and with your help he can achieve this. The well-being of he and his family is in your hands, please do not hesitate to decide to help him.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

El señor Lino tiene 63 años de edad, es viudo y tiene un hijo, él trabajó desde muy joven en la herrería para otras personas, pero los deseos de Don Lino eran abrir su propio taller y lo logró hace poco, invirtió todo el capital que tenia para poder iniciar su negocio, y ya tiene varios clientes, pero para incrementar sus ventas quiere ofrecer sus productos a crédito para lo que requiere de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares, que utilizará en la compra de herramienta y de los materiales que necesita para la fabricación de puertas, ventanas, barandales y protectores, que son los productos de mayor demanda.

Ha sido mucho el trabajo que ha realizado Don Lino, y quiere continuar creciendo con su negocio, con tu ayuda puede lograrlo. En tus manos está el bienestar de él y su familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlo.

loans.use: To purchase materials and tools.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela has been dedicated to planting rice for more than five years. She has been able to sustain her household with the income from this activity thanks to her hard work and dedication. Although her land can be used to plant other crops, she focuses on rice because of the small investment capital it requires and because of her experience. Graciela will use the loan to invest in rice seeds and fertilizer. She hopes that with this final investment she will be able to maximize the production of the crop.

Graciela is 20 years old and only has one son. She lives alone in her home and does not have much contact with the father of her son. Her home is made out of a mix of bamboo and wood, and she hopes to improve it with any extra profits from her rice production.

loans.use: Rice farming

loans.name: Cong

texts.en: Ms.Công is single. She lives in the same house with her mother and young sister and nephew. She takes care of her mother who is weak with a heart condition and plants vegetables. Her young sister’s income is enough to provide for herself and her son. Their average income is $10 per month/person. Now Ms. Công wants to borrow $75 to plant vegetables and will pay it back over 5 months.

loans.use: To plant vegetables

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is 27 years of age, with one son of four months. She is working as a workshop attendant in the Craft Village next to the National Theatre. They sell a variety of art and craft products like beads, African wares, shirts, dresses, children's wear, hats, sandals, woodcrafts, and many more items. She has four years of experience in this business. She owns a tailoring machine that she keeps at home due to lack of space.

Sharifa was persuaded to apply for a loan by a Kiva lender who visited Uganda. She would like to borrow $1,200 to set up her own workshop that will house the tailoring machine. In addition, she hopes to buy crafts from villages, which would make it easier for her to earn bigger profit margins that could support her many dependents.

loans.use: To set up a craft workshop

loans.name: Maysar

texts.en: Maysar is an active client of Microinvest. She is in this business for over 10 years. She has big family: 4 children, husband and his parents. Her husband is a farmer but his income was not enough for family needs. Muyasar says that she loves children very much and that is why she decided to sell children's clothes. It is pleasant  for her to help to choose clothes for little clients and to see thier happy faces. Every day Muyasar goes to her  placeof business with great pleasure .Currently she has good turnover of her working capital. She wants to expand her inventory before the holiday season and wishes to make a nice profit.

loans.use: expand her inventory with seasonal goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for his clients to use

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Born on April 4, 1978 in Lomé, Adjovi S. dropped out of grade school and began an apprenticeship in hairdressing. Despite financial difficulties, she completed her training and was able to open her own hair salon. She is single, and she has a child, as well as her parents and her apprentices, to take care of. Ms. S. is energetic and manages her salon well. She is requesting a loan of $600 to buy hair dryers and hairdressing supplies in order to strengthen her business. This is how she will be able to increase her income and to improve living conditions at home.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née le 04 avril 1978 à Lomé, Mademoiselle S. Adjovi a abandonné ses études au cours primaire et est rentrée en apprentissage de coiffure. Malgré les difficultés financières, elle a terminé son apprentissage et a pu ouvrir son propre salon de coiffure. Célibataire avec un enfant, elle a à sa charge et ses parents et ses apprenties. Elle est dynamique et gère bien son atelier. Elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour acheter des séchoirs et des articles de coiffure afin de renforcer ses activités. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy hair dryers and hair dressing supplies

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old. She is married and has five children ages fourteen and younger. Rosa has belonged to the “Chontaca” community bank for one year. In that time, she has learned how to work more efficiently. She also feels like she has support and enjoys attending meetings.

Rosa buys animals, such as pigs and sheep. She then butchers them and sells the meat from her home. Her dream is that her business will continue to grow and she will able to begin to sell clothing.

Rosa needs a loan of 1500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy school supplies to sell, to sell in addition to selling meat.

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of 1500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Dulce María

texts.en:
Dulce María is thirty-three years old and sells cosmetics items to women in her Herrera community of Santo Domingo. Dulce is a very smart and experienced entrepreneur. She explains that she pays heed to customer demand and when her clientele ask for certain items, she adds the requested products to her inventory.

With her loan, the entrepreneur plans on buying a showcase to display her products. Dulce María hopes that her business can keep on growing. That will allow her better fend for her five children.

loans.use: Purchase of a showcase for a business selling cosmetics

loans.name: Mwajuma's Hamasika Group

texts.en:
Grace is 39 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 7, 3, and 1 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 4 and 15 years old. Grace owns a small cafe, which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

In the past, Grace has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in coconut sales and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Phnov

texts.en: Phnov T. is 30 years old and working as a rice farmer in Kampong Cham province. She says her farm has been in her family since 1970, and she herself continues to work the same plot of land. Uch Srong, her husband, is a taxi driver bringing additional income to the family. They care for their two children through these businesses. One of her younger sisters also resides in their family home and helps support the family through working at a garment factory at $90 (US) per month. Her husband would like to have a business at home to run when he is not working his taxi. Specifically, they would like to purchase pigs to raise as another source of income. If he can make some extra money, he may someday be able to afford his own car and make more money as a taxi driver.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Faindu Group

texts.en:
Mye B. is the group leader of Faindu. He is 41 years old, married and with five children. He sells stones and sand to builders and has been running the stone mining for three years. With his first loan from SMT, he hired three laborers and was able to break more stones. The loan also enabled him to hire transport to take the stones and sand to the market and this has increased his income greatly. He would like to expand his business by hiring more laborers.

Other group members are Abibatu who sells bread and who would like a loan to purchase wheat flour and yeast on wholesale; Idrisa who owns small grocery shop; and Mariatu who sells clothes. The group is requesting a loan of Le.2,600,000 ($US900) to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Hire labor and to purchase wheat flour, clothes and grocery stock.

loans.name: Mamerto

texts.es:
Mamerto is a 58 year-old man who has the strength and interest to continue working in agriculture, an activity that he started when he was a boy. This work helped him raise his children who are now independent, each with their own families. Because he does not have his children nearby, Mamerto feels happy to share his life with his long-time wife who gives him the strength to continue working for their well-being and, as a good woman, she provides him with love for his health. However, they are certain things that limit his production, mostly the high prices of fertilizers which are necessary for his fields and because of this he asks for a loan with the hope that you are the right person to help him in his work as a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mamerto es un hombre de 58 años de edad que sigue manteniendo la fuerza y la entereza para seguir trabajando en la agricultura, actividad que inició desde que era niño. Dicha actividad le ayudó a educar a sus hijos quienes ya son independientes y cada uno tiene su familia. A pesar que ya no tiene cerca de sus hijos Mamerto se siente feliz por compartir su vida con su pareja de toda la vida, esto le da fuerza para seguir trabajando por el bienestar de ambos y como toda buena mujer, su esposa vela con amor por su salud. Sin embargo, hay ciertas cosas que limitan su producción, que es básicamente los costosos precios de los abonos, los cuales son muy necesarios para sus terrenos, y en base a ello, solicita un préstamo con la esperanza de que usted es la persona indicada para ayudarlo en su actividad como agricultor.

loans.use: Purchase of Fertilizer for his Farmlands

loans.name: Junaydullo

texts.ru: Зиеев Джунайдулло житель Явана. Занимается бизнесом . Торгует  национальными мужскими халатами – чапаны , хиджабы  и тюбитейки. Занимается торговлей уже 3, 5 года. Имеет торговую точку на рынке «Тиджорат». Бизнес приносит неплохой доход , что позволяет прокормить семью . Он женат и имеет семерых детей. Но для того , чтобы развивать бизнес необходимо получить кредит , сроком на 7 месяцев.
texts.en:
Junaydullo Z. lives in Yavan. He is a businessman, is married and has 7 children. Junaydullo sells national men’s gowns, hijab and skullcaps. Junaydullo has been in this business for three and a half years and has a sales location at the “Tidjorat” market. The business earns good profits, which allows Junaydullo to feed his family. In order to expand his business he needs to take out a 7 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Moussoulétou

texts.fr:
Madame M. Moussoulétou est née à Sokodé en 1968. Elle est mariée et est mère de trois enfants. Elle vit dans un quartier essentiellement commercial. Ainsi elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de divers articles en plastique, et certains produits de premières nécessités.
La concurrence étant rude elle a décidé d’aller vers les clients en faisant du porte à porte. Cette méthode lui a bien réussi ce qui fait qu’elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour ajouter à son stock d’autres produits. Ainsi avec ce crédit qu’elle sollicite, elle pourra acheter 25 glacières, 20 seaux en  plastique et un carton de savons.
texts.en:
Mrs.Moussoulétou M. was born in Sokodé in 1968. She is married and the mother of three children. She lives in a very commercial neighborhood. This is why she launched herself in the sale of various plastic goods, and some basic goods.

The competition was rough so she decided to go towards her clients by selling door to door. This method worked very well and she is requesting this first loan to add other products to her stock. With this loan she will be able to buy 25 ice chests, 20 plastic buckets and 1 box of soap.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plastic goods, ice chests and soaps.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
La señora Aida, socia del Grupo del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en la Región San Martín,  provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesos y confección de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su domicilio en el Jr.  Apolonia S/N, Barrio el Porvenir, en este lugar es donde elabora los quesos para luego salir a repartir en el mercado de la ciudad. Igualmente sus confecciones las vende de manera ambulatoria a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares.  Se inicia en el negocio porque le gusta manejar su propio capital.  

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará madera para la confección de moldes para quesos, leche en cantidades, así como telas de diversos colores, hilos, elásticos, blondas, etc., además de todo lo que necesita para la preparación de sus productos y confecciones para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. 

Aida tiene 53 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien la apoya en sus actividades. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de sacar adelante su negocio. Desea, más adelante, implementar y mejorar los ambientes con una mesa donde preparar los quesos ya que depende de la presentación de su local y de sus productos para hacerse muy conocida.
texts.en:
Aida, a member of the Virgen del Rosario communal bank group, lives in the San Martín region in Bellavista province and district. She devotes her time to the manufacture and sale of cheese and the sewing of articles of clothing. The business is located in her home in the Apolonia neighborhood of Provenir district. This is where she produces the cheese for later distribution in the city marketplace. She also sells what she sews door-to-door to her neighbors, friends and relatives. Aida began this business because she likes to have money of her own. With this loan of $400 (1200 nuevos soles), which will be repaid within six months, she will buy wood to make cheese molds, milk in bulk, as well as fabric in various colors, thread, elastic, lace, etc.—everything she might need for the manufacture or construction of products to meet the customer demand. Aida is 53 years old, and lives with her husband, who assists with her endeavors. She is a very diligent and responsible woman, who wants her business to be a success. In the future, she would like improve the ambience by setting up a table for preparing the cheese, because a nice location and good product presentation are good advertising.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood, and fabric in various colors

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 3 enfants à charge, Madame K. Ayoko est née à Aklakou en 1958. Depuis plus de 20 ans, elle y exerce le commerce d’alimentation générale et la vente de bouillie comme activité secondaire, à ciel ouvert, grâce auquel elle subvient aux multiples besoins de sa famille. En temps de pluie et de fort ensoleillement, son activité tourne au ralenti dans la mesure où elle ne l’exerce pas sous un abri devant protéger aussi bien les marchandises, ses clients qu’elle-même. Dans le souci de mieux rentabiliser son affaire, elle se propose de réaménager une boutique qu’elle a déjà construite. Mais elle ne dispose plus suffisamment de fonds. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit pour réaliser son projet.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 3 children for whom she is responsible, Mrs. Ayko K. was born in Aklakou in 1958. For more than 20 years, she has been tending a little grocery store and selling porridge as a secondary activity, out in the open. Her two businesses bring in enough to cover the many needs of her family.

When it is rainy or the sun is too hot, her business slows down since she has no roof to protect her, her customers, and her merchandise from the elements. Wishing to make her business more profitable, she would like to furnish a little store that she has already built. However, she does not have enough money to do this. For that reason, she is requesting a loan to help her make her plans come true.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: furnishing a little grocery store

loans.name: Sunny

texts.en: Sunny E. sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, garri, etc. He started this business in 2006. He is 42 years old and married with 3 children. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. He says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina M. is single and has no children. She has received senior high education and, since 2003, has been earning income sewing and selling fabrics. A seamstress by profession, Augustina sells different kinds of fabrics and both male and female clothing at Intarbeton, Cape Coast. She uses her income for paying utility bills and covering various personal expenses. Her loan will be used to buy additional fabrics and sewing materials. She hopes to use the extra profit to reinvest in the business to increase its capital base.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics and other sewing materials

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Gloria Maria tiene 49 años de edad, habita en villa reconciliación, tiene  cuatro hijos mayores que son independientes, su esposo trabaja como guionista, ella se dedica a la costura desde hace siete años, que inicio con prestamos de Afodenic que ha sido de mucho beneficios para su superación en su negocio, con esta solicitud es la quinta la cual va invertir en  materiales de construcción para construir un porche y poder gozar de sus esfuerzos de trabajo junto con su familia. Sus planes es poder comprar una maquina overlook para hacer mejor los trabajo de costura, y sastifacer al cliente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria is 49 years old and lives in Villa Reconciliación. She has four grown children who are independent and her husband works as a scriptwriter. She has been a seamstress for seven years. She began her career as a seamstress with a loan from Afodenic, which has been of much benefit to her business. This is her fifth loan, which she will invest in construction materials to build porch on her house so that she can enjoy the benefits of her hard work with her family. Her future plans include the purchase of a sewing machine to do her job better and satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a porch on her house

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen sells foodstuffs and she has been in this business for a long time. Helen sells retail to customers. She wants to purchase foodstuffs in large quantities to enable her to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for a loan  to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Helen is 41 years old and married with three children. She is indeed grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Amparo es costurera, desde muy joven aprendió la costura el cual ha sido su medio de vivir, gracias a sus padres que le pagaron un curso a prendió, trabaja haciendo los encargos y también hace ropa para vender. Tiene 56 años de edad, reside en  villa Venezuela con cuatro hijos mayores que la apoyan con los gastos. El préstamo que esta solicitando es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer un muro en su casa para estar más segura con su familia ya que la delincuencia es día a día. Sus planes es poder comprar muchas telas para hacer vestido, vender más lo cual le generara mejores ganancias y poder seguir haciendo su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Amparo is a seamstress. She learned how to sew when she was very young, and this has been her way to make a living, thanks to her parents who paid for a course for her so she could learn. She works by taking orders and also makes clothing to sell. She is 56 and lives in Villa Venezuela with four adult children who help her with the expenses. The loan she is requesting is her fourth with Afodenic, which she will invest in the purchase of construction materials to make a wall in front of their house so they will be more secure since delinquency happens every day. Her plans are to be able to purchase many different fabrics to sell more clothing so she can make more profits and continue constructing her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make a wall

loans.name: Jane Atieno Demba

texts.en:
Jane Atieno Demba O. is an incredible vivacious woman and one of the initial recipients of the K-MET revolving loan fund.

Jane is 42-years-old and the mother of seven children ages 24, 23, 22, 18, 16, 14, and 12. Her husband recently retired from public work. Jane is the quintessential entrepreneur. She owns a butcher shop at the local market, a community pharmacy and is a community-based health worker.

She has taken out three loans so far for 10,000, 20,000 and 30,000 KSH. She finds them very helpful and has been able to buy four acres of farmland where she grows sugar cane. She has been slowly growing and expanding her businesses over the years and recently added a two-family rental house.

With her community based health work, she sees 18 clients a week and often gives them extra meat. She is asking for 50,000 KSH so she can do more farming for sugar cane and increase her acreage. Jane uses some of her extra profit to feed patients.

She wants Kiva lenders to know that the loans she has received have seen her through so many things, she doesn't know how to describe how grateful she is for them.

loans.use: Buy land.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is married with three children. She received an education through junior-high school. For one year, Joyce has worked as a trader in Siwdo, selling fresh goods such as garden eggs and tomatoes. Her husband also works as a trader in the same area.

Joyce uses her income to pay for her family’s expenses, such as the household bills. She will use the loan to purchase additional foodstuffs for selling. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to reinvest back in to her enterprise to ensure her further success.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs for selling

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Odile D. est mariée et mère de famille. Elle voudrait maintenir son activité de commerce de miel et de pâte d’arachide. Elle compte avec ses revenus, assurer une meilleure condition de vie à sa famille.
texts.en:
Odile D. is married and the mother of a family. She would like to keep up her business selling honey and peanut butter. She feels sure that her income can allow her to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of honey and making and selling peanut butter

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu John is currently in the business of selling charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to open up a charcoal store. Dudu is 34 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a charcoal store

loans.name: Aijan Tokbolotova’S Group

texts.en:
Six years ago, Aijan Tokbolotova opened a small business selling women’s clothing. She owns a small stall in the market in Balykchy, a city in the Issyk-kul region. She buys women’s clothing and shoes in the Dordoi market in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan), which is the largest market in the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS), and then sells them in Balykchy. She has about $70 USD (~ KGS 3,000) to use as working capital and she is planning to use the loan to purchase summer clothes to sell.

Aijan is married and has 3 children, 2 daughters and 1 son. The son and one of the daughters are currently studying at Bishkek universities. Aijan’s husband works as a bus driver.

All the members of Aijan's loan group are neighbors. They are all occupied with various small businesses. Toktogul resells children’s clothes at Balykchy market. Naryngul is planning to spend the loan to purchase sheep and cows for her livestock breeding business. Sonunbubu needs a loan to help her husband pay for car repairs, because her husband is a taxi driver and his car is their only source of income.

loans.use: To purchase summer clothes to sell and to pay the educational expenses of her children

loans.name: Pikoke

texts.en: Pikoke T., 52, is married with eight children.  She has five years of experience in the plantattion business.  She sells to village people three days per week.  She has six previous loans with SPBD.  Pikoke expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Pikoke’s only access to capital because she is no able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizers, weed killer etc.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is a 45-year-old married woman who is raising five children, four of whom are still attending school. Samira has owned an accessories and clothes shop since 2000 where she services the neighboring areas. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy merchandise for her shop in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animals for his farmland

loans.name: Aapasara

texts.en:
Aapasara T. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati. Sainbu-Bhaishipati is located in lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural work.
Mrs. T. lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is engaged in agricultural work.  She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 12 and daughter is studying in grade 8.
Mrs. T. is engaged in selling cow’s milk. She already own one cow and selling cow’s milk door to door in the local market. Due to the increasing demand of the milk Mrs. T. is requesting for Rs 10000.00 loan to buys another young cow to meet the increasing demand of cow’s milk.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos que están estudiando. Desde hace 2 años tiene un pequeño puesto donde vende todo tipo de celulares, aunque no tiene un punto de venta estable, con su negocio obtiene ganancias regulares. Graciela trabaja al lado de su esposo, quien es el encargado de la reparación de los celulares y a la venta de repuestos para éstos. Adicionalmente, Graciela vende diversos productos de panadería a las personas que viven por su zona, negocio que lo viene realizando hace 8 meses y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es estar activa y dar un buen trato a sus clientes, pues gracias a su trabajo está solventando los gastos educativos de sus hijos.
Este es su 5to crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es que luego de algunos problemas, han quedado en su banco comunal sólo las personas más responsables y trabajadoras. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más celulares, calcula un gasto de mil soles; con el resto comprará algunos repuestos para el trabajo de su esposo.
texts.en:
Graciela is 26 years old and lives with her husband and their two children who are in school. For the last two years, she has had a small booth where she sells a variety of cellphones. Although she does not have a fixed location to sell from, her business generates profits regularly. Graciela works alongside her husband who is in charge of cellphone repairs and of selling replacement parts for the phones. Also, Graciela sells bakery goods to the people who live in her area, a business sideline that she has been working on for 8 months and which is going very well. What she likes about her work is being active and treating her customers well. Thanks to her business, she can pay for her children's education. This is her fifth loan with MFP. What she likes about working with her group is that after some problems earlier, only the most hard-working and responsible people remain part of her Village Bank. With her loan, she will use 1000 soles to buy more cellphones. With the rest, she will buy more replacement parts for her husband's side of the business.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is managing a community-based store in her village of Rizaluna Cordon, Isabela. According to her, she is able to generate a weekly income of PHP 1,000 due to easily selling out the merchandise in her store. For this reason, Teresa would like to request a loan of PHP 5,000 for her to purchase stocks of goods to expand her store, to lessen her transport expenses and to increase her daily income.

Teresa is married to Rolando, a simple farmer. They are helping each other in the growth of their livelihood for the future of their family especially their children. They hope to give their children an improved life someday and to do this they must work hard, be patient always and learn to be open minded to cope with everyday challenges and life changes.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

loans.name: Sergyi

texts.en:
Sergyi is married with two children. He is a small entrepreneur from Mukachevo, Western Ukraine. Sergyi sells women’s lingerie and handbags in one of the local stores in his home town. He started this business 2 years ago. Currently, Sergyi has 43,000 Grivnyas of gross income each month. 

Sergyi seeks to increase assorted merchandise he offers for sale in his store. He is requesting a loan of 7,500 Grivnyas to pursue these plans. Sergyi’s family assists him in his business endeavors. They are very supportive of Sergyi’s plans and believe the current loan will benefit his business promoting its further growth.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Danzanhorol

texts.en: Danzanhorol Batbayar is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in the Arkhangai province of central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). His youngest son currently attends a local secondary school. Batbayar operates a dairy trading business in his town. He started his business 12 years ago with a working capital of 50,000 tugrugs (~35 USD) and has built a stable operation over the years. Today, he is well established in the local business community and attributes his success to his strong customer base, communication skills and good accounting practices. Batbayar also has many reliable suppliers, many of whom sell exclusively to him. Today, his working capital exceeds 1,000,000 tugrugs (~700 USD). Still, Batbayar hopes to own his own workspace which will allow him to serve more customers. He is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~350 USD) loan, which he will use to purchase more dairy products for his business.

loans.use: purchasing more dairy products

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita L., 54, is a traveling fish vendor.  She also owns a sari-sari (retail store) as a source of income. Her family lives in Norala, South Cotabato.  She is married to Jose and has four children. Together, they support each other to sustain the daily needs of the family.

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to obtain a loan that has a low interest rate. She has requested the amount of 18,000 PHP, enough to buy groceries for her store and support in financing her fish vending business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for resale at her store, and to finance her fish vending business

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora M. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Nora owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Nora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Nora is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 54 years old, married, and has two children aged 15 and 27. Her husband is working with an income of 40,000 Rawandan francs /month (approximately $70 US). Angela’s family lives in Burera, in a region of Ruhengeri, in the northern province of Rwanda, which is almost a two-hour drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  Angela has been in the business of sewing for more than five years, employing three people from her community.  She works at the business from 7 AM to 6 PM every day except Sunday.

Angela has successfully repaid her previous loans in full and on time.  She is requesting her fifth loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more sewing equipment that will enable her to increase on her clothing sales. With these additional supplies, Angela is expecting to earn more profits that will help her take good care of her family as well put aside some savings. Angela is thankful to Kiva lenders that have contributed to her success in business.

loans.use: Sewing equipment

loans.name: Chérifatou

texts.fr: S. Chérifatou est née en 1972 à Kétou, au Sud du Bénin. Mariée à AKANNI Aliou, un électricien bâtiment, Chérifatou est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a environs 5 mois que la famille s’est installée à PK11, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Chérifatou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis près de 7 ans, Chérifatou vend des condiments de sauce (tomates fraîches, piments, etc.), ainsi que de l’Akassa (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs), à son domicile. Chérifatou s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Chérifatou sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui servira à augmenter son capital et à renforcer son activité, pour mieux satisfaire et agrandir sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Chérifatou S. was born in 1972 in Ketou in the southern part of Benin. She is married to Aliou AKANNI, an construction electrician, and the mother of six children, who are all in school. As a couple, they work together to meet the needs of the family. About five months ago, the family moved to PK11, in Benin’s Seme-Podji municipality. Chérifatou did not attend school. For the past 7 years, Chérifatou has been selling sauce condiments (fresh tomatoes, hot peppers, etc.) along with Akassa (a local dish that resembles cornmeal porridge) from her home. Chérifatou gets her supplies at the Dantokpa international market in Benin. This is Chérifatou’s first loan request from ALIDé. She will use the loan to increase her capital, reinforce her business, better satisfy her customers and expand her clientele.


Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baskets of fresh tomatoes and bags of corn

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Mrs. Vy N. is 43 years old and she lives in Ponley village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare field where she cultivates rice. In order to make her rice crop more productive, Mrs. Vy N. decided to ask for a loan to buy irrigation equipment to water  her crop. The remainder of the loan she would use to buy rice seed. 

She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions through this loan. Her husband, Mr. Kouy Sok, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support his family. Mrs. Vy N. is the mother of four children who are all students in the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a machine to water her crop, and to buy rice seed.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf S. is 49 years old. He and his wife have raised three children. For the past 15 years, Yusuf has been involved in manufacturing wooden doors and window frames. The elder son of Yusuf helps him in the business. Yusuf is respected and known in the neighborhood as a real master, which provides him with lots of clients. The business is stable, generating the main income for the family. Today, Yusuf needs to purchase materials like wood, plywood, flake board and other supplies for his business. Also, he is planning to improve the working conditions of the business. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting $1500 US Dollars. Yusuf thanks all for supporting him and for their trust.      

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase wood, plywood, flake board and other supplies for making furniture.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort has a poultry farm where she sells poultry to make a living in Sapele. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. She hopes for a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more poultry to sell. She is a friendly woman and she uses her friendly skills to attract and retain more customers to her business. She is 64 years old and married with seven children. Her youngest child is 27 years old. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Marilux

texts.es: La señora Marilux es maestra de educación, tiene 5 años de experiencia es muy trabajadora es madre de una niña ella está solicitando el crédito para terminar de construir su casa ya que ha estado repellando sus paredes pero este crédito le ayudara.
texts.en:
Marilux has been a teacher for 5 years. She is very hard-working and is the mother of a daughter. She is requesting funds to finish building her house; she needs to plaster the walls and this loan will help her do so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building her house.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina F. is from the village of Dimalco Bonifacio. She is 30 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as vinegar, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Gina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Hemat Group

texts.en: Tahera is the daughter of B. and the leader of Hemat group. She is 49, married with five children, and lives in District 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. Tahera, the only one currently working in her family, has been involved in weaving carpets for more than one year and now wants to buy some tools that will help her to enlarge her business and expand her clientele to make a better life for her family.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Siguitèmasson Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Siguitèmasson sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec en moyenne 39 ans, 5 enfants et habitant  toutes  à Farabougou, un des villages de la Commune Rurale de Téssérèla  (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Elles font le commerce de riz,  de spaghetti, de poissons séchés, fumés, d’oignon, de savons etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro  Yiriwaso avec qui, elles sont  à leur 1er  prêt solidaire. 
Madame Fatoumata T. qui est un des membres du groupe a opté se spécialiser dans l’achat et la vente de céréales (maïs, fonio, mil, arachide, riz, etc.) 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, un sac de riz étuvé à Tissala auprès des producteurs. Elle revend son riz à domicile, à Gassola et Zambougou Fouta à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour acheter du condiment et entretenir ses enfants. 
Fatoumata T. a pour ambition l’achat d’une charrette et d’un âne pour assurer son transport et celui de ses marchandises dans les différentes foires.
texts.en:
The six members of the Siguitèmasson group are married for the most part into large traditional extended families and are on average 39 years old with five children. They all live in Farabougou, one of the villages in the Téssérèla Rural Community (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They became acquainted through family ties and weddings, and as neighbours. Their commercial activities deal with rice, spaghetti, dried and smoked fish, onions, soap, etc. Wanting to increase their working capital, they decided to join up with the Soro Yiriwaso credit loan programme, where they are requesting their first group loan. One of the group members is Mrs. Fatoumata T. who decided to specialise in the trade of grain cereals (corn, fonio, millet, peanuts, rice, etc.). She will use her loan to buy one bag of pre-cooked rice from producers in Tissala. She retails from her home, in Gassola and Zambougou Fouta to a mixed customer base. She hopes to achieve average monthly earnings of 15,000 FCFA, which will serve to buy condiments and support her children. Her ambition is to buy a donkey and a cart to ensure her transport and that of her merchandise to different market fairs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice

loans.name: Sophoan

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoan C. is a 30-year-old married woman and she lives in Roneam Tnaot village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Mean Parn, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

Aside from farming, Mr. Mean Parn is employed in a rice mill and Mrs. Sophoan C. is a pig breeder. In order to support her pig breeding, Mrs. Sophoan C. decided to ask for a loan to buy seven piglets to raise and pig feed.

Mrs. Sophoan C. is the mother of three children: two are students in the local school while the youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: To buy seven piglets to raise and pig feed

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha M. is 35 years old and is the leader of this group loan having been selected by its four members. They are located in Boueng Kroam village in Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use the loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Sokha M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice and corn. For this farm, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to support her farm crops.

Mrs. Sokha M. is a widow with two children who all both students in the local school and also support their mother farming.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary I., who has spent many years in business, sells at Amina market, one of the popular market areas located in the central market.  A widow highly committed to her business, she trades in textiles.  She has two grandchildren, both of whom are attending primary school.  Mary is in dire need of a loan in order to increase her stock so that she can retain her customers and encourage new ones.  She also intends to use the profit to take care of her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Kyunga

texts.en:
Kyunga T. is a 32-year-old single man who runs a motorcycle transport business and a food kiosk. He has been in the business for the past year and he has been making profit of up to Kshs 63,000 per month. His primary business, which is the motorcycle transport, is at the Kilifi stage.

He was introduced to Kadet by a Kadet staff member and he is taking out his first loan of Kshs 80,000 which he is planning to use to purchase iron sheets, buy more stock for the retail stock, and repair his motorbike.  He hopes to expand the size of his business with the loan.

loans.use: purchasing of iron sheets, buy more stock for kiosk, and repair motorbike

loans.name: Mirtha Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora Mirtha  tiene 31 años de edad tiene dos niños de doce y siete años ella vive en la Maica Central parada seis  que es un cantón de la ciudad de Cochabamba a unos veinte minutos de la ciudad, ella vive sola con sus hijos y con la cuñada.

Mirtha es una persona responsable y trabajadora es la única mujer de cuatro hijos los cuales salieron solos porque sus padres se divorciaron cuando eran niños y ella vivía con la abuela ya que la mama les  abandono  cuando su padre se fue de la ciudad entonces ellos quedaron solos, Mirtha se puso a trabajar desde muy niña ayudando a la abuela con la actividad de la producción de leche  de esa manera ella se quedo con esa actividad de producción de leche ella tiene tres cabezas de ganado lechero que le dan una producción de 60 litros diarios con los cuales ella realiza quesillo y los comercializa en el mercado, de los cuales ella paga el estudio de sus hijos y al mismo tiempo cuidad a la abuelita porque ella se encuentra delicada de salud y como es su abuela quien la ayudo a Mirtha ella dice que le debe mucho a su a abuela y tiene que ayudarla para que pueda vivir más.

Mirtha pide el crédito para la compra de cascara de soya, para poder aumentar la producción y de esa manera poder producir más leche y realizar más quesillo, con esa ayuda ella tendrá más ingresos con los cuales ayudara a sus hijos en la escuela y que sus niños terminen y realicen una carrera  en el futuro.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirtha is 31 years old and has two children, ages 12 and 7. She resides in Maica Centra Parada Seis, which is a canton of the city of Cochabamba that is located twenty minutes away from downtown. Mirtha lives alone with her children and her sister-in-law.

She is a responsible person and a hard worker. Mirtha is the only daughter of four children. After her parents divorced, she went to go live with her grandmother since her mother abandoned them and her father already left town. Mirtha started working as a young girl by helping her grandmother collect milk. She continues in this same line of work and now has three dairy cows that provide 60 liters per day that she uses to make fresh cheeses that are sold in the market. The income she earns goes toward her children’s education and the care of her grandmother since she is in delicate health. Mirtha says she owes so much to her grandmother, so she has to help her live longer.

Mirtha is requesting a loan to buy soybean husks to feed to her cows so that they can produce more milk. This will allow her to make more cheese, which means she will have more income to help her children with their schooling and enable them to earn a degree in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soybean husks for her cows

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Señor Juan Carlos se dedica a la fabricación de sombreros de cholitas esta es un actividad muy dificil y de mucho trabajo manual, ya que necesita de mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, el es una persona que vive solo, ya que se separo de su esposano hace mucho sigue atravesando todavia con los problemas de sus separacion ya que para el fue dificil pero esta saliendo adelante, tiene en su taller varios productos entre acabados y materia prima, este oficio lo aprendio hace muchos años del Señór con el que trabajaba como operario,  hasta que puso su propio taller donde tiene bastante acogida, el dinero del credito lo utilizara para la compra de material para la fabricacion de los sombreros ya que por estas fechas se dan muchas fiestas de zonas, teniendo pedidos en sombreros, es una persona que fue recomendado por un cliente que vive por la zona.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos works making hats. It is a very difficult job that requires a lot of manual labor, time and effort. He now lives alone, following a separation from his wife not that long ago. He is still dealing with the problems of their separation, as it was difficult for him, but he is trying to keep going. In his workshop he has many products ranging from supplies to finished products. He learned this trade many years ago as an apprentice until starting his own workshop that was very well-received. He will use the loan money to buy supplies to make hats, as there are currently a lot of parties and celebrations in his area and he has orders for hats. He was recommended by a customer who lives in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies to make hats

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry A., from the village of San Pablo, Cauayan City, Isabela, is 47 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Jerry owns and operates a specialized retail store selling home products such as kitchen utensils. Engaged in her business for over 13 years, she earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jerry joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, Jerry plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun S., 41, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. S. and her husband are employed at a local garment factory for an income of USD 3.3 each per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret K. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of her mother.    

Margret has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days a week. She sells her products at the market  on a retail basis. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.     

She also generates additional income through selling clothes. The main business challenges for Margret include transportation and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to educate her children up to university level and to build rental rooms. 

She lives in a home that she owns where she doesn’t have access to electricity but does have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Bella Ballesteros' Group

texts.en:
Bella B. is 38 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Namnama within the municipality of Cabatuan, a part of Isabela province on the Luzon islands. Bella is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Bella runs a food stall from which she operates a canteen or eatery in the community. Bella has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5000 PHP monthly.

In 2009 Bella joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Bella successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional inventory and gain working capital. Bella is requesting a new loan, her third from ASKI, of 13,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory and gain working capital

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
José Raúl es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Puerto Arturo del distrito de Reque, una zona situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la fabricación y reparación de estructuras metálicas (carpintería metálica). Para lo cual cuenta con un pequeño taller instalado en su domicilio. El trabaja en base a pedidos y sus clientes principales son los mototaxistas del lugar que siempre acuden a el para reparar algunas fallas en sus vehículos. Este negocio le permite agenciarse de algunos ingresos, los cuales utiliza en el mantenimiento de la economía de su familia.

José Raúl desea implementar su negocio con la compra de más materiales y herramientas que le ayuden a llevar su negocio de la mejor manera posible. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

José Raúl siempre se esfuerza para sacar adelante a su negocio. El es responsable y bastante empeñoso. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y de confianza.
texts.en:
Jose Raúl is a 34-year-old family man who lives with his wife and three children in the Puerto Arturo sector in the Reque District. This zone is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.
He works fabricating and repairing metals structures (metal carpentry). He works in a small shop at his home. His work is based on customer requests. His primary customers are motor taxis drivers from his area. They always come to him when they have problems with their vehicles. This business permits him to eek out an income that he uses to support his family. Jose Raúl would like to expand his business by purchasing materials and tools. This is the best way to grow his business. For this reason he has found it convenient to ask for a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 new soles. 
Jose Raúl is always looking for ways to improve his business. He is responsible and persevering. People that know him consider him a calm and confidant person.

loans.use: To buy more materials and tools

loans.name: Kabunyansi Agalyawamu Savings And Credit, Mubende Group

texts.en:
Hard-working N. Edison has over two years been operating a cattle-fattening farm in Kamuseenene, Mubende where he sells cows to earn a living at the periodic markets that take place around the area in western Uganda. In this business, he directly purchases the livestock and then rears it for some time on his farm till he finds it ready market, where he supplies to butchers and restaurants. He further operates agricultural farming from which he generates income out of food crops, produce that he sells such as beans, maize and more.

His main drawback in the course of doing this business has been unstable prices on the market and low capital input. With hard work and efficient customer care skills, he has managed to keep his business going. In a month, he makes profits to the tune of 320,000 Ugandan shillings.
