His future plans are to fully expand the business transactions and do farm restocking with more livestock which will earn him more revenue to pay for his children’s education requirements and improve their standard of living. With this loan, he anticipates great strides in achieving this dream and restocking more cattle for resale.

Edison belongs to Kabunyansi Agalyawamu Savings and Credit, Mubende.

loans.use: purchase of more cattle for fattening on the farm

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina forma parte del banco comunal “La Hermandad” de la comuna de Maipú. Ella vende ropa de lencería, ropa deportiva, juguetes y  hierbas medicinales en un puesto en una feria de su comuna, la cual se instala en 3 lugares diferentes. Trabaja 4 días a la semana, incluyendo todos los fines de semana, desde hace 18 años. Además Dina confecciona productos para temporadas definidas, con su máquina de coser, por ejemplo: en fiestas patrias hace trajes típicos y para navidad hace manteles y servilletas. Dina comparte el puesto en la feria con su hija , quien vende muñecas. 
Con este préstamo Dina comprará lencería. Su sueño es tener más clientes para aumentar sus ventas. 
Para Dina Fondo Esperanza ha sido una gran ayuda, por su bajo interés en los préstamos y por los talleres educativos, no solo de negocios, sino también de valores y de relaciones personales. 
Maipú es una comuna ubicada al este de Santiago, capital de Chile. Designada como la comuna más grande de Chile es llamada Cuna de la Patria debido a importantes hechos históricos ocurridos en esas tierras durante la época de la Independencia.
texts.en:
Dina is part of the Communal Bank, "La Hermandad," in the neighborhood of Maipú.  She sells lingerie, sportswear, toys, and herbal medicines in a booth at a fair in her neighborhood, which is installed in 3 locations.  She has been working 4 days a week including all weekends for 18 years.  Dina also manufactures products for the defined seasons with her sewing machine.  For example, on national holidays she makes typical costumes and for Christmas she makes tablecloths and napkins.

Dina shares her position at the fair with her daughter who sells dolls.  With this loan Dina will buy lingerie.  Her dream is to have more customers to increase her sales.

For Dina, Fondo Esperanza has been a great help for low interest loans and educational workshops, not only for business but also for values and personal relationships.

Maipú is a municipality located east of Santiago, capital of Chile.  Designated as the largest municipality of Chile, it is called the cradle of the country due to major historical events that ocurred on those lands during the time of independence.

loans.use: To buy lingerie clothing.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam A. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Mariam has a business selling charcoal which she has had for 5 years.

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mariam hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Mariam hopes to become a lawyer. Mariam is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program which has helped her prospects for the future through her hard work.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret M. is a fifty-one year old-woman, married to Benson Lugadiro, who is employed as a civil servant in the Kenyan government.  Margaret sells her fruits wholesale in Eldoret Municiple market; she has been in this business for five years and gets a monthly income of 8,000 shillings.

This will be Margaret's first loan with KADET, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy more fruits, such as pawpaws, so that she can increase her stock.  With the expected income from the loan she plans to buy a shop in the market and also stabilize her finances.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business, raise her stardard of living and have a stable and happy life.

loans.use: To purchase fruits for resale.

loans.name: Doul

texts.en: Doul P., 44 years old, owns a small shop located along a major road where she sells soft drinks, fast food, sweets for kids and some cooking supplies. She typically makes around $2 per day to support her family. She has been married for many years to Chea Thet, 44, a construction worker, and they have three children, all of whom are single. Doul P. is running her business well because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. Currently, Doul P. wishes to have more funds to buy some soft drinks, fast food and cooking supplies to sell.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, fast food, and some cooking supplies

loans.name: Crotilde

texts.en: Crotilde is 40 years old, married and has five children who range in age from four to 19 years old. She owns a small business selling various products such as juice, soap, cooking oil, bread and other items. She has been in this business for four years and is doing quite well. Her shop is open from 6.30 a.m. until 9 p.m. daily and she employs two people. She has applied for this loan from Kiva through the Vision Finance Company to expand her business.  Once her shop is enlarged, Crotilde hopes to earn enough money to provide a better life to her family.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Erlinda's Group

texts.en: Erlinda D.'s main source of income comes from tending a canteen near a school. She is 30 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Banquero. Erlinda has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 9th loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. Erlinda is the leader of a five member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Erlinda D.'s Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jardin Del Altiplano Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “Jardín del Altiplano” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la banca comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la presidenta, la señora Olga.   Los negocios que las integrantes llevan adelante son variados: lavado de arena, venta de  coca, cría de conejos, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de llauchas (empanadas grandes con relleno de queso, su característica es que es jugosa), venta de ropa.

La señora Olga, presidenta de la asociacion comunal “Jardín del Altiplano”, indica que es la primera vez que solicita un prestamo.  Actualmente casada, madre de siete hijos, la actividad que desarrolla en su hogar es el tejido de camas en telar, a pedido.  Este primer crédito es por Bs 2000.-  y esta dirigido a la compra de lana y tambien al compra de coca, pues el negocio familiar ha sido la venta de esta hoja medicinal (la infusión de la hoja de coca puede curar dolores de estómago y dolores de cabeza producidos por la altura, la ciudad de El Alto está a más de 3.500 mts.).

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Jardín del Altiplano” (Garden of Altiplano) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch Community Association. The group consists of eight members. This group is led by its Board of Directors and the head of the board is the president, Sra. Olga. The members succeed in various businesses: sand washing, selling coca leaves, breeding rabbits, selling vegetables, operating a neighborhood store, selling “llauchas” (large turnovers filled with cheese and known for being quite juicy), and selling clothes.

Sra. Olga, the president of the “Jardín del Altiplano” Communal Association, says this is the first time she has requested a loan. She is currently married and the mother of seven children. Olga operates a business out of her home in which she weaves bedding on a loom based on orders she receives. Her first loan will be in the amount of 2000 BOB and used for buying wool. She will also buy coca leaves since her family has a side business selling medicinal leaves (an infusion of coca leaves can be used to cure stomach aches and headaches caused by altitude sickness since the city of El Alto stands at more than 3,500 meters above sea level).

When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, Sra. Olga replied that she enjoys having this loan.

loans.use: Purchase wool for weaving & medicinal coca leaves to sell

loans.name: La Bendicion 2, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Marta is the coordinator of her group "La Bendicion" 2, 4 & 5 (Blessing). She makes her home here in a simple house with her eight children and her long-time partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise and provide for her family. She plans to continue enjoying being with her children.

Marta is excited to be taking out her 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She has had her business for over six years, starting after the first loan she received from Esperanza Internacional. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pants, shirts, underwear and shoes. She will use the profits to pay for a lot that she acquired.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed to start up a business; a group was formed in her community and she was invited. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and unreliable electricity.

loans.use: new clothing for resale

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando V. M., está casado, tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad al igual que su señora esposa. El quiere comprar abonos y realizar unos trabajos que le faltan a su cafetal, por lo cual tiene que pagar la mano de obra de estas mejoras. El pretende mejorar su cafetal en todas las condiciones que se puedan para tenerlo más desarrollado y así obtener mejores cosechas de la plantación este año. El piensa en el futuro de sus hijos y la de su esposa por lo cual está realizando cada día mejoras a su plantación para cada vez obtener más ingresos de ella y así ir creciendo su nivel de vida y ofrecerle a sus hijos una mayor comodidad para que lleguen a ser unos profesionales algún día.  
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Orlando V. M. is married and has three children who, together with his wife, are his greatest priority.  He wants to buy manure and to finish some pending jobs in his coffee plantation so needs to pay labor costs to accomplish them.  He intends to improve all his coffee plantation’s conditions so that it will be better developed and thus obtain improved harvests this year.  

He thinks of his wife’s and children’s future so is always improving his crops daily in order to obtain more income from them thus improving their standard of living and providing his children with more comfort so that they will become professionals some day.

This is his first FUDECOSUR loan.  He hasn’t had previous loans with state banks but FUDECOSUR offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy coffee farming supplies.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MOSOQ RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana; la socia tiene 33 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia cuenta con una empresa dedicada a realizar tejidos en alpaca como chompas, mantas entre otros para luego exportarlo a Japon, la socia lleva años en este negocio la cual trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, la socia es una persona bien dedicada a su familia e hijos y lucha cada día por darles lo mejor.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su empresa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Roxana, 33, is a member of the “MOSOQ RUNA” communal bank, located in Cusco district which is part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has two children.  She has a firm dedicated to weaving Alpaca wool items like sweaters and blankets, among others, for export to Japan.  She’s been in this business several years and works in it with her husband.  She is a person who is devoted to her family and children and struggles daily to provide them the best.

She is asking for the loan to buy more merchandise for her firm.

She is happy about the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her firm.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is 24 years old and is married with one child. She is widely known for her business selling a variety of goods such as soap, biscuits, lotions, water and so on. Sophie has been in this business for five years and the hours of her business are from 6am until 9pm every day. 

She has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business. With this loan, Sophie will start adding to her business the sale of powders, pens, sugar,  etc. With the sale of these items, she will expand her business and thus her profits will increase. With these profits, she will gradually keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as lotions, soap, biscuits, and powders, pens, sugar,  etc.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is from the village of Conat, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, married and has four adult children. To make a living, Leonida runs a business venture in the food sector selling fish. Her main source of income comes from selling fish in the local community.

Leonida has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns approximately 8500 PHP a month for these activities. Leonida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell.

Leonida is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory. This will be the second loan taken out by Leonida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 26 years old and is married with one child, who is 3 years old.  Jean is a tailor and works from 6am to 9pm every day.  He has been in this business for 6 years.

Jean has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of buying a new sewing machine.  With any profits, Jean will be able to earn more profit, which will allow him to save in the future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Maame Yaa

texts.en: Maame sells palm oil and palm kernel oil in the village of Brasi in Cape Coast. She has received junior high education. Maame is married to a farmer and has five dependents. She assists her husband to feed and educate her children. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to process into palm and kernel oil for resale. She hopes to reinvest her new profit. Maame is standing by the kernels she uses to produce the palm kernel oil.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruits to process into oil for resale.

loans.name: Willian Alexander

texts.es:
William, vive con su esposa y tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, William se dedica a la venta de minutas, tiene experiencia en el negocio, es propio y lo aprendió desde pequeño, pero se dedica a él desde hace 6 años como medio de ingreso para su hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de jarabe, miel, azúcar, leche y hielo, estos son los ingredientes que él necesita para continuar ofreciendo minutas, con este préstamo espera realizar la inversión y aumentar sus ventas.
Su objetivo es tener buenas ventas, aumentar las ganancias y comprar lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
William lives with his wife and has one 5-year old child.  William dedicates himself to selling minutas (ground ice topped with fruit syrup).  He has a lot of experience, as he learned it from a young age.  He has been in business for 6 years, having started it as a means to generate income for his household.

Currently, he requests this loan for the purchase of syrup, honey, sugar, milk and ice.  These are the ingredients he needs to continue offering his minutas.  With this loan, he hopes to realize the investment and augment his sales.  His objective is to have good sales, increase his earnings, and buy what’s necessary for his family.

loans.use: buy syrup, honey, sugar, milk and ice.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Gina provides motorela or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the service. Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the service.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is 36 years old, hard-working and a mother of a 16-year-old child. She sells wall charts in her local area of residence. Prior to this, she was operating a boutique. She joined Faulu Kenya so that she would access financial resources easily.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has managed to expand her business by adding business stock.

In the next five years, she wants to open another business in her rural home. She has requested for 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy wall charts.

loans.use: To buy charts.

loans.name: Lizeth Angelica

texts.es: La Sra. Lizeth  tiene como actividad la venta de comida, en especial la venta de pollos broaster, actividad que desarrolla todos los días de la semana, ella es una persona joven muy trabajadora su familia esta compuesta por su esposo quien también trabaja como mensajero de una institución y su pequeños tres hijos,  el destino del crédito es para la compra de una maquina spiedera y la renovación de mobiliario de su snack para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que es muy conocida por el buen servicio que brinda a sus clientes, es una persona joven con ganas de superación agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Lizeth has a food business that specializes in selling roasted chickens. She manages her business every day of the week. Lizeth is a hardworking young woman. Her family consists of her husband, who works as a messenger for an institution, and their three small children.

This loan will be used to buy a rotisserie spit and to replace the furnishings in her snack bar so that she can provide better service to her customers. She is already well-known for providing good service to her customers. Lizeth is a young person who has the desire to succeed. She is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy a rotisserie spit and to replace the furnishings in her snack bar.

loans.name: Fadila

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 38 years old, married, and has five children. 

Fadila has owned a farm for rearing calves and cows since 1991. She has a lot of experience in this field, a deep understanding of local consumers, and is well known in her area. 

She is requesting a $2100 loan to buy a Friesian cow. She is aiming to make more profit to improve her family's quality life.

loans.use: To buy a Friesian cow.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Remy works hard to provide for the financial needs and basic needs of her family.

She has had a used clothing business for 2 years and she earns about P20,000 monthly. Due to high cost of basic commodities she would like to ask for a loan amounting to P20,000 to buy stock of used clothing to sell in her stall. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to be sell in her stall

loans.name: Saron

texts.en: Saron, 27 years old, sells food. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Their income is $6 per day. She has two children. They are three and one years old. Every month, she has to spend $60 on food, $6 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy grocery goods to sell in front of her house so that she can do two careers at the same time. Her mother-in-law is helping her. In the future, she wants to have a good shop at her house for selling food and groceries. She will work hard to send her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to sell at home

loans.name: Holman Antonio

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Managua el  señor Holman Antonio se dedica arduamente a laborar como conductor en una empresa de esta cuidad  dedicándose  a esta labor desde hace 5 años .es casado y con  tres pequeño hijos a las que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen. 
Una de las necesidades que el señor atraviesa hoy en día es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que ha tomado la sabia decisión  de iniciar la obra de mejora . es por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc,perlines .para iniciar la  mejora de la vivienda realizando el cambio de techo, por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos y esposa .
Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporciona a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Mr. Holman Antonio works very hard as a driver for a local company. He has done this work for five years. He is married with three small children for whom he must provide good conditions for their development.
One of the imperatives that he is now confronting is that he has to improve his home's conditions because it is in bad shape. For this reason, he has made the wise decision to start the work of improving it. This is why he has turned to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of construction materials such as zinc and purlin beams to start the work on his home. He will change the roof, thus offering his wife and children better living conditions.
It is important to emphasize that through this improvement, he will provide his family with a dignified roof over their heads so that they can have good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy zinc.

loans.name: Leangky

texts.en:
Leangky (in the photo) and her husband, Navuth, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1988 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of the children attend school: one is in university and another one is a cashier.

Leangky is a chef and runs a grocery store at home, while her husband is a soldier. Leangky asked for a Kiva loan once, previously, to purchase a motorbike. She is now applying for another loan of $1,000 to buy one more motorbike for her son, who is in university, to drive to school.

loans.use: to purchase one more motorbike for her son, who is in university, to drive to school.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida, 33, resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Jorge, an electrician, and the father of her two children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to cover their daily expenses.

Nida operates an appliance repair shop. They have one full-time head technician and other on-call workers when needed. She handles finances, accounts, inventories, and promotion of their business. They offer repair and check-up of all types of appliances like TVs, washing machines, air conditioners, and others. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in service fees every day. 

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy appliance spare parts. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Nida hopes to open another shop in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy appliance spare parts needed in her business

loans.name: Phadarany

texts.en: Phadarany, 23 years old, is a tailor who earns 5 USD per day. The woman standing next to her in the photo is her mother. She lives with three siblings: two are students and one more works in the factory and earns 4 USD per day. Every month, she has to spend 100 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity, 10 USD on school fees, and 10 USD on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of 1,200 USD to buy a motorbike for herself to travel to work. She plans to open a tailoring shop at home so she doesn’t have to travel far from home to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transportation to work

loans.name: Weumba Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Weumba Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Stephen is the facilitator of the Weumba Group. He takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Stephen had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on three-quarters of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Stephen was only able to harvest three bags of maize on three-quarters of an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Stephen and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Stephen will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Weumba Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
In the picture, the field officer is pictured standing on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 42 years of age. She is a kind and responsible parent to her family. She is thankful because her husband supports her in running their business. Rosemarie has been involved in the livestock business for six years up to nowadays. She is glad that her husband is her helper in feeding them daily. 

The couple has been blessed with three children; two of them finished their studies while the youngest is still studying. Rosemarie aims that her youngest child could also finish her studies, so the couple does their best to provide for their family's needs. According to her, she would like to improve her livestock business and make it more profitable so that she could save some and support her student. With her dreams for her child and business, Rosemarie is encouraged to join the program suited for her livestock business. In this way, she could improve and maintain her business. 

Rosemarie is requesting a loan amounting to 25,000 Philippines pesos, which will enable her to buy feeds, vitamins and an additional piglet to be raised. She hopes that through her requested loan, she could fulfill her dreams in life.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and an additional piglet for her livestock business.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Ramón, tiene la edad  de  39 años, está casado y vive actualmente con sus hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar materiales como alambre para la mejora de su finca de ganado e insumos para sus pastos. El cuenta con una finca sembrada  de pasto para el cuido del ganado, actualmente necesita hacerle unas mejoras en cercas y pastos por lo cual opto por el crédito. El necesita darle a sus animales una buena calidad de pastos y a su vez buenas cercas para evitar la salida del ganado a otras fincas. El tienen como meta con estas asistencias darle mejor cuido al ganado para así poder tenerlo en buenas condiciones para la venta y así obtener el mayor de las ganancias para mejorar su nivel económico y su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ramón, 39, is married, and currently lives with his wife and children, who are his greatest priority. With the loan he will buy materials such as wire for improving his cattle farm, and agricultural supplies for his pastures.  He has a farm planted with grass for raising cattle.  

At the present time he needs to make some improvements to his fences and pastures, so he decided to take out the loan. He needs to provide his animals with good quality grazing, and at the same time he needs good fences to prevent his cattle from straying onto other farms.

His goal is to use this assistance to take better care of his cattle in order to have  them in better condition for sale, and so get greater profits to improve his financial situation and his family's well-being.

This is his first loan with Fudecosur. He has not had other loans from regular banks before, but Fudecosur has offered him a loan on better terms, and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To maintain his cattle farm.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, age 24 and unmarried, is a fish vendor. He runs a shop that offers a variety of fish for sale, such as sardines and mackerel. He has operated his business for two years.

Richard joined HSPFI earlier this year. His goal is to make improvements to his business.

He has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000 in order to buy fish to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 62-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and has three children who are all working. Since his family depends on him and needs his support, Mohamad works nonstop to fulfill their needs. 

Mohamad started his own business as a taxi driver in 2009, and is looking forward to gain more clients. He’s good, welcoming, and friendly, which makes people loyal to him. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen S.a.l to perform needed maintenance on his car. He’s sure that this will enhance his business and make him earn superior income. In the future, he plans to collect money and hire someone to work on his behalf.

loans.use: To perform needed maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Mrs. Tep is a 57-year-old widow who has been living in the Baray district with four children. To earn a living, Mrs. Tep sells breakfast to the people living in her commune from small a store behind a pagoda. From this business, she generally earns about $3.50 per day to cover her primary daily expenses. She is very diligent in her work to pursue a comfortable living. 

Presently she owns two hectares of farmland, on which she has grown some types of potato crops. And now it's time to harvest her crops because they are ripe enough. For that reason, her lands will be available to grow a new cycle of potato crops. So she decided to ask for some funds from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to buy potato seeds to put on her farmland again. This is her second loan with HKL and first loan with Kiva. Mrs. Tep repaid her previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds to put on her farmland.

loans.name: Embajadores 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Juan is the coordinator of his group Embajadores 1 & 2 ("Ambassadors"). He is excited to be taking out his sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. This associate began with Esperanza because it is an interesting program offering more than just loans and low interest. 

Juan plans to use this loan to invest in his business: a fruit stand where he sells all kinds of fruit. He makes his home in a simple structure with his long-term partner and two children. He has had his business for almost four years, starting when he stopped working in private enterprise. He says that his most difficult challenge for now has been to travel to the USA. In the meantime he plans to continue to enjoy his work, being with his family and playing dominoes. He will use his profits to invest in his business and house. His future plan is to have a fruit mall and a vehicle.

His group is located in rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Guy Roger

texts.fr:
Client de 38 ans, celibataire avec 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 mois et 5 ans, n'ayant pas pu faire des longues etudes ,il s'arrête en classe de 6eme et commence avec la vente des habits pour se prendre en charge .

Il ya une année, il est client et bénéficie de plusieurs prêts, et a partir de cette année ,son commerce a connu un réel essor , son historique de remboursement a été très favorable et il a fait des épargnes considérables .
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il va renforcer le stock  des pantalons jeans, des polos, des marinières des chemises.

Tres pragmatique, il a de très grande ambition, ouvrir une grande boutique et s'occuper de la scolarité de ses enfants et investir pour acheter une parcelle pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Guy Roger, age 38, is unmarried with two children, aged 2 months and 5 years. Since he was unable to pursue his studies, he dropped out of school after six years, and started selling clothes to provide for himself.

He's been a client of Kiva's partner, HOPE, for one year and already benefited from several loans. Last year, his business started blossoming, his repayment history is very good, and he managed to put a lot of money away.

With this new loan, he will bolster his stock of trousers, jeans, polo shirts, long-sleeve shirts, and shirts.

Very pragmatic, he has big ambitions: to open a large shop, take care of his children's schooling, and buy a land lot for his family.

loans.use: to buy trousers, jeans, polo shirts, long-sleeve shirts, and shirts

loans.name: Cresten

texts.en:
Cresten is 22 years old and is married with one child. For the past three years she has had a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Cresten has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of food for her shop. With her profits she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of food for her shop.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en: Sophorn, a mother of five children, is 59 years old and a resident from Bantheay Meanchey province. To sustenance her family, she sells porridge and grow rice as the main source of income. Including this loan, she is the fifth-time borrower with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loan completely. Now, she joins a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her agribusiness and ingredient for making porridge for resale. She hopes to gain a good yield

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her agribusiness and ingredient for making porridge for resale

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Mrs. Hien  is a hardworking woman, 41 years old. She is married and has three children. She has been running her own cattle farming business for the past 15 years. She is responsible for fulfilling the needs of her entire family and for managing the household. She wants to purchase animals for her business purpose, but due to financial constraints she is unable to purchase these cattle. Therefore, she has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner QB WDF. This loan will enable her to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of her business.

loans.use: To buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of her business.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
My name is Antonio M., I have been selling rush-hats, leather belts, backpacks and briefcases for five years, I get my products from local artisans in my city. They are products that are produced primarily in this part of Honduras and are distributed on the national level, our city is one of the most visited by tourists and has tourists  year round. With my earnings from my business I support my three children who are in college.

Descripción del Negocio: Me llamo Antonio Mejía, me dedico a la venta de sombreros de junco, fajas de cuero, mochilas y maletines hace cinco años, mis compras las realizo a artesanos de mi ciudad ya que son productos que se producen mayormente en este departamento de Honduras y son distribuidos a nivel nacional, nuestra ciudad es una de las mas visitada por turistas y el movimiento es de todo el año. Con las ganancias de mi negocio mantengo a mis tres hijos que estudian en el colegio.

loans.use: Buying book bags, briefcases, belts.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has 10 years of experience in seafood sales, together with her husband, who taught her the business. He worked with his father from the age of 15. After he married Maria, they succeeded in founding their own business. They work every day from 7 am to 2 pm. They catch crabs, cook them, remove the meat and package it to be sold later.

Maria wants the loan so that she can invest it in her business, since she has demand she can't meet for lack of capital.

Maria is 28 years old. She has 4 children, all in school. Her children appreciate their parents for the effort they put into supporting them and giving them the opportunity to study. Maria and her husband wish to be able to buy a refrigerator with the earnings they are able to save. They now have a freezer where they store their seafood products but nothing of their own. They hope to buy their own house, as well, since they currently live with Maria's inlaws.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Maria tiene una experiencia de 10 años en el negocio de la venta de mariscos junto a su esposo que fue la persona que le enseño esta actividad. El desde la edad de 15 años comenzó a trabajar con su padre y una vez casado con Maria logran poner su propio negocio actividad que la realizan todos los días de la semana en el horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m. En si el trabajo de ellos consiste en capturar el cangrejo, cocinarlos para después proceder a sacar su carne y ponerlo en tarrina para su posterior venta. Maria desea el crédito para invertir en su negocio ya que tiene bastante demanda y no logra cubrir por falta de capital. Maria tiene 28 años, 4 hijos los cuales estudian y están muy agradecidos de sus padres por el esfuerzo que ellos hacen en darle el estudio y mantenerlos. Ellos desean poder comprarse una nevera con las ganancias para poder guardar su mercadería. Actualmente tiene un congelador donde guardan el producto pero no es de ellos. Desean también tener su casita ya que actualmente viven donde los padres de su esposo.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in fresh seafood to sell

loans.name: Tet

texts.en: Tet V. works as a landlord and also cooks pies that she sells around the city.  She makes an average of $3/day, while her husband makes $2/day working as an electrician.  She has 2 young children that she supports, as well as her mother.  Tet V. will use this loan to repair her rental home, and also to buy a cart for her pies so that she can cover more ground in the city.  As her income grows, she dreams of supporting her children in their education (She hope they can both get PhDs).

loans.use: To repair a home for rental and to buy a pie cart to sell her delicious pies!

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve snack bar business

loans.name: Allahverdi

texts.en: Q. Allahverdi is 68-year-ol farmer who live with his 6 children in the southern town of Azerbaijan in Bilasuvar. Allahverdi  is internally displaced person from Nagorniy Karabakh since 1993, he was fled to Bilasuvar during Azerbajani-Armenian conflict. Allahverdi has 12 year of experience in sheep breeding. He sells them for meat production which i in high demand in all across Azerbaijan. Children grow up and prices are strong, so living in small region become harder and harder. Allahverdi decided to expand his business and purchase additional seven sheep and one milkier cow.  The summer and autumn is high season for weddings and meat demand double increase during this time. The estimated cost for cow is 700-800 USD and for sheep is 70 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milky cow and seven sheep

loans.name: Paulina Vasco

texts.pt:
Paulina is married and has no children. She joined the credit program in 2004. She currently sells homemade popsicles at a street stand besides owning a small pharmacy. Her businesses are doing well – she was even able to buy a new freezer recently – and count with a regular clientele. Paulina would like to sell more popsicles but needs a loan in order to buy more plastic bags, which she will use as packaging.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulina e casada mas infelizmente ela nao tem filhos. O que lamenta bastante. Ela entrou para o Programa de credito do Fundo de desenvolvimento da Mulher em 2004.Ela vende gelados na sua banca.Mas por outro lado ela e proprietaria de uma farmacia.Ela tem muita clientela, principalmente por causa dos produtos farmaceuticos que vende.O negocio esta a correr-lhe muito bem. Ela ja comprou mais um congelador com os rendimentos do negocio. Ela pensa em ampliar o negocio.

loans.use: Paulina would like a loan to buy more packaging for her homemade popsicle business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali lives with his family in the region of Saida, in south Lebanon. He has four children and owns a coffee shop. Ali makes deliveries in the surrounding neighborhood. This is the 6th time Ali is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. This 42 year old man is planning to extend his shop for a more productive business.

loans.use: To extend his shop

loans.name: Allen's Group

texts.en:
Allen B. currently rears 500 chickens. Her investment is 2 million shillings and she makes a weekly profit of 4,200 shillings (about $35). She has 4 children and she plans to use the loan to buy more chickens and build another poultry house.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To add chickens and add buildings

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier lives on Apure Street in the town of San Jose de Yunguyo, located in the city of El Alto. He is single and lives with his father and younger brothers. He works as a baker making empanadas, or turnovers, which he distributes in various schools. The loan that he is soliciting will be used in the purchase of flour and ingredients necessary to bake empanadas. This is his first loan petition through Impro and an evaluation done qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Wendy Wise

Javier vive en la calle Apure de la zona San Jose de Yunguyo, ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. El es soltero vive con su padre y hermanos menores. Trabaja en la elaboración de salteñas las cuales distribuye en diferentes colegios educativos (salteñas son como empanadas, que en ingles significa “turnovers”). El crédito que ahora solicita lo destinara en la compra de harina e insumos necesaR. para la elaboración de sus salteñas.. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase flour and ingredients to bake empanadas (turnovers).  Compra de harina e insumos para elaborar salteñas

loans.name: Ruth Delania's Group

texts.en:
Ruth (pictured second from the left) is a 22-year-old newlywed and her husband is in the military. Ruth is opening her own salon to supplement the income that her husband earns in the military. Ruth spends her evenings and weekends studying at her local university, and she is very excited to start her own business. With this loan, Ruth would like to purchase a hair dryer and hair care (e.g., styling) products. In practice, Ruth plans to expand her hair care inventory and purchase only those products requested by her clients. Ruth hopes that the income generated from her beauty salon will allow her to complete her studies.

Ruth is the leader of her loan group, which includes Santa, Ana, Nancy, and Fior. All of the women in the group are hereby applying for their first loans and each one is a new entrepreneur with enormous hope for the future.

loans.use: To make early investments in new businesses (e.g., to purchase a hair dryer and hair care products for a beauty salon)

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi D., 58 years old, has joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2004. She uses most of her loans for her chicken breeding. Her loans increase each year, together with the profit from her job. In 2007, Mrs. D. earned a profit of 800USD (after deducting all the cost of buying chickens and chicken food). In 2008, according to TYM Fund policy, she is now qualified for the loan of 575USD to expand her business. Right now she is living with her husband and their only child in Y Yen, Nam Dinh province.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Đào, 58 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2004. Các vòng trước chị Đào sử dụng vốn chủ yếu cho việc chăn nuôi gà. Số tiền vay từ Quỹ lớn dần theo các năm tham gia, lợi nhuận cũng tăng theo mức vốn. Năm 2007, sau khi trừ chi phí mua gà giống, thức ăn, chị Đào lãi được khoảng 800USD. Sang năm 2008, theo quy định của Quỹ, chị đã đủ điều kiện và xin vay mức vốn 575USD đầu tư mở rộng dự án của mình. Hiện chị Đào đang sống cùng chồng và người con duy nhất tại Ý Yên, Nam Định.

loans.use: Buy chickens

loans.name: Carla Pedro

texts.pt:
26 year-old Carla Pedro T. was born in Maputo, Mozambique, where she still lives with her husband and two kids at her parents house. At age 15 her studies were interrupted due to her parents' financial difficulties and she started dedicating herself full-time to the family business of chicken raising. She heard about Hluvuku from a friend, in 2007, and is now applying for a loan of $425, which she plans to use to buy more baby chicks and chicken feed to improve the business and its profits. Her activities have allowed her to support her family for the past 10 years and have a positive impact in the community by providing indirect work for many women that resell her chickens. In the future, Carla hopes to expand the business by adding the necessary equipment to have egg-laying hens.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Nome da Cliente - Carla Pedro T. Localização - Bairro do Ferroviário, Maputo Actividade - Avicultura Montante Financiado - 10,000.00MT Aplicação – Compra de Pintos e rações Início- 25/03/2008 Fim- 18/03/2009 Carla Pedro T., nascido aos 8 de Setembro de 1981 em Maputo, vivendo com os seus pais até então. Estudou até 9ªclasse e porque os seus pais não estavam em condições de continuar a sustentar os seus estudos, teve que interromper dedicando-se ao negócio de criação de Frangos para o seu sustento o mesmo que vinha sendo desenvolvido pela família facto que fez com ela ganhasse larga experiência nesta actividade. Em 2000 casa-se e tem dois filhos continuando a residir em casa dos seus pais com o seu marido. Em 2007 através duma amiga soube da existência da Hluvuku tendo solicitado um empréstimo no valor de 10,000.00mt o pretende aplicar na compra de pintos e rações mostrando se entusiasmada pelo empréstimo uma vez que aumentou o número de Frangos, assim como a receita . Esta actividade tem impacto na sua vida e na Comunidade uma vez que garante o sustento da sua família a 10 anos e cria postos de trabalho indirectos para muitas mulheres que compram frangos para revenderem. Futuramente almeja construir um grande Aviário onde para além de criar Frangos de Corte quer criar Poedeiras para a produção de ovos e que poderá gerar vários postos de trabalho e para tal recorrerá ao empréstimo.

loans.use: To buy baby chicks and chicken feed to improve her chicken raising business

loans.name: Lok

texts.en:
Lok E. has two businesses to support his family. He goes around his village, door- to-door, purchasing recycle items and then sells them to the recycling plant. He also collects palm juice and refines it to palm sugar to sell in the market. He earns approximately three dollars a day.

His wife, Chheun Ean, raises a cow and owns a plot of farmland where she grows a variety of vegetables. On average, she earns around one dollar a day. They have five children; one is employed at a garment factory earning two dollars each day; three are construction workers and also make two dollars per day; the fifth is married and lives outside the family home.

Mr. Lok E. is looking for a loan to purchase a motorbike to transfer the recycle items to the plant.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transfer recycle items to the recycling plant.

loans.name: Juana Adilia

texts.es:
Doña Juana lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, is 38-years-old, and is married. Her husband works in transportation and helps with the home's expenses.

Juana's business is a restaurant. She has 8 years of experience and started with her own resources. She would like this loan to invest in working capital for the purchase of products to sell her food.

Her short-term plan is to make her location better for her customers, to have more sales, and to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Juana habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada. Su esposo es transportista y ayuda a los gastos del hogar.

El negocio de la Sra. Juana es una comideria, tiene ocho años de experiencia e inició con recursos propios. El préstamo lo quiere para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos para la venta de comida.

Su plan a corto plazo es tener un local mas acondicionado para sus clientes y así tener más ventas y mejorar su nivel de vida.

loans.use: To purchase products for food sales

loans.name: Zacarías

texts.es:
Zacarías S. P. is in the cleaning business for a company in Piedras Negras. His son, Miqueas, helps him support their family. They would like to have a loan of $1,200 USD in order to build two rooms in the back their house because it is too small and their family is big. He wishes to improve their living conditions. He had already started construction of the two rooms but had to leave the project unfinished due to lack of funds.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Zacarías S. P., se dedica a la limpieza en una empresa de Piedras Negras su hijo Miqueas le ayuda para poder mantener a su familia, ellos desean un préstamo de $1,200 dlls para construir dos cuartos en la parte de atrás de su casa ya que es muy pequeña y su familia es grande y desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida. El ya había empezado la construcción de estos cuartos pero por falta de recursos la dejo sin terminar.

loans.use: Construction of two rooms

loans.name: Fayiza

texts.fr:
Agée de 29 ans, Madame A. Fayiza réside dans le village de Tékponou avec sa famille. Mariée et mère de trois enfants, elle est la restauratrice des villageois. Elle est très appréciée à travers la qualité de ses mets et des épices qu’elle vend. 

Elle vend également des poissons comme activité parallèle. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle et éviter les ruptures de stock, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner en maïs et poursuivre son petit commerce d’épices et de poissons. 

Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer sa qualité de vie et celle de toute sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fayiza A., 29, lives in the village of Tékponou with her family. Married and the mother of three children, she provides cooked food for the villagers. The quality of her food is very much appreciated as are the spices she sells.

As a parallel business, she also sells fish. To satisfy her clientele and avoid shortages, she is asking for a loan to stock up on corn and pursue her little business selling spices and fish.

This will permit her to improve her quality of life and the living conditions of her whole family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling spices and corn

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mr. Mom M. was born in 1952, and he now lives in Pun Phnom Village in Takeo Province.  

He is a pig butcher who kills pigs for profit. His wife, Mrs. Kaing Song, owns small restaurant where she sells Khmer noodles to the villagers and visitors. 

Even though Mr. Mom M. and his wife have separate businesses, they still live in poor conditions. To improve their standard of living, Mr. Mom M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. 

Mr. Mom M. is 56 years old and the father of two children -- one is employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school. His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: La Sra. María Magdalena González T. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera de  6  hijos mayores de edad. La Sra. González hace frito  de pollo y enchiladas rellenas de arroz   por mas de 7 años, teniendo como clientes a los estudiantes de la universidad URACCAN y secundaria el colegio La  Normal, que la prefieren por ofrecer producto caseros, cabe mencionar que el único ingreso que recibe es el de su negocio. En estos momentos la Sra. González no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar en grandes cantidades los ingredientes de sus productos ofertados por esta razón   necesita comprar: 1 bidón de aceite a $ 46.00 dólares el bidón, 1 quintal de arroz a $ 62.00 dólares el quintal, 1 quintal de maseca a $ 38.00 dólares el quintal, 1 litro de acido acético a $ 4.00 dólares el litro, 25 libras de pollo a $ 1.00 dólar la libra, con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia y satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena Gonzalez T. is originally from the city of Bluefields. She is 37 years old, and a single mother with 6 older children. Mrs. Gonzalez has been making fried chicken and enchiladas filled with rice for more than 7 years, and she caters to the students at the University of URACCAN and the high school “La Normal”. Her clients prefer her because everything she makes is home made, and it is important to mention that the income from this business is her sole source of income. Currently she does not have sufficient means to buy in bulk. What she needs is 1 large can of oil for $46.00usd, 1 large bag of rice for $62.00usd, 1 large bag of corn flower for $38.00usd, 1 liter of vinegar for $4.00usd, and 25 pounds of chicken for $1.00/pound. With this investment she would be able to increase her profits and fill the demand of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase: 1 large can of oil 1 large bag of rice, 1 large bag of corn flower, 1 liter of vinegar and 25 pounds of chicken

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Joyce S. from Mwanza. She is married with four children, between the ages of 10 and 17. Joyce has been running a kuku farm since 2008.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Second, they require little space, so you can sometimes just let them run around your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

Joyce works at this kuku business for eight hours per day, seven days per week. Joyce currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to buy 200 chickens. In the future, she plans to further increase the number of her chickens. Joyce thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to raise

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia is a member of the Amor y Esperanza (“Love and Hope”) Village Bank. She is 38 years old and married with one child. 

Dionisia grows potatoes and wheat on her small farm in Chiara. She sells her crops in the Abastos Market in the city of Ayacucho. Dionisia and her husband also own a tractor, so their neighbors hire them to plow their farms. Dionisia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy potatoes to plant and to pay her farmhands.

Dionisia’s dreams are for her children to get a good education, to improve her business, and to continue growing crops.

loans.use: Buy potatoes to plant, pay farmhands

loans.name: Mansata

texts.fr:
Mansata M. a une cantine au marché de Grand Dakar. Elle vend du tissus et de la mercerie pour soutenir son époux dans la prise en charge de la fammille.
Cette brave mére de famille sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son commerce et engranger davantage de revenus.
texts.en:
Mansata M. has a shop at the Grand Dakar marketplace. She sells cloth and sewing supplies to support her husband with regard to family responsibilities. This good and honest woman is requesting a loan to boost her commerce and to accumulate more income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construct a wall.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina A. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through commercial college and now sells food supplies like groundnuts at the Elmina New Market, which she has done since 1996. Her husband works as a commercial driver. Georgina uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses and will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of food supplies to meet the increased demand of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Georgina plans to develop a plot of land which she bought with her husband to build their family house.

loans.use: To purchase more food to resell to customers

loans.name: Lucinda Esther|

texts.es:
La señora Lucinda Esther R. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en el Jr. Victoria Vásquez Nº 273, Distrito de Morales, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviente, madre de 03 hijos y tiene 56 años.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, motivada por su  esposo y sus hijos se inicio vendiendo golosinas en los colegios y ropas usadas en los pueblos. Tiene 04 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la elaboración de kekes utilizando su horno a gas los mismos que los comercializa en las bodegas de la ciudad, además  vende  ropa usadas por las tardes. 
Con el préstamo de S/2,000.00 que cancelara a plazo de 06 meses, lo invertirá comprando harina y azúcar en sacos , mantequilla en kilos, huevos en javas, leche en cajas, esencia de vainilla en botellas, gas en balones.

Ella y su esposo son los manejan los gastos y ganancias de su negocio. Ahora se siente una Mujer independiente, más segura, responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y toma sus propias decisiones.

Lucinda, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela R. por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucinda Esther R. S. belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Moralinas.” She lives at Jr. Victoria Vásquez Nº 273, Morales district, San Martín department. She is married, is a mother to 3 children, and is 56 years old. With her first loan for S/. 300.00, motivated by her husband and children she began selling candy at the schools and used clothing in the towns. She has been working with the Bank for 4 years. Today she makes cakes with her gas oven and sells them in the grocery stores in the city, in addition she sells used clothing in the afternoons. With the loan for S/2,000.00, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy sacks of flour and sugar, kilos of butter, crates of eggs, boxes of milk, bottles of vanilla extract, and cylinders of gas. She and her husband take care of the expenses and income from her business. Now she feels like an independent woman, more assured, responsible with her loan payments and making her own decisions. Lucinda thanks Manuela R. for permitting her to grow as an entrepreneur and woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, sugar, butter, eggs, milk, gas.

loans.name: Coudou

texts.en: Codou S. is 48 years old and has been a member of the Bayof Pout village bank for several years.  She sells fruit and would like a loan to be able to purchase fruit in bulk to resell.  Depending on the season, she normally sells mandarins, watermelons, oranges, mangoes, or melons.  She is married and intends to use the profits from her loan to take care of her family.

loans.use: Purchase fruit for selling.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.es: Elisabeth tiene 52 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de frutas que trae de sus viajes a la selva y las vende en su localidad al por menor, repartiendo a sus clientes, y del mismo modo lleva de su localidad productos nativos  para venderlos en la selva. En algunas ocasiones realiza un intercambio de productos, Elisabeth viene desarrollando esta actividad desde hace 5 años y ha visto las ganancias y los resultados de este trabajo que le han permitido solventar los gastos familiares de su casa. Para más adelante quiere crecer en su negocio incrementando su capital. Es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal porque vieron en ella a una persona responsable y dispuesta a realizar un trabajo en equipo. Con el dinero requerido comprará más mercadería, específicamente sacos de granos para venderlos en la selva, y allá comprará frutas.
texts.en:
Elisabeth is 52 years old and lives with her husband and her 2 children in their own home. She sells fruits that she brings from her trips to the forest and sells them in her town, distributing them to her clients. In the same manner, she brings native products from her town to sell in the forest. On some occasions, she exchanges the products. Elisabeth has been developing this activity for 5 years and has seen the earnings and results of this work, which have allowed her to settle her household expenses. In the future, she would like to grow her business and increase her capital. This is the first time the she has requested a loan with MFP. She was invited to be a part of her community bank because they saw in her a responsible person who was ready to work in a team. With the money she requested, Elisabeth will buy more merchandise, specifically sacks of grains to sell in the forest, and there, she will buy more fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina es una señora de 44 años, está casada, tiene 5 hijos, 4 de ellos ya son adultos y viven  en Lima, y sólo uno los acompaña en sus jornadas de cultivo. Con una enorme sonrisa nos muestra sus cultivos de lechugas, las cuales ha sembrado en su  chacra al costado de su casa. También siembra papa, alverjas y olluco, cuyas ganancias le han servido para educar y mantener a sus hijos, que gracias a su trabajo les brindó la secundaria completa en la ciudad de Tarma. Catalina trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, por ello se levanta a las 4.00am para preparar los desayunos y el almuerzo para después ir a trabajar, con la finalidad de terminar de educar a su último hijo. Ahora está viendo la posibilidad de sembrar de forma paralela las hortalizas y los tubérculos, para evitar tener meses sin dinero suficiente, ya que la cosecha de lechugas las realiza cada dos a tres meses. Este es su 4to crédito con MFP, y al igual que en sus anteriores préstamos se compromete a pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas. El dinero que viene solicitando en esta oportunidad es para la compra de fertilizantes para el abonado de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Catalina is a forty-four-year-old woman, is married and has 5 children, four of whom are adults and live in Lima. Only one of her children accompanies her in the farm. With a big smile, she shows us her lettuce crops, which she has sown in her farm next to her house. She also sows potatoes, peas, and olluco (a tuber), whose earnings have allowed her to educate and take care of her children. Thanks to her work, she offered her children complete secondary educations in the city of Tarma. Catalina works with her husband. She wakes up at 4:00 am to make breakfast and lunch and later goes to work, with the goal of finishing funding the education of her last child. Now, she is seeing the possibility of sowing vegetables and tubers at the same time, so that she can avoid having months without enough money, since the lettuce harvest occurs every two or three months. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and just like in her previous loans, she promises to pay her installments punctually. The money that she is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers to fertilize her farms.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Safia Muhammad Bashir Group

texts.en:
(This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.)

Khursheed baji is requesting a loan to buy embroidering material, such as colored thread, beads, and clothes, for her decorative embroidering business.

Naziran baji is requesting a loan to buy bedsheets to sell.

Safia baji is a wife of M. B., a man who runs a grocery shop in the community. Safia baji is the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. They all live in Yadgar, a historical part of town in Lahore, Pakistan. They all independently handle their own businesses. They are responsible to pay utilities and the school fees of their kids. Safia baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries to diversify her husband's grocery store.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị is a 37 year-old woman living in Đô Lương. She is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Nguyễn Thị has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 1500000 VND a month.

In 2007, Nguyễn Thị joined the TYM Fund to access financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She successfully repaid a loan of 7000000 VND from TYM Fund to expand her business.

Nguyễn Thị is requesting a loan of 9000000 VND to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her third taken out from TYM Fund. Nguyễn Thị plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania M., 50, is married with six children. She has many years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the villagers and general public three days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). She has five previous loans with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Epifania’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge, cooler, fishing net, spear, and materials to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Kasmero

texts.en:
Kasmero G. is currently in the business of selling beans, rice, potatoes, etc., at a restaurant.  She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant to sell. Kasmero is 28 years old and married to an army man. She has two children who both go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services. These are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. 

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs at the resturant to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios D. has been an entrepreneur for decades. She’s into buying and selling of goods that are in demand in any given season. She is now 58 years old and she lives in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City, with her husband, Victoriano: also 58 and a salesman. They have five children: three of whom have their own families already and the two youngest remain under their care.

Remedios is now concentrating on buying and selling fresh chickens, eggs and edible oil. She has a home-based business. She earns more than 2,000 PHP every week.

Remedios just joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in the first quarter of this year but she is already enjoying the warm ambiance of the weekly gatherings of her fellowship group. Now on her third loan cycle with CCT, she's applied for a 8,000 PHP loan which she will use to purchase additional products to sell.

About CCT: The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Lizalie

texts.en:
Lizalie C. is from the village of Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 33 years old. Lizalie is married and has one young child. To make a living, Lizalie owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, and electronic load in the local community. Lizalie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lizalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lizalie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lizalie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

location.town: Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Tania Aspacia

texts.es:
La señora Tania es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Caña”  que esta ubicado de el distrito de Plateria, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 28 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, tiene estudios superiores (ing., Industria Alimentaría), y es madre de 01 hijo,  vive en Plateria.

La señora trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de insumos para la fabricación de néctares. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1100.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de edulcorantes, botellas,  estabilizantes, zaborisantes, etc. Para su negocio de fabricación de néctares, los cuales los distribuye en las tiendas de la zona.

Su mayor sueño es terminar su carrera.
A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos
texts.en:
Ms. Tania Q. is a member of the “Señor de la Caña” Communal Bank, located in the Plateria district of the Puno province, department of Puno. She is a 28-year-old woman with a live-in partner and a child. She lives in Plateria, and is pursuing a degree in the Foodstuff Industry. Ms. Q. has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 2 years. Her initial loan, which she used to purchase supplies to make fruit nectar, was for 300.00 PEN. At this time, she is requesting a 1,100.00 PEN loan so that she can purchase sweeteners, bottles, stabilizers, flavorings etc. to make juice, which she then distributes throughout several stores in the area.
