Her biggest dream is to finish her studies. She likes the savings offered by her bank, and the ease of obtaining loans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweeteners, bottles, stabilizers, flavorings etc.

loans.name: Herm

texts.en: Herm H. is married with two children. He lives with his wife (pictured) in Battambong Province Province. To make a living, he is engaged in the construction business as a construction foreman, typically earning US $5 per day which is the primary source of income for his family. His wife is involved in a business of selling vegetable in a local market, earning an income of US $3 per day. Both of them have to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for the family and the children. Therefore, Phanna is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase various kinds of vegetable to expand her inventory.

loans.use: buy vegetable

loans.name: Barbara's Group

texts.en: B. Barbara is the leader of her lending group in Kayunga. She is a hard working and determined lady with a bar business that she has been running for over 10 years in the same location. She started so small with the limited capital that she secured from her husband and friend until she joined her lending group years back to secure loans and these have helped her so much in boosting her business. her bar operates mostly in the evenings when most of her customers are done with their day’s chores until the wee hours of the night. She admits that some of her customers are unruly after consuming a few bottles but due to the experience she has in the business, she knows what to do when such a scenario occurs. Barbara works so hard to ensure that her children can access the best of education to the last level by paying their school fees with much ease. She needs a loan to help recapitalize her business by stocking more crates of sodas, beers and wines since buying in bulk reduces the costs.

loans.use: Restocking her bar with more crates of sodas, beers and wines.

loans.name: Patrick Tom

texts.en:
Patrick is married to Hanna and they have no children yet.

Patrick was introduced to KADET by existing clients, and has no previous credit history. He has been in the business of selling water and shoes for seven years. He intends to use this loan to buy a motorbike so he can transport his water for sale in other locations and diversify his source of income.

Patrick's business is in a slum area, and the residents of the area are his customers. With the extra profits he will purchase a stock of shoes to sell.

Patrick's hopes are to own a minibus and use it for the transportation of people. He believes he is hardworking.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website:  www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport his water and diversify his income

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch K. is a 27-year-old married mother who currently lives in the best territory of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is a Khmer cake seller in the market, selling the cake that she makes in her home. She has two school-aged children. Another source of family income comes from her husband's working as a local chef. In addition, she will be using her loan to buy a small plot of farmland in a good location for farming. She will rent her land to the farmers for a fee.

loans.use: To buy a small plot of farmland in good location to rent to farmers

loans.name: Juma Zia Group

texts.en:
M. Juma is the son of M. A. who is the group leader of Juma Zia group. He is married and he lives in district 2 in Kabul Afghanistan. This group is made up of two members each one of them is busy with different tasks. M. Juma has a tailoring shop. With the loan he would like to buy the essential materials for his business.  Gull Sib, the second member of this group wants to take a loan for his son who has a fresh fruit shop. With the loan he receives he would like to expand his business and purchase more fresh fruits to attract more clients.
They want to take a group loan of 20000 Afghani to develop their businesses and they are confident that they will repay their loans on time. They would like to thank Kiva for their help.

loans.use: they want to purchase the things they need

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing E. is 29 years old, married and has two children, the youngest a year old. She sells used, moderately worn clothing to her customers. She purchases these clothes from Lagos to sell in Agbor, Delta State. She makes 10,000 NGN in profits each month.

Blessing’s used clothes are much in demand by those who cannot afford new clothes during this festive season. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more used clothes to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina, tiene una tienda D. barrio en la zona D. Cotacota, es un negocio bien surtido y tiene buena venta debido a que es la única tienda en la calle donD. ella vive, ella es una pesona trabajadora y responsable, ya que por las mañanas trabaja como empleda D. limpieza y por las tardes atienD. el negocio, el esposo trabaja D. albañil en la zona D. Cotacota y ayuda a su esposa con los gastos D. la casa, tienen hijos ya casados, por lo que no tienen obligaciones y gastos adicionales.
texts.en:
Cristina has a neighborhood shop in Cotacota. It is a well-stocked store that has good sales since it is the only store on the street where she lives. She is a hard-working and responsible person. In the mornings, she works as a cleaning lady and in the evenings she manages her business. Her husband works as a bricklayer in Cotacota and helps his wife with the bills. They have children who are already married and for whom they don't have debts or additional expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.fr: Removed at borrower request

loans.use: purchase of children's outfits, hair extensions, and shoes for resale

loans.name: Primera Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Primera Esperanza (First Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, a poor, agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their child.

Maria is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling new clothing by purchasing jeans, polo shirts, and blouses in Santo Domingo in the main market and then selling them in her community at a profit. She will use the profits to invest in a new floor for her family, which will improve sanitary conditions. She will also save for the university education of her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: Carmelito

texts.en:
Carmelito M. is from the town of Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de oro City. He is 53 years old. Carmelito is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmelito owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including dried fish and shrimp, in the local community. Carmelito has been engaged in his business for more than ten years and earns approximately PHP 7,800  a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carmelito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelito is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carmelito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misa

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad T. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Natividad owns and operates a business offering motor transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Natividad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from GDMPC. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair her motorcycle in order to provide better service. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Jesus Is Lord Group

texts.en:
Mardia L. is the leader of a group five borrowers called Jesus Is Lord. She is 43 years old, married, and has five children ranging in age from 7 to 26.  She finished high school and started attending college, but had to drop out due to financial problems.

For more than 10 years, Mardia has been baking bread for sale at the 72nd community on the SKD Boulevard in Paynesville, Liberia.  She prepares her bread well and approaches her customers in a nice manner which keeps customers returning.

But she faces problem when supplying customers who do not want to pay on time.  She plans to use her portion of this 36,000 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase some baking materials such as flour, sugar, and butter. Her hopes and dreams are to build a house for her family if her business improves in the near future.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mardia is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase some baking materials such as flour, sugar, and butter.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana C. M. A. is married and has five dependents. She has no educational background. Her husband is a fireman.

Juliana sells bags of sachet water (water in plastic bags) at Akotokyire and uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Juliana will use the loan to purchase more bags of water for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to educate her dependents.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of water to sell

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 17 people located in Trapeang village in Takeo province. Mrs. Khorn N. is 44 years old and the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Each member of this village loan will use it to support a different purpose.
Mrs. Khorn N. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice. In addition to farming, she is also a pig breeder at home. In order to support her pig breeding business, Mrs. Khorn N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food. Her husband, Mr. Vanna Chhil, is a village chief who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has three children; one is a construction worker and two are students.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Elvita

texts.en:
Elvita C. is from the village of Research Minante, Cauayan City. She is 44 years old. Elvita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvita sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Elvita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Elvita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvita is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Elvita's seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Glyn

texts.en:
Glyn L. is from the village of Sinian Balanlinao Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Glyn is married and has one adult child. Glyn owns and operates a business that provides motorcycle services. Glyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Glyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from GDMPC, which was for 20,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

Glyn is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase motorcycle spare parts. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase motorcycle spare parts.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 31 years old, married with two children. The first born is 4 years old and the younger one is 3. Francois takes care of two dependents in his family. Francois owns a small business selling cow meat in his place of residence. Francois is organised in his business as well as known. The hours of his business are from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day except on Saturday.

Francois is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing his business through purchasing enough cows for his butcher shop. With this loan Francois will be able to satisfy demand which will allow him to earn more profit.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Ángel Fausto

texts.es:
Ángel Fausto L. V. tiene 60 años.  Es casado y vive con su esposa y 4 hijos, de 25, 23, 20 y 18 años, en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Ángel es un socio de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Ángel trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas, cebada, trigo y otros cultivos. Realiza sus compras en Guaranda y Echeandia y sus ventas cada 6 meses en los 2 pueblos.
 
Solicita el préstamo para poner un negocio de animales, para comprarlos y después venderlos. Piensa que el crédito le ayudara a ganar mas dinero para seguir adelante e invertir en el negocio. Su sueño es encontrar ayuda para la agricultura. Dice que no es seguro de tener la cosecha con las plagas. También en el verano hay sequía y en el invierno, demasiado agua. 

Le gusta trabajar. Quisiera que sus hijos sean estudiantes o bachilleratos.
texts.en:
Ángel Fausto L. V. is a 60-year-old man who lives with his wife and 4 children, ages 25, 23, 20, and 18, in the Guaranda canton of the Bolívar province.

Ángel is a member of the Patrón San Juan rural microfinance institute, located a half an hour from Guaranda. There is a total of 16 members in the group, the majority of whom cultivate corn and potatoes. This is the group's first loan from the San José cooperative.

Ángel works in agriculture, cultivating potatoes, barley, wheat, and other crops. He makes his purchases in Guaranda and Echeandia and sells his products every 6 months in the those two towns.

He is requesting this loan in order to start selling and buying animals. He thinks that this loan will help him earn more money so that he can make progress and invest in the business. His dream is to find help with his agriculture. He states that there is no guarantee of a good harvest because of pests. There is also drought in the summer and too much rainfall in the winter.

He likes to work. He would like for his children to become students or get their degrees.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Launch animal business

loans.name: Sara Del Socorro

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer de 36 años, trabajadora, madre de dos hijos, casada, su esposo de oficio conductor.
Se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace dos años, pues ha contado con el apoyo de su familia como la de su esposo. Para la inversión.
Con el objetivo de poder aportar a los gastos, logrando mejores beneficios para su familia.
Mediante el financiamiento que la institución ha dado ha logrado mejorar su casa con el crédito anterior logro terminar un cuarto.
Y con este préstamo lograra hacer otro cuarto en la parte de atrás de su casa para poder cubrir la necesidad de privacidad de sus hijos ya que anteriormente todos dormían en un mismo cuarto lo que era incomodo. Y gracias a la oportunidad de Afodenic nuestras vidas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Sara is a hard-working 36-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of two children. Her husband is a professional driver. For the past two years, she has worked selling clothing and cosmetics. She received support from her family and from her husband for the investment involved. Sara's aim is to be able to contribute to the household expenses, thus achieving greater benefits for her family. Through the financing granted to her by the institution, she has been able to improve her home. With the previous loan, she was able to finish a room. With the current loan, she will be able to finish adding another room at the back of her home, so that she can satisfy her children's need for privacy. Previously, everyone slept in one room, which was uncomfortable. Thanks to the opportunity provided by Afodenic, she reports, "our lives have improved."

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials to add a room for her children at the back of her house

loans.name: Menecia

texts.en: Menecia D. C. is from the village of Sta. C., Benito Soliven. She is 43 years old. Menecia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Menecia runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Menecia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Menecia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Menecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Menecia is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Menecia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lilian Akinyi

texts.en:
Lilian is a twenty-eight year old mother of two children, Mary and Derick, who are aged four and six years respectively. She is married to a gentleman called Mr. W..

She was introduced to Kadet by existing members and with this second loan, Lilian plans to purchase more shoes for sale. She has been in the business for fourteen years and she has been making sustainable profit.

Her future plan is to expand the business into the wholesale field.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of shoes

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomás vive en la zona  Aconi, Provincia  Aroma, del Departamento La Paz junto a su   esposa y sus hijos  los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. Se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche la vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  de leche). El crédito será destinado a compra de ganado. Es su primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Tomás lives in Aconi neighbourhood of Aroma province in the department of La Paz together with his wife and school-aged children. He earns his living by raising cows and selling the milk to PIL Andina, an industrial milk plant. The loan will be used to buy more cows. This is his first loan with both Impro and Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Maman Kinsimédé Maman

texts.fr: A. est une femme de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants, son époux exerce comme activité la soudure. elle s'est lancée il y a de cela 2 ans dans le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale. elle s'est installé dans une petite boutique pour exercer son activité. elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite un deuxième prêt pour gonfler son stock avec 4 cartons de spaghetti, 2 cartons de détergents OMO, 3 paniers de tomates et divers autres produits d'alimentation générale.
texts.en:
A. is a 41-year old woman, married and the mother of four children. Her husband works as a weldor. About two years ago, she opened a small store and started selling general food products. She already had a loan from WAGES, which she has properly repaid. She is now seeking a second loan to expand her stock by buying four boxes of pasta, two boxes of detergent (OMO brand), three baskets of tomatoes and other general food products.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing food products

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia L., age 40, sells agricultural equipment to local farmers. She deals primarily in crop fertilizers such as manure. Virgilia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. She and her husband live in the village of Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. They have one school-aged child.

In 2009, Virgilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Virgilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Virgilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Virgilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary B. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  Mary has a business of a clinic. She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Mary sells her products from home, by means of retail. Mary has requested a loan of 2,000,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of drugs. She also generates additional income through poultry farming. The main business challenge(s) for Mary include transportation and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked clinic and to educate her children up to university. Mary lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of drugs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy household property

loans.name: Wan Ward Mabureh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Wan Word Mabureh” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 600,000 for each to invest in their businesses. 

Kadiatu B. is the leader of this group. Kadiatu is twenty-four years old, and she is married with two children. Kadiatu sells market food – palm oil, rice, onions, vegetable oil, nut oil, sugar, etc. She has been doing business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy palm oil, rice, sugar, onions, vegetable oil, and nut oil wholesale

loans.name: C4609 Twikebuke Group

texts.en:
Alphonsine, 33 and married, is the leader of a five-member group called Twikebuke. Alphonsine owns a small shop which sells a variety of products including basic foodstuffs such as sugar, rice, flour, etc. She has five years of experience and her shop is open from 6 a.m to 6 p.m. everyday.

. Alphonsine and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to earn more profit.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell, including sugar, rice, and flour

loans.name: Indira

texts.en: This is 25-year-old Indira T.. She is married and has one child, aged 7. In 2005, she established her cow-raising business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and will use her most recent loan to buy a young, milk-giving cow. In the future, Indira plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI (microfinance institution), Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates by joining the BPW Kiva lending team.

loans.use: To buy a young, milk-giving cow

loans.name: Marleni

texts.en:
Marleni is 42 years old and married with three children. She belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the department of Cusco, Peru.

Marleni is requesting the loan to invest in her bakery. The city of Oropesa is famous for bread making and Marleni will use her loan to buy firewood for her oven, which is very expensive this time of year. Marleni is very happy with her loan and is committed to making full and on-time payments.

loans.use: to buy firewood for bakery oven

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo G. is from the village of Mangga. He is 23 years old and single. Alfredo owns and operates a business raising crops, with his main source of income coming primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2010, Alfredo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Alfredo from ASKI. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
La señora Hortencia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias, del distrito de Calleria y departamento de Ucayali, tiene 56 años de edad y 3 hijos (dos mayores y uno que todavía está a su cargo).
La señora Hortencia tiene su negocio de venta de comida, todo asado en carbón, es un trabajo que no deja mucha ganancia pero le alcanza para sus gastos primarios y para poder seguir trabajando.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,300.00 nuevos soles comprará una mesa de 2 metros y 2 bancas grandes, 1 mantel de plástico, 2 fuentes, ½ doc. De jarras de ½ litro de vidrio, y un paraguas grande para cuando llegue el invierno y otras pequeñas cosas que necesita.
La señora Hortencia quiere seguir trabajando para poder darle estudios a su hijo sin que le falte nada, porque el estudio es la única herencia que se puede dejar a su  hijo y dice que lo va lograr gracias a Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Hortencia is a member of the "Mujeres Solidarias" (Supportive Women) community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 56 years old and has three children (two are grown up and one is still in her care). 

Hortencia's business is selling fire-roasted food.  It is work that doesn't make much profit but it makes enough to cover all her basic needs and enough that she is able to continue working.  

Hortencia will use this new loan for 2,300 Peruvian soles to buy a 2 meter-long table and 2 large benches, 1 plastic tablecloth, 2 dishes, half a dozen 1/2 liter glass pitchers, a large umbrella for the winter and some other small things that she needs.

Hortencia would like to continue working so that she can provide her son with an education without him wanting for anything.  An education is the only inheritance she has to leave her son and she says that she will achieve it thanks to Manuela Ramos

loans.use: To buy a 2 meter-long table, 2 large benches, 1 plastic tablecloth, 2 dishes, half a dozen 1/2 liter glass pitchers and a large umbrella for the winter

loans.name: Carmen Rosalina

texts.es:
La Señora. Carmen P. es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir, vive en la comunidad de la Floresta en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura. Muchos han migrado en busca de trabajo para entregarle un mejor futuro para sus hijos.

Doña Carmen tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene una niña de 3 años de edad, su esposo labora en la construcción como oficial de albañilería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus padres pero independientes.
 
La Señora. Carmen se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y también a la cría animales como: cerdos y cuyes los que vende en su comunidad.
 
Hace 13 años es socia del banco comunal y le gusta porque tiene muy buenas amigas con quienes comparte en cada reunión,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de animales para crecer en este negocio. Su sueño es  tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen P. is a member of the Nuevo Porvenir community bank. She lives in the Floresta community in the parish of Cumbe, where the weather is cold. The people from her community are traders, farmers and animal breeders. Many of them have moved away in search of work so that they can provide their children with a better future.

Señora Carmen is 36 years old, married and has a three-year-old daughter. Her husband works in construction as a master bricklayer. They do not have their own house, so they live at home with their parents, but independently.

Señora Carmen takes care of the household chores and she also raises animals such as pigs and guinea pigs, which she sells in the community.

She has been a member of the community bank for 13 years and she likes it because she has some very good friends who attend the meetings with her. She will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of animals so that her business can grow. It is her dream to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy pigs and guinea pigs

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie C. and her husband Offie own 3rd Eye Surveillance, through which they sell, design, and service surveillance equipment.  Now in its seventh year of operations, 3rd Eye Surveillance has grown beyond its founders to include an additional full-time employee and four independent contractors.  Besides selling surveillance systems, 3rd eye surveillance also sells pepper spray and other violence-deterring products.

At first, the majority of 3rd Eye Surveillance’s business came from installing security systems at apartment complexes.  Offie ran the business, while Marie had another full-time job that helped support themselves and their two children.  When Marie quit her job to help run 3rd Eye Surveillance, she helped make their business HUB-certified (Historically Underutilized Businesses).  She says this certification makes them eligible for government contracts, and makes them more attractive to large corporations.

Marie and Offie want to start selling security systems wholesale to other independent contractors and have the contacts in place to begin importing.  They need financing to help them with the high start-up costs.  Because Marie and Offie had been paying cash for their purchases, their credit score kept them from getting a loan from commercial banks.  Marie is using this loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana to build her credit score, so that she can qualify for a larger loan this summer.  She and Offie ultimately want to receive financing so that they can begin importing surveillance systems to sell wholesale.

Marie and Offie donate and install free surveillance systems for organizations that need added security but lack the resources to pay.  For example, they donated and installed a surveillance system for the Genesis Women’s Shelter.  They have also donated surveillance systems to churches and retirement homes.

Check out their website at http://www.3rdeyesurveillance.net/index.html.

loans.use: To build credit

loans.name: Foray

texts.en: This is 28 year-old S..  He is single, and has no children.   In 2008, S. established his drinks and top up (phone card) business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. S. requires a loan in order to buy additional beer, stout, Heineken and soft drinks. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, S. plans to own a building and get married.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drinks for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics and sewing materials

loans.name: Docki

texts.en: E. is currently in business selling alcohol. She is 30 years old, married, with four children and all of them go to school. E. borrowed a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. She hopes to pay for her children in school in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Security Group

texts.en:
Asma Selemani, is in her early twenties and married with a four-year-old son. She has been running a video library for two years.  She works from 7.00am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Asma's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a plot of land, to buy householdings and also increased the library stock. She has paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more CDs and DVDs for her library.  Her dream is to one day have a big and international library.

Asma will share this loan with her loan group "Security"  which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Asma is 2nd from left in a red dress.

loans.use: To buy more CDs and DVDs for the video library

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité Primavera nace mediante la gestión de la Sra. Ma. Francisca. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
Ma. Francisca, presidenta del grupo está domiciliada en la ciudad de San Lorenzo,  y es una mujer casada, con  dos hijas, y muy emprendedora.
Motiva a sus compañeras a optar por la superación tanto en lo personal como en lo económico.
Todas las integrantes están conformes con los programas que se van desarrollando, han demostrado desde siempre un gran interés por todo lo implementado en la Fundación.
Ma. Francisca solicita el crédito para la adquisición de artículos para fiestas como ser souvenires, globos, piñatas, juguetes, etc. para incrementar el negocio y ayudar a solventar los gastos que se presenten.
texts.en:
The committee "Primavera" (Spring) was born through the work of Sra. Ma. Francisca.  This committee is from the city of San Lorenzo.  The committee members set the growth of each member as their principal objective.  The members are all known for being very hard-working.
Ma. Francisca, president of the group, lives in the city of San Lorenzo.  She is married, has two daughters and is very enterprising.
Ma. Francisca motivates her companions to choose to overcome difficulties in their personal as well as their financial lives.
All of the members are happy with the programs that are developing.  They have always shown a great interest in everything implemented by the Foundation.
Ma. Francisca is requesting the loan to acquire party supplies like party favors, balloons, piñatas, toys etc. in order to increase her business and to help settle the expenses that come up.

loans.use: to purchase party supplies like party favors, balloons, piñatas, toys etc.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus -Chupaca Group

texts.es:
L. señora Carmen María es socia D. L. alcancia comunal D. divino niño jesus, D. 56 años D. edad vive en L. zona rural D. L. provincia D. Chupaca, L. socia es casada tiene 2 hijos, Marcos  D. 18 años en L. universidad y Carlos D. 12 años D. edad en L. etapa escolar, quienes le ayudan a su madre en L. preparación D. los diferentes platos típicos, en horas D. L. mañana preparan los platos como el puchero, L. quinua a tamalada, chicharon colorado, picante D. cuy y D. refresco L. chica D. ccora que es preparada a base D. 7 semillas, su esposo trabaja independientemente pero ayuda con el aporte en el hogar siendo necesario que Carmen venda comida para solventar los gastos D. L. universidad. El préstamo es para L. compra D. víveres y sillas para el negocio. L. socia esta ubicada al centro del grupo con chompa color rosada 
El Préstamo es  D. s/. 1000.00 Nuevo Soles
texts.en:
Carmen Maria is a member of the Divino Niño Jesus Communal Bank.  She is 56, and she lives in a rural zone in the Chupaca province.  She is married and has two children.  Marcos is 18, and he attends the university.  Carlos is 12 and in school.  They help their mother prepare different typical dishes.

In the morning they prepare the dishes like stew, quinoa “atamalada” (boiled potato cubes, milk, cheese cubes, salt and finely chopped fresh herbs), “chicharon colorado” (a pork and potato dish), “picante D. cuy” (guinea pig in a spicy sauce), and “chicha D. jora” (a corn based drink), which is maD. from a base of seven grains.

Her husband works independently, but he helps her with the household expenses.  He needs to do this because Carmen sells food in order to pay the university expenses.

The loan is to buy supplies and chairs for the business.  

Carmen appears in the photo with a pink sweater in the center of the group.  Her loan is for 1,000 soles.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur CARMEN MARIA  from  Peru

loans.use: to sell typical food dishes in the area.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 39 years old and married.  She is blessed with two children, aged 6 and 10, who attend school.  To earn a living, she sells second-hand clothes.  She has been running this business for three years.  She also sells soap to earn extra income.

Mary has benefited from Faulu Kenya because she has improved her business. In five years, she hopes to grow her business into wholesale.  She has requested 8,000 Kenyan shillings to buy second-hand clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hilda Yolanda

texts.es:
Hilda Yolanda tiene 35 años, es soltera vive con los padres en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  SAGRADO CORAZON  se encuentra ubicada en el sector Cuatro Esquinas perteneciente al cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 12 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de los mismos y otras actividades que da utilidades.

Hilda se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz además tiene 1 vaca lechera. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos y alimento para el animal. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y salir de viaje.

Le gusta leer libros, tejer ropa de lana y bailar en las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Hilda Yolanda is 35 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province. She does not have children.

The members of the Sacred Heart Communal Bank meet in the sector of Cuatro Esquinas, which is part of the canton of Guaranda and located 15 minutes from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The Communal Bank consists of 12 members who engage in agriculture, livestock breeding, the sale of their products, and other profitable activities.

Hilda is a farmer who grows potatoes, wheat, and corn. She also has one dairy cow. Hilda purchases her supplies at the market in Guaranda and sells her products at the wholesale market in the same city.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her crops and feed for her cow. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges she faces include diseases that could impact her crops. Her dreams include buying land and traveling.

Hilda enjoys reading, making clothes out of wool, and dancing at the year-end parties.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is 45 years old. She sells groceries. Her husband is a chief construction worker and the couple has five children. Three of their children are studying and the other two work in construction with their father. The family income is 7 USD per day. Each month, Pov spends 50 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity, 10 USD on rent, 10 USD on school fees, 20 US on transportation, and 20 USD on other expenses. 

Pov is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to buy more goods to sell. She is strongly committed to sending all of her children to study in the university and she will work hard to get more income to support them.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en: Charlita is a 45-year-old woman who is married and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two grown children. Photo frame-making activity is the family's primary source of income. After five years of creating noticeable photo frame designs, she has managed to reach a total monthly income of PHP 5,000. Charlita craves more production so she has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC to purchase eye-boosting materials for her photo frame-making activity. She has already been connected with GDMPC for one year. Charlita hopes to have a simple showroom in town to promote her products.

loans.use: To purchase eye-boosting materials for her photo frame-making activity.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Many Cambodians make a living as farmers. One of them is Suong, 36, who has been working in this sector since 2005. Presently, she and her husband grow maize and potatoes on farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. Suong is able to generate a daily income of about 3 USD from her business. This humble couple has two dependent children, both of whom are in school. 

The couple planted maize during this growing season but it is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. Therefore, Suong and her husband are requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizer to improve their field. The increase in income from her loan will help to improve the family’s standard of living. Suong is grateful to all of the lenders who are supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Kiova

texts.en:
Kiova is a 27-year-old married woman from Lebanon living with her husband. In order to help with the family expenses, she decided to start working as a private teacher. 

She has been involved in this occupation since 2008, and she gives lessons at student's houses. Today, she is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on her car so that she can make her transportation easier and safer. In the future, she is planning to get a job in a proper school and make her work a stable source of income.

loans.use: to repair her car so that she can make her transportation easier and safer

loans.name: Alicia Del Socorro

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Managua la  señora Alicia del socorro se dedica arduamente a laborar como conserje  en una empresa de esta cuidad  dedicándose  a esta labor desde hace 5años .es casado su núcleo familiar esta compuesto por 4 persona dos de ellos pequeño doña Alicia  quiere proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. 
Una de las necesidades que el señor atraviesa hoy en día es que debe  de hacer un muro alrededor de su vivienda. es por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques,  arena, cemento piedrín para iniciar la mejora de la vivienda realizando  levantamiento de una pared para mayor seguridad de su vivienda .por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos 
Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporciona a su familia una mayor seguridad  y con todas las condiciones necesarias
texts.en:
Alicia Del Socorro works hard as a caretaker in a firm in the city of Managua; she’s been at this job for five years.  She’s married and her nuclear family consists of four people, two of them minors. Alicia wants to provide them with the necessary conditions for their development.

One of the needs she currently has is that she must build a wall around her house and this is the reason why she’s called upon Ceprodel to request a loan to buy building materials and supplies like concrete blocks, sand, cement and gravel to start this home improvement project erecting a wall for better home security.  Through this project she will provide her children with better living conditions.  It’s important to point out that through this project she will provide her family with increased security and with all necessary conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ayawoavi

texts.fr:
Ayawoavi est une femme  âgé(e) de 32 ans. Elle est mariée à un transitaire. Elle a 02 enfants tous à l’école. Le premier a 7 ans et le dernier a 04 ans.  
Ayawoavi travaille comme revendeuse d’habits et trousseaux bébé depuis 1998. Elle vend à la boutique à ses clients.
Ayawoavi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des couches bébé et trousseau. Elle veut investir dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ayawoavi voudrait augmenter le niveau d’activité.
texts.en:
Ayawoavi is a 32-year-old woman who is married to a forwarding agent. She has two children, aged 7 and 4, who both attend school. 

Ayawoavi started selling baby clothing and accessories in 1998. She conducts her sales from her shop. She is seeking a first loan from WAGES to buy baby's wear and diapers. She wants to invest in her business. 

In the coming years, Ayawoavi wishes to bolster her activity.

loans.use: to buy baby's wear and accessories for resale

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en: Jemimah is a hardworking business lady.  She is 22 years old and is married. For the last three years, she has been selling clothes to earn a living. She has grown her business through Faulu Kenya and has managed to employ one person.  In the next 5 years, she wants to become successful in her business. She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Darlene Mae

texts.en:
Darlene Mae is 26 years old and is raising her family in their community. She aims to educate her child and give him a bright future. Despite the hardships of life, she is striving hard to earn income for the improvement of their lives. She has had a sari-sari (variety) store for almost a year and usually earns a profits of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month, which she uses to purchase her family's daily necessities. 

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy soy sauce, vinegar, soft drinks and bread as additional goods to sell. She hopes that through this loan, she can continuously acquire a better income, which will give her family a better future.

loans.use: to buy soy sauce, vinegar, soft drinks, and bread

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.ru:
Лидия замужем, ее дети уже взрослые и самостоятельные. Лидия занимается реализацией красивого женского белья на центральном рынке своего родного города Новомосковска. Ее товар всегда подобран со вкусом для покупателя требовательного к высокому качеству. В этой сфере Лидия работает более 10 лет.  

Лидия планирует использовать кредит в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы купить новые модели белья, а также обновить ассортимент пижам. Она надеется разнообразить свой ассортимент и иметь возможность предлагать товар высокого качества для женщин разных возрастов и с разными предпочтениями. Лидия однозначно предприниматель со вкусом, который находится на своем месте и умеет выбирать и предлагать хороший товар. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Lidiya is married, her children are grown up and independent. Lidiya sells beautiful women's underwear on the central market of her hometown Novomoskovsk. Her merchandise is always tastefully selected for the customer who demands high quality. Lidiya has worked in this field for more than ten years.

Lidiya plans to use the loan in the amount of 15,000 hryvna to buy new styles of underwear and also renew the variety of pajamas. She hopes to add more variety and have an opportunity to offer a merchandise of higher quality to women of all ages and preferences. Lidiya is uniquely a businesswoman with taste who is stationed at her place and can select and offer good products.

loans.use: to buy new styles of underwear and also renew the variety of pajamas.

loans.name: Amivi Mawuena

texts.fr:
Amivi est une femme âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée un Géomètre de profession. Elle a 3 enfants dont 2 scolarisés. Le premier a 10 ans et le dernier 03 mois.
Amivi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle achète et revend des produits d’alimentation générale genres sucres, savons, laits et autres à toutes personnes à son domicile. 
Amivi a requis son premier crédit de  WAGES afin d’acheter et vendre des produit d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir les profits supplémentaires dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Amivi voudrait ouvrir une boutique de vente. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Amivi is a 34-year-old woman. She is married to a land surveyor. She has 3 children, two of whom attend school. The oldest is 10 years old and the youngest is 3 months old.

Amivi has been selling things since 2006. She buys and resells general food products, such as sugar, soap, milk, and other things to people at her house. 

Amivi requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy and sell general food products. She wants to reinvest her supplementary earnings back into her business.

In the coming years, Amivi would like to open a boutique. She says that with her earnings, she plans to contribute to the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy general food items

loans.name: Zoilo Leoncio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TETE CACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Zoilo Leoncio; el tiene 36 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos agroindustriales como harinas, mermeladas y manjares, el socio también se dedica al trabajo en un empresa pública, por medio de este trabajo y este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de productos agroindustriales. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar los productos agroindustriales como frutas y azúcar al por mayor.                    
                         
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Señor de Tete Caca communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member, Zoilo Leoncio, is 36 years old and married with three children.  He alternates his daily activities with his business selling agroindustrial products such as flour, marmalade, and delicacies.  He also works in a public company.  By means of this job and this business he gets his children ahead.  He wants to expand and improve his business selling agroindustrial products.

Zoilo Leoncio is requesting the loan to buy ingredients to make agroindustrial products such as fruit and sugar wholesale.

He is happy about the loan and is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make agroindustrial products such as fruit and sugar wholesale.

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Miraluna has a shop that sells electronic loads (prepaid phone cards) from several networks. She has had this business for 5 years. She is also engaging in networking businesses like UNIGOSYO & PERSONAL CARE. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of electronic loads for sale.

Miraluna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Miraluna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads (prepaid phone cards)

loans.name: Irma Nellys

texts.es: Irma Nellys tiene 56 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa y refrescos. Desde hace tiempo le ha gustado luchar para salir adelante. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos por lo que se siente agradecida pues es por medio de ellos que ha podido mejorar los ingresos de su hogar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes entre otros. Ella realiza sus ventas de manera ambulante, pues es así que puede obtener una gran cantidad de clientes diariamente.
texts.en: Irma Nellys is 56 and she sells clothing and beverages. For some time, she has enjoyed fighting to get ahead. This is not the first time she has received funding for which she is grateful since it has made it possible for her to increase her household income. The purpose of this loan is to buy pants, shirts, skirts and suits among other items.  She is a street seller, since this is the way she is able to attract a large number of customers every day.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts and suits among other items.

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika is 30 year old a married woman. She has five children, all in school. Monika has had her pharmacy in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Monika is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase drugs. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase drugs for sale.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora, de 48 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, además es alegre y sociable. Convive con Víctor quien es pintor, asimismo su vida la comparte a lado de sus tres hijas de 24, 20 y 9 años de edad, a las que quiere bastante, instaladas en su casa propia. El negocio que tiene Dora es la venta de abarrotes en general, contando con una bodega que abrió en su casa iniciándose con un capital, fruto de sus ahorros con su pareja. Es así que lo invirtio, dándole una rotación constante a sus productos, logrando así crecer su negocio y tener una buena clientela. A lo largo de estos 18 años de comercio se siente contenta, además que cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas en la atención a los clientes cuando ella está fuera de casa. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar cerca de su familia, así como el tiempo libre que le deja para ocuparlo en otras actividades, asimismo el ingreso económico que le sirve para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Sin embargo no le gusta cuando sus clientes se retrasan en el pago de sus créditos, pero ella sabe que eso no debe perjudicar sus obligaciones con MFP. Además viendo la buena acogida que tiene su negocio desea continuar y mantenerlo. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus integrantes ser personas puntuales con sus obligaciones de pago. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como abarrotes en general al por mayor para surtir su negocio, pues considera que con mayor variedad tendrá mayor preferencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dora, age 48, is a hard-working and dynamic woman. She is also happy and sociable. She lives in her own home with Victor, who is a painter, and their three beloved daughters ages 9, 20 and 24. Dora runs a grocery store in her home using money that she and her partner had saved up. She invested this money in the business, and constantly rotates her products. This way, her business is growing and she has a good customer base. She has been in business for 18 years and is happy. Her daughters help out with the business when she is out. She enjoys her business because it allows her to be close to her family. It also gives her free time for other activities, and her income supports her partner with the household costs. However, she does not like it when her customers are late with payments, but she knows that this should not affect her obligations to MFP.
Furthermore, since her business is popular, she wants to continue it and keep it up. This will be her fifth loan with MFP, and she hopes for your collaboration so that she can continue toward her goals. She tells us that she feels good about her communal bank, because the members are punctual with their payments. With the requested 1500 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in the wholesale purchase of merchandise such as groceries to stock her business. She feels that her customers will be happier with greater variety to choose from.

loans.use: to buy a variety of basic staples to stock her business.

loans.name: Bolo

texts.fr:
Madame Bolo  est une femme très active et très brave  âgée de  62 ans. Elle exerce le commerce depuis  22 ans .Elle est marié et mère de cinq enfants dont  l’ainé est âgé de 40 ans et le cadet  de 15 ans. 
Son activité consiste à vendre des fruits : orange, pomme, banane et d’autres fruits de la période.
Avec le prêt elle va acheter des fruits et de l’arachide qu’elle transforme en cacahuètes. Elle est pris en charge par ses enfants ce qui lui permet de réinvestir  son bénéfice dans l’ activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bolo, age 62, is very energetic and brave. She's been a merchant for 22 years. She's married and the mother of five children, age 15 to 40.

Her business consists in selling fruits: oranges, apples, bananas, and other seasonal fruits.

With her loan, she will buy fruits and peanuts. Her children provide for her, which enables her to reinvest her profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and peanuts

loans.name: Lorienza

texts.en: Lorienza is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. Lorienza has operated a retail shop for 5 years, buying and selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Lorienza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a married man, age 42, with 6 children.  Four attend school in different areas. He lives in a rural setting with his family. He deals in farming and cattle keeping, which he considers as his side income; he started his business in 1990.

He works six days a week and started a business to get enough food and capital for the family. 

He has acquired this loan for cattle fattening and buying of fertilizer for the banana plantation.  He said his clients are traders from cities and people in his village.

His hopes are to be the leading supplier of bananas and cattle products, and to educate his children. 

He faces challenges of too much drought and lack of enough capital, which affects the productivity rate which in turn affects his income growth.

He is a hard working man.In the photo is the client (on the right )and the Ugafode credit credit Officer.

loans.use: To buy cattle and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 38 years old and married to Stonard, who is a farmer. She has four children who go to school and she also looks after school-going orphans. She runs a market stall selling dry fish and is requesting this loan from Kiva lenders to buy fish in large quantities to reach more customers in her neighborhood.

Florence started her business to reduce poverty levels for her family and to be self-reliant. Her plans are to open a grocery store and send her children to private schools when she makes enough profits. Since she started receiving loans she has seen her business growing bigger and she believes that the training she received in ‘Market Research’ will assist her to achieve what she wants from her business. As a woman she is able to feed her family three meals a day and she is independent.

loans.use: to buy fish in large quantities.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline earns a living through her clothing sales. She sees to have enough inventories to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied a loan to purchase more clothing inventories to sell. Evangeline hopes to live comfortably with her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventories to sell

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 23-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child. She is a housewife only taking care of her child and her husband is covering their needs. He owns a motorcycles shop in his town where he sells and repairs motorcycles. Due to the hard financial situation, she is in need to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l to pay the school fees. She said that she is very happy and eager always to borrow additional loans to help her children continue their education suitably

loans.use: to pay the school fees.

loans.name: Pak

texts.en:
M. Pak is living in the house were she was born, in Kandal province, not far from Phnom Penh, with her 6 children. Her husband is a moto taxi, while she is selling food to the factory workers in her neighborhood. She gets up early in the morning to cook and begins selling around ten for the first break in the factories. In the afternoon, her husband brings her to the market. Four of her children are helping her in this business and the two remaining are employed in the factories. The five of them make around $5 profit out of $25 daily sale.

For her first loan with CREDIT, she is requesting a $500 loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband. She will sell the old one, which is breaking down often and costs much in reparations.

M. Pak is a cautious person; her first concern would be to save a little money for the rainy days. She is also thinking about expanding her business with her next CREDIT loans.

loans.use: Buying a new motorbike

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes has been selling ceviches door to door for a year. She decided to found this small business because she could do it at home, with her children’s involvement. With 50 dollars she had saved from her previous job she bought the ingredients and some utensils. She works in the business Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from 4 am to 9 am. Her children help her, one by cooking, the other by delivering and a third takes the orders. She works entirely in cash.

She needs this loan to buy pots and plastic containers in which to deliver the orders, and a pair of tables to place in her house.

Mercedes is 46 years old, a single mother with 3 sons. For 10 years she has been solely responsible for her children because her husband abandoned her. Since she was 10 years old she has worked as a nanny, a cook and a housecleaner. She currently works Monday through Friday mornings cooking in her home, which is her other source of income. Her aspiration is to improve her house, which is completely of cane, with a dirt floor. Her greatest satisfaction is seeing her children in school and knowing that they will soon finish their studies. She does not know how to read or write. She wishes to continue with her business because she sees that it has generated additional income and most importantly because her children help her.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Mercedes tiene 1 año vendiendo ceviches a domicilio. Ella decidió poner este pequeño negocio porque lo podía hace en casa y que sus hijos se involucren. Con un pequeño capital de $ 50 dólares que había ahorrado de su trabajo arranco para comprar los alimentos y ciertos utensilios. El negocio lo atiende los días viernes, sábado y domingo solo por la mañana de 4:00AM hasta 9:00AM. Sus hijos la ayudan uno cocina, otro entrega y otro va ha tomar los pedidos de los ceviches. Todo es al contado. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar: ollas y plásticos (tarrinas) para poder entregar los pedidos y comprar un par de mesas y ubicarlas en su casa. Mercedes tiene 46 años. Con 3 hijos. Es madre soltera. Desde hace 10 años ha estado a cargo de sus hijos porque su esposo la abandono. Desde los 10 años ella ha trabajado de: niñera, cocinando, limpiando casa, Actualmente trabaja de lunes a viernes por la mañana cocinando en casa estos son otros ingresos para ella. Su aspiración es mejorar su casa que es de caña totalmente que no tiene piso y vive sobre la tierra. Su satisfacción más grande es ver que sus hijos están en el colegio y que pronto van a terminar sus estudios. Ella no sabe leer ni escribir Ella desea seguir con su negocio porque ve que ha generado otros ingresos y lo más importante es que sus 3 hijos la ayuda.

loans.use: Buy pots, plastic containers and tables.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Sharifa, daughter of Abdullah Khan, was born in 1953. She is married and her family counts 6 people and lives in district 8 of Kabul. She is an illiterate women because when she was young girls were not allowed to go to school. She has a bead works business and through that she solves some of her financial problems. She started her business with limited resources and few materials because she didn't have enough money at that time to purchase more materials for her business. Therefore, her production was small and she could not make much income from her business. She was thinking about ways to expand her business when she heard about the loan process and decided to take a loan. She used her loans in a good way,  resulting in her business expanding, production increasing and sales improving. Sharifa has finished 3 loan cycles and now she is in her 4th cycle. She is happy with the loans and wants to continue with it because the loans had a positive impact in her business.

loans.use: Buying beads, fabric, string, needles...etc

loans.name: Erlinda Juana

texts.es:
Erlinda is 28 years old and is married with two children. Her husband works in a clothes shop. She belongs to the group ’10 D. abril’ and she sells cosmetic products from house to house in her community. With the loan she wants to increase her earnings by buying more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

ERLINDA TIENE 28 AÑOS ES CASADA CON 2 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO EMPLEADO EN UNA TIENDA D. ROPA.ELL. PERTENECE AL GRUPO 10 D. ABRIL 4 Y TRABAJA VENDIENDO PRODUCTOS COSMETICOS D. CASA EN CASA ENTRE LAS PERSONAS D. L. COMUNIDAD . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA AUMENTAR SUS INGRESOS COMPRANDO MAS MERCADERIA

loans.use: To sell cosmetics/VENTA DE COSMETICOS

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa Q. P. makes lunches every day for the workers at a factory in her town. Each day she and her business partner (another member of the same Friendship Bridge women's group) prepare hot food for the men and then set up outside the factory gates when the men start to break for lunch. They sell a good, simple, hot lunch for about US$1.00. On a normal day they'll sell about 24 lunches. Felipa started the business just 6 months ago with her first Friendship Bridge loan. As before, she'll use the loan as working capital to buy the food she needs to prepare the lunches.

Felipa is 41 and is married with six kids aged 3 to 23. Her husband is an electrician. The kids that should be are all in school, but Felipa never went, and can't read or sign her name, so she signs the loan papers with a thumbprint. The family's health is generally good, but her husband has enormous headaches that keep him from work some of the time. Felipa's simple dream is that she wants to prosper more so she can support the kids and keep them in school.

The pictures shows Felipa with her youngest daughter. It was too late in the day to take a picture with her at her stand.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase the food needed to make lunch for the factory workers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Having access to liquid capital in order to buy more waste material.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. is 38 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Mercy sells many different kinds of creams. This is a business she started in 2004. She is in need of $475 so she can buy more creams to sell.

loans.use: To buy creams for sale
